loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 59-year-old married woman from Garcia, Bohol. She has seven grown children. She has been operating a sari-sari or variety store business for 10 years now. Usually, she earns 4,000 PHP a month. This is the source of her income and provides for the rest of the needs of her family.

Rosario is requesting a loan to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, milo, milk, noodles, detergents, toiletries, candies, coffee, and spices. These items will help her to earn more profit. Through this loan, she will be able to buy such items and sell it in her store.

In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business and to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, milo, milk, noodles, detergents, toiletries, candies, coffee and spices.

loans.name: Saliadeen

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Saliadeen.  He is married and has four children, aged 10, 8, 7, and 5 years, all of them school-going children. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to provide care for his children.

In 2007, Saliadeen established his business, selling clothing and other cloth items, like jeans, polos, undershirts, boxers, school bags, towels, and children’s dresses. He began his business while he attended Arabic school, because of the perception of his father about English education.  He was previously engaged in farming with his father.  When he was fully grown he farmed on his own for two years, and then he used the profits from farming to start selling used clothing, which has now developed into a shop.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,050,000 every month from this business.

Saliadeen would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy jeans, shirts, undershirts, boxers, nappies (diapers), school bags, and towels. In the future, Saliadeen plans to build another house, educate his children and open another shop.  This loan will help to achieve some of his future plans. He is a hard-working and trustworthy business man.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his shop, such as jeans, shirts, undershirts, boxers, nappies (diapers), school bags, and towels.

loans.name: Mbetsa

texts.en:
Mbetsa is 50 years old and married with two children. She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. She works very hard to provide for her family.
She runs a general store in her town Kaloleni and has requested a loan of KSH 50,000 to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store; oil, wheat and maize flour, sugar, salt and washing materials. She has been in this business for more than four years.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store; oil,wheat and maize flour, sugar, salt and washing materials.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. She is married and they have three children who attend school. Her major monthly expenditure is school payments.
Mariam has a grocery stall selling fruits and vegetables at the market. She has a fixed customer base, good income, good business and personal references. She is a hardworking woman and an excellent client.

She requested a loan of KSH 20,000 to buy sacks of vegetables and sacks of potatoes. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of vegetables and sacks of potatoes for her grocery stall.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a 46-year-old woman and lives in the Mtskheta district. She is married and has two grown children who are unemployed at the moment. Her husband is 50 years old and he works as workman in the capital city and has a small monthly income. Nana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. She has an empty space in her village and plans to open a grocery shop there. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-starts up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. Nana requested a loan for purchasing stocks of groceries which will help her to start her grocery store. She will reinvest the profits into the shop and will keep adding more products. Nana hopes this project will be profitable and it will help her and her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for starting her grocery store.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Osman.  He is single and has two children, aged 2 and 4 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to receive his help so she can go to school.

In 2001, Osman established his Patented Drugs business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant, after coming from the village. His business is located in the city center, and his customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 978,700 every month from this business.

Osman would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. He requires a loan in order to have an increase in stock. He hopes that this loan will support him to improve his business. In the future, Osman plans to see his business grow to a large drug store.  He said thanks to Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To buy medicines for his pharmacy

loans.name: Armando Efrain

texts.es:
El Sr. Armando vive en Guayaquil. El es militar en servicio pasivo luego de salir de las filas del ejército decidió adquirir un negocio propio por lo que se compró un taxi. Esta labor la realiza solo a diario en su taxi.
Teme a la delincuencia ya que los ladrones que se suben al taxi abundan y las zonas en donde trabaja son lugares muy peligrosos.Teme que le vayan hacer algo ya que si al él le sucede algo sus hijos y su esposa se quedarian solos; su familia es su fuerza su aliento para alcanzar lo que quiere.

Está casado su esposa le ayuda en los quehaceres domésticos, tiene tres hijos uno de 6 años, otro de 10 años y el ultimo de 12 años de edad todos juntos estudian en una escuela fiscal. 

Armando desea que sus hijos sigan adelante con sus estudios y que no les haga falta nada. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar uniformes y útiles escolares para sus hijos ya que estan por estar al colegio (en la foto esta Armando, su esposa y sus tres hijos). Y así darles un mejor bienestar de educación social.
texts.en:
Sr. Armando lives in Guayaquil. He was in the military reserves, but later left the service so that he could acquire his own business. Armando bought a taxi and now he works every day by himself.

His main concern is crime since he works in very dangerous places where robbers could climb into his taxi. He is also afraid of his wife and children being able to take care of themselves should something happen to him. However, his family provides him the strength that needs to pursue the goals that he wants to achieve.

Armando is married and his wife helps with the household chores. They have three children (ages 6, 10, and 12), all of whom attend a state school. For this reason, Armando is requesting a loan in order to buy uniforms and school supplies for his children since they are already back in school. (Armando appears in the photo with his wife and three children.) He wants to provide them with a better education.

loans.use: to buy uniforms and school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 34 years old with two children. She is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a grocery stall in Kaloleni. She is requesting a loan of KSH 20,000 to purchase more groceries, sacks of potatoes and onions to sell in her store.
She is grateful for the opportunity. She hopes her business will continue improving and soon her family’s living standards will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries, sacks of potatoes and onions to sell in her store.

loans.name: Emman

texts.en: Emman, 31 years old and single, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental where, for over four years, he has owned and operated a motorcycle transport service, earning 25,000 PHP every month. Emman joined GDMPC in 2009  and is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to repair his bike and purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his bike and purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Fikiria

texts.en:
Fikiria is a 38-year-old lady living in Kaloleni, Kenya. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives together with her husband and children, in a house they built six years ago. Her major monthly expenditure is school payments.

She has a charcoal stall, where she sells charcoal and firewood. She has approached Yehu for a loan amounting to KES 20,000, which she will use to buy twenty sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy twenty sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Kabba

texts.en: This is 49-year-old Kabba. He is married and has 4 children aged 12, 9, 6 and 4 months old. 3 going to school. In 2010, Kabba established his business selling plastic shoes for men, women and children. He attended school up to Class 5 and dropped out because of poverty. His father took him to a garage to learn vehicle maintenance and upon completion he joined his sister in business. After some years, his sister gave him an amount of money to start his own business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 965,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Kabba requires a loan in order to buy assorted plastic shoes and slippers. In the future, Kabba plans to buy a vehicle, build a house, educate his children, open a shop and send his parents to Hajj.  This loan will help to expand his business. He is a hardworking and committed businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for assorted plastic shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Ishmail

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Ishmail.  He is married and has two children, a school-going ten-year-old child and a five-month-old baby. He has three additional dependents, one who is a school-going child he is helping and two who help with domestic work. 

In 2005, Ishmail established his clothing business. After attaining his Ordinary Level education certificate he joined his elder brother in this business. He had wanted to go to college but was not able to for lack of financial support. He and his brother worked in the trade together for years, until Ishmail set up his own business.  

Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,100,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Ishmail requires a loan in order to purchase jeans, shoes, t-shirts, sneakers, Lacoste shirts, and football jerseys. 

In the future, Ishmail plans to expand his business, set up a cosmetics store and educate his children. He is a hardworking and competitive businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more jeans, shoes, t-shirts and football jerseys

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Ibrahim. He is married and has five children, aged 21, 20, 18, 15 and 10 years; three are school-going children. In 2002, Ibrahim established his food (rice, onions, sugar, and salt) business. He began his business because he came from a poor background. He was not able to finish his secondary education; he then decided to join his brother who was a trader. They traded from place to place until he set up his own business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 537,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to purchase bags of rice, sugar, salt and onions. In the future, Ibrahim plans to educate his school-going children and develop his business. Competition is his main challenge. The loan will help him achieve his dream because it will enable him to buy more stock for his growing business. He is hardworking and committed to his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more bags of rice, onions, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Ishaka

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Ishaka. He is married and has one child, a four-month-old baby. He has two additional dependents, his wife's relatives who are living with them while they attend school.  

In 2008, Ishaka established his business selling mobile phone accessories and drinks. He began his business because they were living with his parents in the mining areas, and when the war broke out, his parents did not have enough money to send him back to school in addition to caring for his younger siblings. He decided to join his uncle who is a businessman.  

Working seven days a week and fourteen hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,404,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Ishaka requires a loan in order to purchase mobile chargers, headphones, earphones, mobile covers, mobile batteries, pure water and soft drinks. 

In the future, Ishaka plans to open another outlet. The loan will help because he will be able to buy in large quantities, procuring goods to meet his customers’ demands. Changes in price of products to meet the customers’ demands is his main challenge.  He is hardworking and committed to his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more phones and drinks

loans.name: Neneh

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Neneh. She is married and has three children ages 26, 21 and 19. Two are school-going children. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to be fostered.  

In 2004, Neneh established her business selling lace, waxed cotton material, chains, earrings, madam bags, travelling boxes and such products. She began her business as she did not attend school because of her parents’ perception about female education. She was only introduced to domestic work at home and business. When she got married her husband gave her some money to start business.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,125,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Neneh requires a loan in order to buy more inventory of madam bags, travelling boxes, chains, lace and waxed cotton material. 

In the future, Neneh plans to build another house, educate her children and open another shop.  The loan will help to improve the business and generate more income. There is high competition where she is selling, but she overcomes competitors by having good customer care skills. She is a hardworking and trustworthy businesswoman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy madam bags, travelling boxes, chains, lace and waxed cotton material

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr: Céline est une  femme de 58 ans mariée, mère de 7 enfants. elle est commerçante depuis 20 ans déjà dans un marché de la place ou elle commercialise le couscous (manioc et maïs). elle a de l'expérience en la matière et se debrouille assez bien. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour se déplacer et allez acheter sa marchandise à des prix bas et en grande quantité dans les villages. Ce qui lui permettra d'agrandir son activité et surtout de réaliser un bon bénéfice. profit qui l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'épargner pour les besoins futurs comme la scolaritée.
texts.en: Céline is a 58-year-old married mother of seven children. She has been a merchant for 20 years already at a market in her area, where she sells couscous (manioc and maize). She has gained experience in her field and manages quite well. She is seeking this loan to get around and buy her merchandise at low prices and in bulk in the villages. This will allow her to expand her business and especially earn higher profits. The profits from her business will allow her to provide for her family and save for future needs such as school expenses.

loans.use: To expand her stock of couscous.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her stock of fish.

loans.name: Irembo Group

texts.fr:
Cassilde fait partie du groupe  Irembo et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 47 ans et est mariée à Laurent, un commerçant.  Ensemble ils ont 6  enfants  âgés de  8 à 20 ans,  tous étudient.
Elle prend soins de  4 orphelins qui étudient.

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait voir ses enfants étudier et parvenir à nourrir la famille et, payer le loyer.
texts.en:
Cassilde belongs to the "Irembo" group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 47 years old and married to Laurent, a merchant. Together, they have six children, whose ages range from 8 to 20, and all of whom are students.
She takes care of four orphans who are students.
She has run a business selling clothes for 20 years.
She is on her fourth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy lots of clothing for resale in order to earn more.
In the coming years, she would like to see her children study and be able to feed the family and pay the rent.

loans.use: To increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothing for resale in order to earn more.

loans.name: Aubery

texts.fr:
AUBERY est un jeune homme âgé de 34 ans qui, comme activité gère un secrétariat-cyber café dans un quartier de la ville depuis 05 ans déjà. il y vend également le petit matériel informatique (accessoires d'ordinateurs). il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter les accessoires d'ordinateurs, les rames de papiers, etc... pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin d'augmenter ses capacités de vente. 
avec ses connaissances en maintenance informatique, il a pour ambition d'ouvrir un grand atelier.
texts.en:
Aubery is a young man, aged 34, who has run a secretarial office-cyber cafe in an area of the city for five years so far. He also sends small computer equipment (computer accessories). With this loan, he would like to buy computer accessories, reams of paper, etc. to strengthen his stock of merchandise in order to expand his sales capacity.
With his knowledge of computer maintenance, his ambition is to open a large workshop.

loans.use: To buy computer equipment.

loans.name: Allan Rogerd

texts.es:
El sr. Allan  vive en Guayaquil, tiene 31 años .Empezó su negocio como ayudante luego fue aprendiendo como se utiliza la pintada de vehículos, actualmente se dedica a este negocio le gusta como labora y se ha hecho como un hobbies.

El solo trabaja de 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, el negocio es de encerada y pintada.
La dificultad para él es la delincuencia y su enfermedad la cual no le permite laborar con normalidad .El cliente no está casado tampoco tiene hijos  es soltero.

Su sueño es poder tener un taller propio, casarse, poder tener hijos, ser cada día más responsable, constribuir con su situación económica en el hogar y permanecer bien de salud. Con el prestamo quiere comprar pinturas y heramientas para pintar mas vehiculos y asi poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Allan, 31, lives in Guayaquil.  He started in this line of business as an assistant, and later he learned how to paint vehicles.  He now has his own business, and he enjoys the work so much, it's almost like a hobby for him.

Allan works from 9am until 5pm in his paint and wax shop.  The main difficulties he faces are crime and the illness he suffers from, which prevents him from working normally.  Allan is not married; he is single and has no children.

Allan dreams of: being able to have his own workshop, getting married and having children, becoming every day more responsible, improving his financial situation and remaining in good health.  With this loan, he wants to buy paint and tools so that he can paint more vehicles and in this way accomplish his dreams.

loans.use: to buy paint and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bee hives

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Ruth.  She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 3 years, and one is a school-going child. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to assist her in domestic work, and also to be fostered.

In 2009, Ruth established her business, after having completed her tertiary education. She decided to engage in a business, the experience of which she had gotten from her mother, and which she believed would be profitable. Her mother gave her the capital to start a business selling groundnuts. The business has since grown to include selling pure water and soft drinks. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,805,000 every month from this business.

Ruth would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more pure water and soft drinks to resell. Ruth plans to educate her children, open a shop, build a house, and become an international business woman, in the future.  The loan will improve the business. Inadequate capital, and slow sales in the rainy season, are her major challenges. She is a hard-working and trustworthy businesswoman.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more pure water and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Fatmata. She is married and has one three-year-old child, who is a school-going child. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to be fostered.  

In 2010, Fatmata established her business selling paracetamol tablets, blood tonic, vitamins, baby food, ORS, pain relief, glucose and other products. She was introduced to the business by her foster parents, and when she got married her husband helped her establish the business.  

Working six days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,112,5000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more paracetamol tablets, blood tonic, pain relief tablets, vitamins tablets, ampiclox and flagyl tablets. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to build a house, educate her child and further her nursing courses. This loan will help to increase stock and profit.  Inadequate capital is her major challenge. She is hardworking and trustworthy businesswoman  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 43 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a retired teacher and they live together in Kaloleni, Kenya. Her major monthly expenditure is food.

She owns a stall where she buys and sells coconuts. She has requested a loan of KSH 30,000 to buy sacks of coconut to re-sell in the nearby town of Mombasa. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coconut to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food stocks to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 25 years old. He is a dairy farmer, and has been in business for two years. He is a very hard-working man, and describes his business as very fertile. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save for the future.  Someday, he hopes to be a very successful businessman and to have a herd of cattle. 

He requires a loan of 42,728 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, a 34-year-old married father of two children, has been operating a tailoring shop for three years. He is also a contractor in another firm. A very hardworking man, Patrick believes success belongs to only those who are willing to work harder than anyone else.

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business and is now requesting a loan of 74,014 KES to buy fabric. Patrick hopes to someday be a very rich man and have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is 37 years old, married and a father of five children. For the last 13 years, he has earned a living by operating a general store in Malindi. He earns a monthly income of KES 23,600 from the business and his business is doing well.

He is applying for his third loan of KES 80,000 to buy additional stock for his general store such as soft drinks, stationery, cooking oil and wheat flour to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his children's school fees as well as expand the business. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that he may uplift his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, cooking oil and stationery for sale.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en: Mirriam is a 40-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from two to four years. She describes herself to be a principled and humble woman. She operates a retail store where she sells toiletries. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of toiletries. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy toiletries to sell. Her business goal is to run a bigger retail shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy toiletries.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a 34-year-old lady who is married with two children. She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya and owns a shop where she sells brooms. She has been doing this for the last five years, which has helped her to gain experience and attain a wide variety of consumers.

She has requested a loan of KSH 20,000 to buy more brooms to stock to re-sell. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy more brooms to sell

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 43 years old. She is from Kakamega County, in the western part of Kenya. She has seven children between the ages of three and 20 years old.

Millicent sells second-hand clothing and curtains. The business has been running smoothly for the last seven years. She is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to pay school fees and also to buy more stocks of clothing to sell. She has a plan to grow her business into a big one so she can educate her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees and to also buy more stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 43-year-old married lady with two children.  Both of her children are in school.  She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya.  Her major monthly expenditure is school fees.  

She owns a retail shop where she sells home based goods, and she has been doing this for the last two years.  She is requesting a loan amounting to KES 20000 to restock her shop with detergents, cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: to restock her shop with detergents, cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 40-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 4 to 16 years old. He describes himself to be social and passionate. He operates a motorcycle where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the stiff competition within the area. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a motorcycle with the addition of the motorcycle. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of KES 20,000, which he repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: La Clé De David Group

texts.fr: LA CLÉ DE DAVID est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des cohabitants. La représentante du groupe, Sophie Akouavi est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Sophie Akouavi est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à Michel. Sophie Akouavi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sophie Akouavi et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Sophie Akouavi assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Sophie Akouavi vend des fruits et de l’huile d'arachide dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Sophie Akouavi et les autres membres du groupe LA CLÉ DE DAVID sollicitent pour une sixième fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group “La clé de David” [The Key of David] is a group composed of three individuals living in the same house. The group’s representative, Sophie Akouavi, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Sophie Akouavi is 35 years old; her husband’s name is Michel. Sophie Akouavi never attended school. She and her husband have four dependent children, all in school. Sophie Akouavi and her husband live together with their children, and jointly provide for household needs. Sophie Akouavi sells fruits and peanut oil at a market in Benin. This business allows her to provide for her and her children’s needs without major issues. Sophie Akouavi and the other members of her group seek financial support from ALIDé for the sixth time, in order to strengthen their business and better meet customer expectations. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fruits and some jugs of peanut oil.

loans.name: Sento

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Sento.  She is married and has four children who are 4, 8, 13 and 20. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to assist with the house chores.  In 2002, Sento established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband who is a miner in taking care of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. She has repaid one loan. Sento requires a loan in order to buy more dresses for resale. She hopes that this loan will help to improve the business by getting more stock. In the future, Sento plans to open a shop and to improve her profit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for shoes, dresses, pants, earrings, and chains.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Doreen has been working hard to manage her dry food business where she sells beans. 

To help expand her business, Doreen has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy stock of  beans, rice and maize flour to sell and will help Doreen to generate greater profits and pay tuition for her children. Doreen hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy land. 

Doreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy beans, rice and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Margarette

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Margarette. She is married and has four children ages five, six and fourteen. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to assist with the house chores.  

In 1995, Margarette established her textiles business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. 

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, Margarette earns about SLL 2,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of  SLL 5,000,000. She has paid three loans in the past. Margarette requires a loan in order to buy more lace material, batik, and siphon for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the business by getting more stock. 

In the future, Margarette plans to open a shop and to improve the business' profit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for textiles

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
Zakia's group is comprised of 3 hard-working women. Zakia is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Zakia has been working hard to manage her cassava business. 

To help expand her business, Zakia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve the business. By buying more fresh food to sell, Zakia hopes to generate greater profits to pay for medical expenses and school fees. Zakia hopes that, in the future, she will be able to improve the family's standard of living. 

Zakia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food to sell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 44-year-old married lady living in Kaloleni, Kenya. She and her husband have three children. She owns a cafe where she prepares and sells food to customers. 

Saumu is a hardworking entrepreneur. She wakes up very early in the morning to prepare for the meals. She has approached Kiva's field partner with a loan request totaling to KES 20,000 to buy food ingredients, including wheat flour, sacks of sugar and a sack of potatoes. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients, including wheat flour, sacks of sugar and a sack of potatoes

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael  is a 29-year-old married man. He describes himself as an industrious man. He operates a motorcycle  where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located at a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Raphael describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent traffic jams. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruit to start up a new grocery store. His business goal is to buy another motorcycle which will expand his business and create job opportunities  within five years. In addition, Raphael runs a retail shop where he is helped by his wife.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit to start up a new a grocery store

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 44 years old and a farmer. He is married to Elizabeth. They are blessed with three children. Simon has been farming as his primary business and running an electronics shop as a secondary business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES. 18,000 which he uses to support his family. 

Simon is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD. Simon will use the loan to buy chicken feed. With the anticipated profit from the farm he will invest more on his project. 

His hopes and dreams are to venture into a new business.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Beatrice is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married  and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her boutique which sells materials and clothes. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand her stock of clothes for sale, and will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and help buy more products for sale. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big business. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to expand her stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Kapicha

texts.en: Kapicha is 32 years old, a hardworking entrepreneur. She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya with her husband and her two children. She owns a food cafe where she prepares and sells food. Her major customers are nearby residents and students of Kaloleni secondary school. She has requested a loan totaling Ksh. 20,000 to buy firewood, sacks of charcoal, and food ingredients like cooking oil. She is grateful for the opportunity to take out a loan.

loans.use: to buy firewood, sacks of charcoal, and food ingredients like cooking oil

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a 26-year-old married woman. She has a child who is three years old. She describes herself to be a hard-working woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items and clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Petronila describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy household items and clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy household items and clothes to sell

loans.name: Joel Arturo

texts.es: Joel de 37 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Él se dedica desde ya hace mucho tiempo al cultivo de maíz y frijol, siendo este su principal fuente de ingresos ya que en las épocas de poco cultivo trabaja como jornalero para poder tener ingresos extra y así no dejar de llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar. Joel se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, humilde y responsable,  además de ser conocido por vender productos de buena calidad, es por eso que año con año pone su mayor esfuerzo en sus cultivos ya que su clientela siempre espera lo mejor de él. Es por eso que se acercó a las agencias de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito que le ayude a la compra de todos los insumos necesarios para poder llevar acabo una nueva siembra, tales como abono, pesticidas, semillas, etc. y de esta forma poder generar los ingresos necesarios para poder darle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Joel is 37 years old. He lives in his own home together with his wife and children. For a long time he has earned his living growing maize and beans, this being his principal source of income. At times of low crops he works as a day labourer so that he can have some extra income and continue to bring food to his humble home. 

Joel is hard-working, humble and responsible man and is known for selling high-quality products. Every year he puts more effort into his crop cultivation since his customers always expect the highest standard from him. For this reason he approached the INTEGRAL agency to ask for a loan to help him to buy all of the ingredients he needs to sow this year's crops, such as manure, pesticides, seeds etc and in this way he can generate all of the income  necessary to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides, seeds etc.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Vilma de 51 años de edad, vive junto a su grupo familiar en una vivienda de su propiedad. Se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como el maíz y frijol y cuando le queda tiempo vende ropa aunque su profesion es der agricultora.Desde ya hace un tiempo ejerce esta profesion siendo esta su principal fuente de ingresos, pone su mejor esfuerzo en lo que produce para darle a sus clientes un producto de buena calidad. Vilma es una mujer trabajadora, honrada y responsable que tiene como objetivo sacar a delante a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que sus vecinos, amigos y clientela siempre dan buenas referencias de ella. Es por este motivo y por la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia que se animo a pedir un crédito a INTEGRAL  que le ayude a cumplir el sueño de ayudar a su familia, dicho crédito le servirá para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, abono, pesticida, etc. que le son necesarios para poder producir una cosecha mejor que los años anteriores y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de buenos productos a su clientela.
texts.en:
Vilma, 51, lives with her family in her own home. She farms basic grains, like corn and beans. When she has time, she sells clothes although her primary occupation is farming. She has been a farmer for a long time. Since is this is her main source of income, she dedicates her best efforts to produce good quality products for her customers. 

Vilma is a hard-working, honest and responsible woman whose goal is to get her family ahead and provide them with a better quality of life. This is why her neighbors, friends and customers always give good references of her. 

In order to get her family ahead, she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL [MFI] that will help her realize her dream of providing a better quality of life for her family. This loan will help her buy agricultural inputs, such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, etc. which are necessary to produce a better harvest than in years past. In doing so, she can continue to provide her customers with good products.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, such as seed, fertilizer, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Kamakei

texts.en:
Kamakei is 28 years old, married to Tonye and has been blessed with two children who are`three and one years old, respectively. He is a livestock keeper in the Nkareta area and has been in livestock farming for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He is servicing his third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to add to his animals numbers and build the family a better house. His future dream is to prosper and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattenning and resale

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, 35 years old, is married with two children whom she lives with together with her husband in Kaloleni, Kenya. Her husband is a farmer, and they help each other to provide for the family.

She owns a fish stall; she buys fish from fishermen and resells the fish after frying them. She is requesting a loan totaling 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a refrigerator to keep her fish fresh. She is grateful for the help and hopes this will help avoid losses.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep her fish fresh.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 45 years old and married with children, all of whom are in school. He lives in Kaloleni, Kenya with his wife and their children. He is a hardworking entrepreneur who always has the desire to fulfill his dreams. He has a business buying and selling goals and cattle. He has requested a loan of KSH 20,000 to buy goats to fatten and sell. He is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy goats to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en: Sammy is a 44-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 12 to 18 years old. He describes himself to be hard working. He operates a retail stall where he sells plastic items and clothes. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in a potential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the shortage of plastic items and clothes to sell . He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy plastic items and clothes. His business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes and plastic items

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe de 33 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él se dedica  al cultivo y comercio de maíz, posee una ventaja ya que comercializa en tiendas de mayoreo sus cosechas y gracias a Dios vende en abundancia. Cada año repite esta actividad, siembra la semilla, recoge su cosecha y luego pone  a la venta una parte y otra la deja para consumo.  Esta es su principal fuente de ingresos y es así como se gana la vida día con día para ayudar a su familia. Felipe se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honesto y muy responsable. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de él y confían en el producto que comercializa es por eso que tomo la decisión de visitar las oficinas de  INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar los principales insumos agrícolas como son semillas, insecticidas, abonos, etc. y continuar así cultivando la tierra para cosechar el producto  que le permita llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Confía en Dios y su trabajo que obtendrá muy buenos resultados  y podrá lograr su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe, 33, lives in his own house with his family. He farms and sells corn to wholesale stores which is to his advantage since he sells in large quantities. Every year, he plants the seeds, picks up the harvest and then he sells a portion while leaving some for personal consumption. This is his main source of income to help his family on a daily basis. 

Felipe is known for being a hard worker, honest and very responsible. Many people give good references of him and trust the product that he sells. He decided to visit the office of INTEGRAL [MFI] to request a loan for purchasing the main agricultural inputs, such as seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, etc. This will help him to continue farming the land for harvesting allowing him to provide for his family on a daily basis. He trusts in God and his work that he will achieve very good results and realize his dream of providing a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy main agricultural inputs, such as seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo  en su vivienda propia. Ella se gana la vida de la manera que mejor sabe hacer y esta es cultivando maíz y frijol, actividad en la que tiene una gran experiencia y por la cual se ha ganado mucho respeto y admiración de su familia y amigos. María es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora ella tiene un sueño y es el de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, es por eso que se acercó a una agencia de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito que le ayude a comprar abono, semillas, fertilizante y demás insumos que le sirvan para poder seguir con su objetivo de ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 56 years old and lives with her spouse in their own home. She makes a living doing what she knows best, that is, growing corn and beans. She has a lot of experience in farming, and as such has gained a lot of respect and admiration from her family and friends. 

Maria is an entrepreneurial woman who is responsible and hard-working. She has a dream, which is to give her family a better standard of living. It is for this reason that she approached a branch of Integral to ask for a loan to help her buy manure, seeds, fertilizer and other supplies. These will help her continue to pursue her goal of helping her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer and other supplies.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 30-year-old married man. He has 3 children between the ages of 2 and 8. He describes himself as polite and hardworking. He operates a retail tailoring store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a business area with much potential. He describes his biggest business challenge as his customers' low purchasing power from customer. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy clothes materials. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. In addition, Francis does farming, which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy materials for making new dresses to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 50 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida e hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años. Cada año realiza la siembra de los principales granos basicos de la zona como son maiz y frijol y maicillo. Dicha actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos y es de esta forma como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Su sueño es mejorar  su calidad de vida  y la de su familia ya que viven en condiciones muy humildes y desea darles algo mejor.  Esto lo motiva a trabajar con más entusiasmo ya que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo logrará dar a su familia lo que tanto desea. Es por eso que ha tomado la decisión de acercarse  a INTEGRAL  para solicitar este crédito que le permita invertir en los insumos agrícolas como abonos, insecticidas, etc. necesarios para el cultivo de la tierra y continuar llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Oscar is 50 years old and lives in his own home, with his life partner and children. He has been working in agriculture for many years. Every year he harvests the main bulk grains of his growing zone, like corn, beans and sorghum. Agriculture is his main source of income and it is the way that he earns a living and supports his family. 

His dream is to improve his standard of living and that of his family. They live in very humble conditions and he wants to give them something better. This motivates him to work with more enthusiasm, because with a lot of effort and work he will be able to provide for his family in the way that he so desires. It is for this reason that he decided to approach Integral to apply for this loan, which allows him to invest in agricultural supplies like manure, insecticides, etc. These are necessary for cultivating the earth and to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: invest in agricultural supplies like manure, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es: Noe de 63 años, vive junto a su esposa e hijo. Cuenta ya con una gran experiencia en el cultivo de granos básicos como el maíz y arroz siendo esta su principal fuente de ingresos. Noe es una persona dinámica, trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora que siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia, es por eso que tanto de vecinos como de su clientela solo se reciben buenas referencias. Ya que la época de cultivo se acerca Noe quiere prepararse para que su cosecha sea de primera calidad, es por eso que tomo la decisión de acercarse a una agencia de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito que le ayudara para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas, semillas, y preparar la tierra. Espera cumplir su sueño que le permitirán como en los años anteriores producir una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Noe, 63 years old, lives together with his wife and child. He has a lot of experience in the cultivation of basic grains such as corn and rice, which is his main source of income. Noe is a dynamic, hard-working, responsible and entrepreneurial person that is always in search of a way to help his family get by, and for this reason everyone, from his neighbors to his customers, always give him good references. 

Since the harvest season is getting closer, Noe would like to prepare himself so that his harvest will be of the finest quality. This is the reason why he made the decision to approach INTEGRAL to apply for a loan that would help him buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, and to prepare the earth. 

He hopes to achieve his dream, which would be to produce an excellent harvest as he has done in previous years.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, and to prepare the earth.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Twenty-three-year-old Jackline, who lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda, is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her salon, which sells hair products.

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more products for the salon to attract more clients. This will help Jackline to generate greater profits and boost the business.

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more products for her salon to attract more clients.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a 59-year-old widow. She is a farmer. Cecilia has been practicing mixed-farming for the past nine years. She also raises chickens. She earns a monthly income of KES20,000, which she uses to support her family. Cecilia is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully. She will use the loan to buy chicken feed. With the anticipated profits from the business she will expand her poultry farming. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living standards and those of her children.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 34. She is married to John and they have three children. She has been running her retail shop for about five years with an income of about KES19,000. She is requesting her fourth loan to buy more phone accessories for resale. She hopes to be a successful business lady and expand her business.

loans.use: buy more phone accessories.

loans.name: Tat'yana

texts.ru:
Татьяна  - фермер. С 1998 года занимается выращиванием винограда, подсолнечника, ячменя, кукурузы, лекарственных трав.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает  муж и  2-е детей, старший сын работает агрономом. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания дыни и арбуза на земельном участке площадью 40га.
Татьяна с мужем решила приобрести проволоку и столбики для подвязки молодого винограда.
В планах на будущие:  поставить теплицу для выращивания ранних сортов винограда.
В личных планах:  Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования проволоки и столбиков для винограда.
texts.en:
Tat'yana is a farmer. Since 1998, she has been in engaged in growing grapes, sunflowers, barley, corn, and herbs. Her husband and two children help her to manage the farm. Her eldest son works as an agronomist. The development of the activities began with growing melons and watermelons on a plot of 40 hectares. 

Tat'yana and her husband decided to buy the wire and posts for suspending young grapevines.

Her plans for the future: to build a greenhouse for growing early varieties of grape.

On a personal note: To finish building a house. 

She needs your help to fund the wire and posts for the grapevines.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Kazim

texts.en: Kazim is a 43 year old man. He is an Internally Displaced Person, who lives in Bilasuvar with his wife and three children. Kazim has repaired cars in his garage for the last 10 years. His monthly income is 100 AZN, which he plans to increase. He currently repairs Russian cars and sometimes international cars, including Mercedes and BMWs. Now people prefer international cars, but Kazim does not have enough working tools and has sometimes lost clients for this reason. He applied for a loan of AZN1,800 to buy new working tools. This will be his second loan with AqroInvest and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy new car repair tools.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба активная и деловая женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Махбуба давно мечтала заняться каким-нибудь видом бизнеса, но раньше у нее не было, ни средств, ни какой либо поддержки. Махбуба имеет опыт выращивания и ухода за скотом. Когда она поставила цель начать свое собственное дело- выращивание скота, она обратилась Ассоциация Деловых Женщин, чтоб пройти курс «Добейся успеха». После обучения в этом курсе, она получила много новой информации и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота. Она будет покупать скот, ухаживать несколько месяцев и перепродавать по более высокой цене. Она запрашивает займ для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is an active and business-minded woman. She is 26 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Mahbuba has long wanted to do some kind of business, but in the past she had neither the means nor any support. Mahbuba has experience raising and caring for livestock. 

When she set a goal to start her own business raising livestock, she turned to the Association of Business Women, to go through a course "Bring It On". After learning in this course, she received a lot of new information and received a certificate. She wants to establish a business buying and selling livestock. She will purchase livestock, care for them for several months, and then resell them at a higher price.

She is requesting a loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафрузу 20 лет. Она молодая и энергичная леди. Дилафруз не замужем и живет с родителями. Доход ее родителей маленький и поэтому ее родители попросили ее найти источник дохода для благо получения семьи. Она обратилась Ассоциация Деловых Женщин для обучения в курсе «Добейся успеха».  После обучения в данном курсе, она решила организовать бизнес, скотоводством, так как она живет в сельской местности, и ее местожительства весьма благополучный для скотоводства. Она запрашивает займ для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is 20 years old. She is a young and energetic lady. Dilafruz is not married and lives with her parents. Her parents' income is small and therefore her parents asked her to find a source of income for the well-being of the family. 

She turned to the Association of Business Women for a training "Bring It On". After the training, she decided to establish a business raising cattle, since she lives in a rural area and her domicile is very positive for this work. 

She is requesting a loan to establish a new business.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура женщина с огромной сердце доброты и доброй душой. Она всегда старается быть на ровне с развевающимся миром. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Дети еще не трудоспособные. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и отправляет мало денег. Эти деньги не хватают для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Манзура решила организовать собственный бизнес и найти источника дохода для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания, так как считает, что этот бизнес весьма выгодный. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Manzura is a woman with a huge heart of kindness and a good soul. She always tries to be in the flow of the world. She is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. Her children are not yet able to work. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation and sends a little money. The money is not enough to provide for the family with all the necessary means. Manzura decided to establish a business and to find a source of income to benefit the family. 

To that end, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She wants to establish a business buying and selling food products, as she believes this business is very profitable. 

She is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy goods to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy food items for organizing a new business

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 33-year-old married man with two children, aged 3 and 5 years old. Two years ago, he started a restaurant business selling food, tea and snacks. He describes himself as a honest and determined man. His business is in a good location to attract clients. 

Bernard describes his biggest business challenge as having enough space for his customers. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy food ingredients for making meals with. He dreams of running a hotel in five years time.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en:
Shamil, 30, is married and is on a pension. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  He is the only one who earns an income in his family. 

Shamil breeds chicken, geese, and turkey to sell to local butchers. He has more than five years of experience in this field thanks to his father, who taught him how to look after cattle. Shamil usually sells poultry from his house.  From this business, he earns a monthly income of 120 AZN. 

Each type of poultry has a season and Shamil raises his poultry accordingly. For example, chicken is popular throughout the year, geese are popular only during the winter, and turkey is popular during autumn and spring. Shamil is requesting a 1000 AZN loan to purchase more turkey, as the spring season is very close, and chicken.

loans.use: to buy more turkey and chicken

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 34-year-old man married with four children. He lives with his wife in Kaloleni, Kenya. His major monthly expenditure is a school fees payment because all of his children are still in school. He owns a charcoal stall. He has requested a loan amounting to 25,000 KES to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en: Clemence is 30 years old. She sells different items in her boutique in which foodstuffs dominate any other items. She has been running the business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans, potatoes and sweet potatoes for resale. She plans to renovate the house from the profits that will be obtained from the business.

loans.use: to buy more beans, potatoes and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Ahror

texts.ru:
Ахрор мужчина в возрасте  37 лет. Он живет в Дж. Расуловском р-не. Он женат, имеет троих детей,одного  сына  и двоих  дочек.  Дети учатся в школе.  Ахрор работает менеджером в ресторане, который расположен Дж. Расуловском р-не  . Его жена   также работает в ресторане, официанткой.   Ахрор и его жена работают  денем и ночью, стараются  получить больше доходов для улучшение их семейного состояния.    Он  давно мечтал построить дом для сына, и  несколько лет копил для этого деньги.  В прошлом году он начал строить дом но, его накопивших денег хватило только на фундамент и кладку кирпича. Конечно же стройка дома это очень большое дело, но Ахрор очень стремительный и пробивной человек, и он говорит: "Начатое дело надо доделать до конца".  В этом году Ахрор  планирует достроить дом и с этой целью он  обратился в организацию Арванд. Он решил подать заявку и получить кредит. 
На полученный кредит Ахрор хочет купить строительные материалы и достроить  свой дом. Он очень надеется, что его сын в будущем не будет нуждаться не в чем и будет опорой для него в старости.
texts.en: Akhror is 37 and lives in J. Rasulov. He is married, and has three children — one son and two daughters. The children are school students. Akhror works as a restaurant manager. His wife also works in the same restaurant as a waitress. Akhror and his wife work day and night; they are tring to make more money and improve their family's standard of living. He has long dreamed of building a house for his son, and a few years ago had saved enough money for this. Last year he began building the house, but his savings were only enough for the foundation and laying the bricks. Of course building a house is a very large project, but Akhror is a very driven and ambitious fellow, and he says "You have to finish what you start." This year Akhror plans to complete building the house and with this goal has turned to Arvand. He has decided to apply for credit.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Мастуре 31 года. Она трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Она с детства училась у своей матери шитью национального халата для мужчин, которое называется «джома». У нее очень богатая фантазия и умелые руки.  
Мастура замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Так как доход ее мужа не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами, Мастура решила организовать свой бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет реализовать свое ремесло в бизнес, то есть  шить и продать «джома». От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  6000 сомони для покупки тканей и других средств, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mastura is 31 years old. She is a hardworking and ambitious woman. Since childhood, she has been learning from her mother how to sew national coats for men called "jomah". She has a rich imagination and skillful hand.

Mastura is married and has two children. Since her husband's income is not enough to provide the family with all the necessary means, Mastura decided to establish her own business.

With this goal, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Now she is fully able to establish her own business and to become successful in this sphere. She wants to exercise her craft in the business, sewing and selling "jomah". From the revenue, she plans to provide her children with a good education.

She is requesting a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy fabrics and other means to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other necessary things for organizing a new business

loans.name: Marie Claudine

texts.en: Marie Claudine, age 27, is married with one child, age 3. Her husband is also a business man. She owns a bar and has been selling beers for the past seven years. She wants the loan to buy more beers for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more beers for resale.

loans.name: Renee Olivia

texts.en:
Renee is a Filipino designer who works with women from 50 villages in Eastern Samar to manufacture and export high-quality bags made from Pacific seagrass.

Renee’s family comes from Eastern Samar, which is one of the poorest provinces in the Philippines. Thirty percent of the population live below the national poverty line. This is because the province is constantly bombarded by the frequent typhoons originating from the Pacific Ocean.

Renee started this project using her own savings to develop contacts and international interest. Now that she is receiving bulk orders, she needs a capital infusion to pay for the materials, labor and processing fees for the products, so that they can be delivered on time and in good condition.

Renee is borrowing PHP 1,008,000 through NWTF and Kiva, so that she can sustain the momentum of her growing enterprise and provide her community of weavers with a stable source of income.

Renee's goal is to create a social enterprise environment where women are provided with the opportunity to earn a stable income for themselves and their families by maximizing the use of seagrass, which is abundant in the coastal areas of the island; also developing value chains that could energize the economy of the communities she is working with.

loans.use: to provide her community of weavers with stable income and pay for materials needed in making native bags made from seagrass.

loans.name: Bunyod

texts.ru:
Бунёд с самого  детства занимается разведением скота.  Он раньше  помогал отцу  откармливать скот,  теперь сам ухаживает за скотом так как всему этому уже научился. У Бунёда большая семья, жена  и четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Откорм скота является основным его делом, жена также помогает  в бизнесе, она доит корову и продает молоко и молочные продукты.  
Бунёд планирует увеличить поголовье скота и соответственно  увеличить свой капитал.У него очень много планов на будущее,хочет построить дом, обучить своих детей в хороших высших учебных заведениях, купить себе автомобиль и  для того,чтобы добиться всего этого он очень трудиться.  Они живут в сельской местности, и многие знакомые и родственники уехали в Российскую Федерацию, но он не может оставить своих близких и уехать так далеко.  Поэтому Буньед обратился за финансовой поддержкой в организацию Арванд за кредитом.
 На полученный кредит Буньед планирует купить скот и расширить свой бизнес.  Он надеется,что этот кредит поможет ему реализовать свои планы.
texts.en: Bunyod has been raising livestock since he was a boy. He used to help his father feed the animals, and now he himself tends to the animals since he has learned all about this type of work. Bunyod has a large family, a wife and four children. His wife is a homemaker, His main job is feeding the animals; his wife also helps in the business, milking cows and selling milk and dairy products. Bunyod is planning to increase the number of animals he owns, and thereby increase his capital. He has many plans for the future; he wants to build a house, have his children educated in fine higher educational institutions, and buy himself a car. He works very hard so he can achieve these goals. They live in a rural area, and many of his friends and relatives have left for jobs in the Russian Federation, but he cannot leave his loved ones and go so far away. Therefore Bunyod has come to to Arvand for financial support, for a loan. Bunyod plant to use the money earned with the loan to purchase livestock and expand his business. He hope that this loan will help him to realize his plans.

loans.use: to buying cattle

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлюда 48 лет, замужем. Мать 3 детей. Сейчас Мавлюда занимается животноводством, полеводством и садоводством. Свой бизнес она начала с 10,000 KGS сом в 2000 году.Ежемесячный доход Мавлюда составляет около 15,000 KGS. Муж и дети Мавлюды активно помогают по хозяйству. Мавлюда имеет среднее образование, создает впечатление человека очень честного и целеустремленного. На сегодняшний день у нее имеется очень развитое хозяйство. Все что она добилась благодаря её трудолюбию. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение количества скота в хозяйстве. Планирует приобрести 2 коровы и овец. Мавлюда планирует развивать свой бизнес, увеличивать доход семьи, для того чтобы обеспечить нормальное будущее своим детям.
texts.en: Mavluda is 48 years old and married. She is the mother of three children. Currently, Mavluda practices animal husbandry, crop farming and gardening. She started her business with 10,000 Kyrgyz Som (KGS) in 2000. Mavluda's monthly income amounts to approximately 15,000 KGS. Mavluda's husband and children actively help with her business. Mavluda has a secondary education and gives the impression of an honest and driven person. At the moment, she has a very well-developed agricultural business. Everything that she has achieved is thanks to her hard work. For the purpose of the further expansion of her business, she turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase the amount of livestock in her herd. She plans to buy two cows and sheep. Mavluda plants to develop her business and increase her family's income in order to insure a normal future for her children.

loans.use: To purchase two cows and sheep.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 37 years old. She is married with four children aged between 3 and 10 years. She sells fruits and has been selling fruits for the period of six years. With the loan, she wants to buy more yellow bananas for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья торгует мужской одеждой на рынке в городе Мелитополь. Опыт работы - 15 лет. Лучше всего сейчас продаются свитера, полуверы, куртки. Холодная погода способствует хорошей торговле. Наталья хочет сделать дополнительную закупку товара, чтобы увеличить прибыль.  Она уже давно мечтает сделать ремонт в квартире - в кухне, в ванной и в коридоре - и надеется что в этом сезоне, благодаря возможности увеличить торговый оборот, ее мечта о ремонте наконец-то сбудется.
texts.en:
Natalya trades in men's clothing at the market in the town of Melitopol. She has 15 years experience in this work. Best of all, she new sells sweaters, pullovers, and jackets. Cold weather contributes to good trading. 

Natalya wants to make additional purchases of goods in order to increase profits. She has long dreamed of making repairs to her apartment: in the kitchen, in the bathroom, and in the hallways, and hopes that this season with the ability to increase trade her dream for repair will finally come true.

loans.use: to buy commodities: sweaters, jackets

loans.name: Mwadzoya

texts.en:
Mwadzoya is a 49-year-old married man. He has two children aged 14 years and 21 years. He describes himself as a self-driven and business-oriented man. He operates a retail store where he sells household items such as flour, sugar, salt, maize, flour, soda, bread and tea leaves. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a residential area, and his primary customers are residents from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business.

He has approached with a loan request amounting to 20,000 KES to buy household items like sugar, maize and flour to resell. He hopes that, in the future, he will run the leading profitable distributor business in his residential area.

loans.use: to buy household items like sugar, maize and flour to resell.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем. У нее есть сын, который учиться в школе. Оксана имеет свой бизнес.
Оксана на протяжении семи лет занимается тепличным хозяйством. Она занимается выращиваем ранних овощей. Оксана имеет большой опыт работы. Она целеустремленная и трудолюбивая. Оксана хочет в будущем расширять теплицы, чтобы получать больший доход.

Оксана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на закупку семян, удобрений, пленки и на ремонт теплиц. Кредит поможет Оксане подготовиться к сезону и получить дополнительную прибыль, которую она хочет потратить на нужды семьи.
texts.en:
Oksana is married. She has a son who is studying in school. Oksana has her own business.

For the last seven years, Oksana has been engaged in greenhouse farming. She grows early vegetables. Oksana has great work experience. She is focused and hardworking. Oksana wants in the future to expand the greenhouse to earn more income.

Oksana is asking for a loan of 15,000 hryvnia to buy seeds, fertilizer, greenhouse film and to repair the greenhouse. The loan will help Oksana to prepare for the season and to earn additional profit, which she wants to spend on the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and greenhouse film

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат. У него есть маленькие дети. Александр имеет собственный бизнес.
Александр занимается тепличным хозяйством на протяжении многих лет. У него большой опыт работы. Наиболее продаваемыми являются ранний и поздний лук, клубника, капуста и виноград. Он обеспечивает свою семью.

Александр просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15 000 гривен на закупку  семян, пленки, удобрений, химикатов. Кредит поможет Александру подготовиться к весеннему сезону и получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Alexander is married. He has small children. Alexander has his own business.

Alexander has been engaged in greenhouse farming for many years. He has a lot of work experience. His best selling items are early and late onions, strawberries, cabbage, and grapes. He provides for his family.

Alexander is requesting a loan of 15,000 hryvnia for the purchase of seeds, greenhouse film, fertilizer, and chemicals. The loan will help Alexander prepare for the spring season and to get a good profit.

loans.use: to buy seeds, greenhouse film, and fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado MUJERES EN ACCIÓN está en su ciclo número OCTAVO del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosalía, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres que quiere decir que esta en un nivel verde, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está trabajando arduamente para seguir creciendo. Ella vende todo tipo de prendas y por medio de ese trabajo es que está saliendo adelante. Es muy visionaria y con muchas ganas de crecer.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y también ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: The group Mujeres en Acción [Women in Action] is in its eight loan cycle under the women's committee program, where all the members work and which helps them to advance themselves. One of the members, Mrs. Rosalía, is in level three poverty according to the latest survey, which is to say that she is improving her financial situation but has to keep working hard to go on improving. She sells a wide variety of clothing items and it is through this business that she supports herself. She is a very ambitious person with a strong will to grow. She is taking out this loan to invest in a variety of new clothing articles so she can keep up her sales and help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing articles for sale.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Espiritu Santo está en su ciclo número 12. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde ninguna se encuentra por debajo de la línea de pobreza, eso gracias al trabajo que todas han hecho y siguen haciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gilda, quien se dedica a la confección, y comenta Gilda que tiene siempre mucho trabajo, y que eso la ayuda mucho. Se hizo conocida en el barrio ya que hace muy buenos trabajos y esa es su mayor publicidad. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere seguir creciendo y luchando.
