La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas para la confección de ropas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "Espiritu Santo" ["Holy Spirit"] is in its 12th loan cycle. A survey is being taken for the elimination of poverty, and none of the members are below the poverty line, thanks to the work they have all done and continue to do. 

One of the members is Gilda, who works making clothing. Gilda comments that she always has a lot of work, and it helps her a lot. She has become well-known in the neighborhood, since she does very good work, and this is her best advertising. She is a very hard-working person who would like to keep growing and working hard. 

She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics to make clothing. This will help her carry out her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Jospine

texts.en:
Jospine works hard to support her family. As a married parent of three children, she has a general store in Kaloleni and earns additional income from selling coconuts.

She is borrowing a loan in the amount of KSH 40,000 to buy items for her general store like sugar, oil, bread, soft drinks, and flour. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: To buy items for her general store like sugar, oil, bread, soft drinks, and flour

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 27 years old. She sells clothes commonly known as Bitenge for women. She has been in this business for seven years.  She is married with two children, and the oldest attends school. She wants the loan to buy more Bitenge to sell. The profits from her business will be used for accumulating more savings.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics, called Bitenge, to sell

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 50 years old and married with five children.  She sells food and has spent four years in the business.  She has requested a loan to buy more bananas to sell.  With the loan, she wants to make more savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 25-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be an ambitious and determined man. He operates a motorcycle and retail store where he sells cereals and provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a high-traffic business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of cereals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy cereals to sell. His business goal is to be a supplier of cereals within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad, 49, is married and has three children. He receives a pension. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Mahammad is the only person in his family to earn an income.  

Mahammad breeds cattle to sell to local butchers. Additionally, he sells milk and milk products. Mahammad has more than 20 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him how to best look after cattle.

Mahammad usually buys small cattle and raises and fattens them up for five to six months. Then, he resells them for a profitable price at the local livestock bazaar. He sells the milk and yoghurt to his neighbors. Selling milk and beef allows Mahammad to earn 120 AZN per month. 

Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use beef in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also eaten in everyday life.   

Mahammad's income is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. He is applying for a1200 AZN loan to purchase one dairy cow, one beef cow, and fodder.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow, one beef cow, and fodder

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en: Drocella is 42-years old and married with five children.  She sells bananas and has been running the business for three years.  She wants the loan to buy more bananas to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Houn-Kponou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HOUN-KPONOU est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sofiath Abiodoun est âgée de 46 ans. Sofiath Abiodoun est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Sofiath Abiodoun est mariée à un certain Laurent. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Sofiath Abiodoun et son mari vivent ensemble avec leur enfant et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Sofiath Abiodoun a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Sofiath Abiodoun vend des tissus et divers autres produits à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ces clients, Sofiath Abiodoun désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Sofiath Abiodoun sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUN-KPONOU, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The HOUN-KPONOU group comprises three women who live in the same neighborhood.  

The group's representative, Sofiath Abiodoun, is 46 years old.  She is the group member raising her hand in the photo.  She is married to a man named Laurent.  They have one child who goes to school and is under their care.  Sofiath Abiodoun and her husband live with their child and jointly take care of the household expenses.

Sofiath Abiodoun left school at the secondary level.  She currently sells fabrics and other various products from home, an activity which allows her to meet her family's needs without much difficulty.

Eager to better satisfy the needs of her customers, Sofiath Abiodoun would like to boost her activity.  In order to do so, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the HOUN-KPONOU group.  Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other various goods.

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en: Annonciatha is a 48-year-old widow living with 3 children between the ages of 7 and 16.  She makes local juice from ripe bananas that she prepares.  She has been in this business for three years.  With the loan, she wants to buy more bananas to make juice.  The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.  In the picture, she is showing how they put bananas in the ground in order to ripen easily for juice.

loans.use: to buy more ripe bananas.

loans.name: Dukuzanye Group

texts.fr:
Thomas fait partie du groupe  Dukuzanye et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 54 ans et est marié  à Aline, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants  âgés de 3 à  25 ans,tous étudient.

Il  fait le commerce des produits vivriers (manioc et maïs) depuis  30 ans. 

Il est à son huitième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de maniocs et de maïs à revendre , pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait lutter contre la pauvreté dans sa famille et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Thomas is a member of the Dukuzanye group and he lives in Bujumbura.  He is 54 years old and married to Aline, who works in retail.  Thomas and Aline have eight children between the ages of 3 and 25.  All their children are in school.

Thomas has been selling food products (cassava and maize) for thirty years.

This is his eighth loan with Turame.  With the loan that he is receiving from Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of cassava and maize for resale, in order to make more money.

In the coming years, he would like to fight against poverty within his own family, and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of cassava and maize for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy four bags of rice, two stacks of firewood and one can of oil.

loans.name: Mammad

texts.en:
Mammad, 42, is married and has three children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his family. 

Mammad is a farmer and has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last fifteen years. He grows pears, apples, peaches, plums, pomegranates, cucumbers, tomatoes, carrots, and potatoes. He chose to grow fruits and vegetables because it is profitable and there is a high demand for produce.  Over the years, Mammad has gained enough skills and experience to run his business. 

People in Azerbaijan eat fresh vegetables everyday and consider them to be healthy. Vegetables are featured in many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch.  

Mammad usually sells his crops in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 70 AZN. Mammad wants to expand his business and grow more fruits and vegetables as his produce is in high demand. For this reason, he is requesting a 1000 AZN to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Perlas está en su ciclo número 17 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para que con ello se pueda saber cuál es la situación económica de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teodora, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, cuenta que hace zapatillas bordadas, y que con este trabajo trata de salir adelante. Teodora cuenta que su negocio esta mejorando, ya que las zapatillas bordadas son muy solicitadas y utilizadas por las mujeres y que tiene muy buenos pedidos. Su meta es seguir trabajando y creciendo para seguir dando a su familia una vida sin probaciones.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de zapatillas, lentejuelas, hilos, pinzas y demás, los cuales son los insumos básicos que siempre usa para poder hacer sus productos.
texts.en:
The group called “Las Perlas” (The Pearls) is in its 17th woman's committee program cycle, where all work and help one another to get by. They are conducting a poverty elimination survey in order to find out the economic situation of each member. 

One of the members is Ms. Teodora, who in the last survey showed that she was in poverty level number two. She states that she makes embroidered slippers, and with this job she trys to get by. Teodora also tells us that, since embroidered slippers are very much in demand and used by women, her business is improving and she receives many orders. Her goal is to continue working and growing in order to continue giving her family a trouble-free life. 

She is applying for this loan to buy slippers, sequins, thread, and tweezers, among other things, which are the basic inputs that she always uses to make her products.

loans.use: to buy slippers, sequins, thread, and tweezers, among other things.

loans.name: Teyfa

texts.en:
Teyfa, 52, is a widow who raises her four sons alone. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

Teyfa was a housewife and after her husband's death she was not able to find a job. As a result, she has been breeding cattle for last fifteen years. Her business is only source of income for her family. Her monthly income is 90 AZN.

Teyfa usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them up for five to six months, and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Teyfa also keeps dairy cows for personal use and sells milk to neighbors.  

Teyfa wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a 1000 AZN loan to purchase a dairy cow and fodder.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and fodder

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado SAGRADO CORAZON DE JESUS está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo  la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, de las 11 señoras mas de 60% ya superaron la linea de pobreza, y con las que todavía estan en rojo, o nivel uno, se está trabajando haciendo capacitaciones y incentivando a emprender algo un negocio nuevo o hacer crecer mas su negocio.
Cristina es una de estas mujeres, ella quiere emprender el negocio de las ventas y abrir una pequeña despensa con los productos mas imprescindibles, y de a poco ir creciendo. Ella tiene mucha esperanza en que con esto podrá ayudar a su familia y mejorar su economía.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, pan, fideos, arroz, yerba y demás, y así poder iniciar con este desafío que se propuso.
texts.en:
The group "Sagrado Corazon de Jesus" is in their first cycle as part of the Women's Committee program. They are participating in the Poverty Elimination program. Of the 11 women, over 60% have already surpassed the poverty line, and those that are in the red, or level one, are working with trainings and incentives to start a new business or grow their business. 

Cristina is one of these women, who wants to get in the sales business and open a small dispensary with the most essential products, and to grow it little by little. She is hopeful that with this she will be able to help her family and improve her finances.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of vegetables, meat, bread, noodles, rice, yerba and more, so that she can start this challenge ahead of her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, bread, noodles, rice, tea and more.

loans.name: Jose Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Caacupé tiene 12 integrantes, donde todas y cada una se esfuerza por sus familias, para poder darles todo Caacupé que ellas no pudieron tener, y evitar que así pasen por necesidades.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Ilda, quien es la presidenta, tiene una pequeña cantina bien surtida con todo tipo de productos. Ella cuenta que se esfuerza mucho por ayudar a los suyos, y que también trata de ayudar a sus compañeras del grupo a salir adelante.
Ilda solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de galletitas, jugos, gaseosas, golosinas y demás, para poder tener bien surtida su cantina, y seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Caacupé has 12 members, all of whom work hard for their families so that they can give them everything that they weren't able to have, and prevent that they are in need.

One of the women, Ilda, is the president of the group. She has a small, well-stocked store with all types of products. She says that she works hard to help her own, and also tries to help her partners in the group to get ahead. 

Ilda asks for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of cookies, juices, sodas, snacks and other things so that she can have her store stocked well and continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy cookies, juices, sodas, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Maina

texts.en:
Maina is a 54-year-old man from Olkalau. He is married to Margret and they have five children who are all in school.

Maina is a farmer. He previously borrowed a loan from KADET LTD which he has successfully repaid. He is asking for a second loan now to buy seedlings and fertilizer to use in his farm.

He hopes to educate his children, and grow his farm outputs in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a 26-year-old married man with one child. He describes himself as a determined man. Pascal set up a retail store seven years ago, where he sells cell phone accessories. His shop is located in a good business area. 

Pascal says that his biggest business challenge is security for his stocks. He has asked for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more phone accessories. His business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy phone accesories

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 43 years old. She is married with one child. She sells beans and has requested the loan to reinvest in her business by buying more beans. The profits from the business will be used to build savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 41 years old, married and supports a family of six. For the past five years, he has been a mixed farmer in Narok County, Kenya. His monthly income is 15,000 KES. With a third loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD he plans to purchase livestock and prepare his land for planting.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business. His dream is to have a stable business and to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and prepare his land for planting

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is 33 years old. She has three children, two of whom are enrolled in school. She wants a loan to expand her butchering business, which she has been running for 10 years. With the profits from the business, she wants to build more savings.  In the photo, her husband is helping her chop meat.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale in her butchering business.

loans.name: Dafrose

texts.en: Dafrose is 54 years old. She is married with 4 children and has been selling bananas for 2 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more bananas to make local beer for sale. She has been earning profits from her business, and she plans to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to make local beer for sale.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 43 years old. She is married and has eight children. Six of them go to school. She owns a boutique and has been running it for three years. With the loan, she wants to add more retail items to sell such as salt, soaps and many more. She would like to pay school fees with the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy more retail items to sell

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a 34-year-old married lady with two sons, who are both in school. She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya with her family. Her husband is a primary school teacher, and his income helps to support the family. 

Hadija owns a retail shop where she sells household items. She has asked for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to restock her shop with sacks of sugar, bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to restock her shop.

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en: Ildephonse is 38 years old. He sells animals and has been in the business for 10 years. He is married with five children. With the loan, he wants to buy more different types of animals to slaughter for sale such as pigs, cows and goats. He has a plan for providing food for the family and making savings from the profits that will be obtained from the business.

loans.use: To buy more pigs, cows and goats to get meat for sale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is Kadiatu, who is 38 years old.  She is married and has 4 children, aged 20, 8, 7, and 2. In 2008, Kadiatu established her fish-selling business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband take care of their home. Her business is located on the outskirts of Freetown, and her main customers are people from the general community. Working 7 days a week, 9 hours a day, Kadiatu earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from her business. She needs a loan in order to buy more cartons of fish for resale and would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. In the future, Kadiatu plans to develop her business, educate her children, and build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophie is a married lady with one child. She describes herself as a focused and patient woman. Sophie started a grocery stand five years ago, where she sells fruit and vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, mangoes, lemons and carrots. Her stand is located in a good business area. 

Sophie describes her biggest business challenge as having sufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy fruit and vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to start up a new supermarket within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en: Sylvestre is 48 years old. He is married to a businesswoman. They both have five children and they all go to school. He makes local juice from sorghum and has spent 4 years in the business. With the loan, he wants to buy more sorghum so that he can make more juice. He plans to put the profits into savings.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Aminata. She is married and has two children, aged 3 and 1. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they are assistants. In 2012, Aminata established her mayonnaise, Peak milk, sardines, drinks, etc., business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in taking care of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are the general community people.

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to buy drinks, Peak milk, etc., for resale. In the future, Aminata plans to develop her business, educate her children and to erect a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more provisions.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Finda. She is married and has one child, aged 4 years. In 2007, Finda established her suitcases, cow-kanda, bamako and ready-made clothes business. She began her business because she wanted to increase her income. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 600,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Finda requires a loan in order to purchase more of her business items for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to earn more profit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more clothing and business items for resale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married with 7 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Barangay Culo Molave, in the province of Zamboanga del Sur.

Juliana runs a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. She earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store, including shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, and salt.

Juliana has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to become successful and earn a better living.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, including shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, and salt.

loans.name: Vergelio

texts.en:
Vergelio is married with two children. Vergelio is 56 years old and lives in Tonggo Tudela, Philippines.

Vergelio is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for eight years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers for vegetable production.

Vergelio has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Vergelio hopes to save in case of some emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for vegetable production.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is a self-starter from Chayqend, a village in the Kapan region of Armenia. He lives with his wife and little daughter, along with his parents and one brother.

Arman keeps two cows and two bulls, and he uses the milk for cheese production. He generates income by selling the cheese and milk at local markets. Arman does his best to sustain his family and cover their basic costs, but unfortunately his monthly income is not really enough for such a big family.

So, Arman has applied for this loan to expand his agricultural holdings. With the help of this loan, Arman can buy two cows and a heifer. This will help him to increase his agricultural activity and generate more income.

Arman is a very hardworking person and he hopes that this loan will help him to create a better future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and a heifer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various goods such as sugar, eggs, lotions, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 31 years old and married to Paul, age 38, who is a trader. She resides in Dansoman and sells used clothing such as jerseys.

She has been in this business for the past four years and is doing very well. She is very good with clients and provides excellent customer service. 

This is Sarah's second loan. She needs GHS 500 to expand her business and buy more goods to enable her to sell used clothing to her customers.

loans.use: To buy jerseys for sale

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is a 45-year-old woman who sells food. She is married to Anthony, who is 51 years old and is a pastor.

She has been doing her business for the past five years. She buys her food in bulk from Mankesim in the Central Region of Ghana and, in turn, sells it to customers. She is very dedicated, industrious and hardworking.

This is her sixth loan. She is requesting GHS 500 to help her buy more food to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 57-year-old married man and a father to three sons and one daughter. Mohammad has been building a new house and now he wants to finish it. Mohammad is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing cement and installing tiles. Taking this loan will speed the process of completing Mohammad's house and enable him and his family to move to live in their new house soon.

Mohammad is photographed in the location of his new house.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to complete the house

loans.name: Shifa

texts.en:
Both Shifa and her husband appear in her Kiva profile photo standing next to his taxi.  Shifa is a 45-year-old woman.  She is the mother of five sons and two daughters. 

For the past few years, Shifa's husband has been driving a taxi in a small village near Jinen called Maithalon, which is very famous for agriculture.  It has been a profitable endeavor and is the only source of income for the family.  Shifa is requesting a loan of $700 from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs to insure and license the taxi.  In addition, this loan will help the family cover some of the taxi-related expenses.

loans.use: to pay to insure and license the taxi.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is 32 years old.  He is married and lives with his family in a small village near Jinen.  Amin is a worker who earns very low wage and also has his own project, selling shoes.

Amin is requesting a loan of $500 USD from FATEN in order to help him cover the cost of purchasing new furniture, including pieces for the living room and bedroom, in order to improve living conditions in his house.  Taking this loan will afford Amin the opportunity to purchase comfortable furniture so that he can enjoy living in his house.

Amin is pictured in the FATEN office in Jinen.

loans.use: to buy new furniture.

loans.name: Tureme Group

texts.fr:
J.Marie fait partie du groupe Tureme et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 31 ans et est marié à Alice, une commerçante de tomates. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant de 3 ans.
Il a sous sa charge 2 orphelins qui étudient.

Il  fait la photographie depuis 10 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter des cassettes  vidéo à revendre, un appareil photo(outil de travail)  et augmenter le capital de sa femme, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Marie is part of the group Tureme and lives in Bujumbura. He is 31 years old and married Alice, a tomato merchant. Together they have a 3-year-old child. He supports two orphans, who are students.

He has been a photographer for ten years. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital, purchase video cassettes to resell and a camera (for work), and increase her wife's capital, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a plot of land and to see his children pursue education.

loans.use: to purchase video cassettes to resell and a camera (for work) and to increase his wife's capital

loans.name: Marie Marguerite

texts.fr: Marie Marguerite est une femme de 48 ans célibataire mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 30 ans 2 d'entre eux vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail et en gros des vivres frais (fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 17 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter le stock de ses fruits pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks et d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Marguerite is a 48-year-old single woman and the mother of four children whose ages range between 4 and 30.  Two of her children are in school.

Marie Marguerite has been involved in retail and wholesale commerce for the past 17 years.  Depending on the season, she sells fresh produce (fruits) at a local market.  She knows her suppliers and especially her customers very well, for having built her customer base over time, thanks to her experience in this field.  However, because of her small capital, she is constantly out-of-stock since she has to sell off her stock before she can buy more merchandise.

Marie Marguerite would like to increase her stock of fruits, which will allow her to better meet the constant demand from her customers.  A larger stock will also prevent stock shortages and will help her to increase her profits.  

Marie Marguerite intends to save her profits, not only to expand her activity, but also to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fruits.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, 48, is separated with two school-aged children.She presently lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor.

She has engaged in this business for around three years. She earns five thousand Philippine pesos (PHP) a month which supports her family's daily needs.

Emelia is a new member of PMPC and she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase different products for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar and salt.

loans.use: to purchase different products for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar and salt.

loans.name: Rosalindo

texts.en:
Rosalindo is married with 1 child. Rosalindo is 50 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.

Rosalindo is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for 22 years. He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds for rice production.

Rosalindo has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Rosalindo hopes to open his own business.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer and seeds for rice production

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is 31 years old, married with two children (an infant and one school age) and presently living in Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.

She has engaged in selling of fish  for eight years as their source of income and earns 6,000 PHP a month to support their living. Now, she requested a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP to purchase some fishing net materials.

She has been a PMPC member for a couple of months and hopes to expand her livelihood by having different fishing equipment.

loans.use: to purchase some fishing net materials

loans.name: Raikan

texts.ru: Райкан 29 лет, замужем. Райкан с 2003 года занимается торговлей мужской одежды, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Райкан, на доходы от бизнеса сумела построить дом на месте старого, бизнес приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса и увеличения оборотных средств, Райкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на приобретение весенне-летнего ассортимента мужских товаров. Доходы от кредита Райкан планирует завершить строящийся дом.
texts.en: Raikan is 29 years old, she is married. Raikan has been selling men's clothing since 2003, a business which she started with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work Raikan was able to use the income from the business to build a new house in the place of old one. The business brings her about 15,000 som a month. With the goal to further grow her business and increase her working capital, Raikan has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy a spring-summer collection of men's clothing. Raikan plans to use the income from the loan to complete construction of her house.

loans.use: to purchase spring-summer collection of men's clothing.

loans.name: Nicole

texts.fr: Nicole est une jeune dame de 32ans. Elle vit avec son conjoint cuisinier et leurs 02 enfants de 05 et 03ans à Lomé. L’ainé seul est scolarisé. Après sa formation en coiffure, Nicole a ouvert son atelier de coiffure dans lequel il sert ses clients. En plus du service qu’elle offre à ses clients, elle vend aussi des produits de beauté (mèches, défrisant, poudre pour visage et autres). Ses achats se font à LOME et elle sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour renforcer son stock de marchandises. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille tout en rendant pérenne son activité. Il est à préciser qu’elle a une ancienneté de 05ans et que 02 personnes lui prêtent main forte dans l’exécution de son activité.
texts.en: Nicole is a 32-year-old young woman. She lives with her spouse, who is a cook and their two children who are 3 and 5 in Lomé. Their oldest child attends school. After hairdresser school, Nicole opened her own hair salon. In addition to the beauty services, she also sells beauty products to her clients (hair extensions, hair straighten products, face powder). She buys the inventory in LOME and is requesting her first loan from WAGES to increase her available inventory. In the future, she would like to improve her family's standard of living by stabilizing her business throughout the year. She has been in business for about five years and has two people helping her manage the business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Tété

texts.fr: Mr Tété est un homme âgé de 52ans. Il a pour femme une enseignante et ont ensemble un enfant de 06 ans qui va à l’école. Il est comptable de profession et pisciculteur à la fois.  Il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des alevins, du riz servant à la nourriture des poissons. Il exerce son activité avec 03 personnes et souhait à l’avenir avoir une bonne condition de vie.
texts.en:
Tété is a 52-year-old man.  He is married to a teacher.  Together, they have a six-year-old child who attends school.  Tété is a professional accountant who also works in fish farming.

He is requesting a first loan from WAGES in order to buy some young fish, as well as rice to feed his fish.  He works with three people and hopes to enjoy good living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy young fish and rice bran.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is married and has one child.  She is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Carlita is a farmer and grows  assorted crops and vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. Carlita has requested a loan to purchase sacks of fertilizer for her crops and vegetables. 

Carlita has been a member of PMPC for 9 years.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer for her crops and vegetables

loans.name: Almalyn

texts.en:
Almalyn is married with one child. Almalyn is 31 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Almalyn has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase items for her hog fattening business.

Almalyn has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Almalyn hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase items for her hog fattening business.

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 43 years old and lives in Labo, Ozamiz City. She is single.

Fe has a general store and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this business. 

She has a requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar and other consumable products.

Fe has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar and other consumable products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicken, fish, eggs and rice

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with one child. Virginia is 56 years old and lives in Ozamiz City.
Virginia is an entrepreneur and manage her own general store to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, salt, vinegar and purchase a freezer for her general store business also.

Virginia joined PMPC just this year. In the future, Virginia hopes to expand her general store business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, salt, vinegar and purchase a freezer for her general store business also.

loans.name: Sehati Damai 1 Group

texts.en:
The Group "Sehati Damai 1" will begin its second cycle with VisionFund. It is made up of five members, and Nuryani is the president. The types of businesses from this group are varied, among them there are: socks sales, minutes sales, cooked food, and a grocery store.

Currently, Nuryani has her own business of chicken noodle selling and some kind of juice selling. She started this business over the last two years. The loan she is now requesting is to increase her capital (purchase 20 kilos of noodles and fruit to make juice). She will be making it and selling it from 10am-6pm near her house. Every day she can get profits of at least 30,000 IDR. Sometimes she faces the obstacle of the price of chicken increasing.

She has a plan to add new food to her menu. She has a dream of seeing her child work in a famous company.

loans.use: to buy noodles, mustard, fruit for juice (mango, avocado, orange), and two chickens.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano es de la Ciudad de Curuguaty, donde según la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza de las integrantes, deben trabajar con capacitaciones para poder ir mejorando y de esa forma mejorar la economía de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Leticia, se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como así a faenarlos y venderlos, cuenta que es un trabajo muy duro y sacrificado, pero está feliz con lo que hace, ya que es su único medio para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan y que no se priven de nada.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de gallinas para la cría y venta, y con eso poder seguir trabajando y creciendo dentro del grupo.
texts.en:
This group, called "San Cayetano" is from the city of Curuguaty.  According to the members' poverty elimination survey, they must all work under training to be able to develop and so improve each of their financial situations.

One member of the group is Leticia, who makes a living raising and selling animals, as well as slaughtering and then selling them.  Leticia says it is very difficult and demanding work but she is happy with it as it is her only means of giving her family what they need and not depriving them of anything.

Leticia is applying for this loan to buy hens to raise and sell.  With this she will be able to continue working and growing within the group.

loans.use: to buy hens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer como está evolucionando cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gloria, quien tiene una peluquería con todo lo que necesita para poder dar a sus clientes una buena atención. Se ha hecho conocida en su barrio ya que siempre da muy buena atención a los clientes y ellos siempre salen felices. Gloria es muy trabajadora y con el correr del tiempo quiere seguir creciendo con su negocio y así ayudar más a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, tintes, enjuagues y demás, con lo que podrá ir mejorando en su plan de negocios y también aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, called "Mujeres Emprendedoras", is on its second loan cycle as part of the women's committee program.  All the women work and help each other to prosper.  They are currently undergoing the poverty elimination survey to see how each of them is progressing.

One member of the group is Gloria who has a hairdressing salon with everything she needs to give her customers good service.  She has become known in her part of town as she always gives good service and her customers always leave happy.  Gloria is very hard-working and as time goes on she wants to keep growing with her business and to help her family more.

She is applying for this loan to invest in shampoo, dyes, conditioner and more.  With this she will be able to improve her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, dyes, conditioner and more.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su primer ciclo donde, cada una de las integrantes está trabajando por salir adelante y poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto que vienen haciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Aurelia, quien en su primera encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de de Chancos, para faenar y vender  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, ya que este es su trabajo y con esto mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
This group, called "Kuña Guapa", is on its first loan cycle.  Each of the members is working to prosper and to be able to help their families through the work they are doing.

One of the members is Aurelia who, in her first poverty elimination survey, was on level two of the poverty scale.  Thanks to her continuous work and effort, her financial situation is improving.  Aurelia is applying for this loan to buy pigs to slaughter and sell.  This will help her to realise her business plan, thus helping her to improve her income.  This is her work which is for maintaining her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughter.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.ru: Алие 45 лет,замужем. У них с мужем двое детей. Муж является инвалидом 2 группы. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, в 1985 году Алия и её муж начали  заниматься животноводством и садоводством. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов и фруктов по сезону. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алия обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Алия планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Aliya is 45 years old and married with two children.  Her husband is on disability.  As a source of income for her family, Aliya and her husband got started in livestock and farming in 1985.  They started with 1,000 som (KGS) and now their farm brings in about 15,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk, dairy products and fruits in season.  With the goal of further increasing her business, Aliya turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy a few additional head of cattle.  She plans to reinvest this increased income back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has since paid off his previous loan owing to the good harvest of the previous season. He has used the proceeds to lease an additional five acres of land where he will plant maize and beans, in addition to wheat farming.

He has applied for KES 50,000 from KADET LTD which will facilitate in paying for additional labour as well as the purchase of inputs like fertilizers, seedlings and pesticides.

He plans to educate his children with the farm proceeds and better the family living standards. His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and prepare the farmland.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 31-year-old IDP, who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and three children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 5 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan and they are also use to make fresh punch.

Zaur sells his crops in the bazaar. His monthly income is 150 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.
These products are in high demand and Zaur wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover this market demand. For this purpose he has applied for 2000 AZN. He will buy seeds and fertilizers. This will be his 2nd loan and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his fruit and vegetable crops.

loans.name: Protais

texts.en: Protais is 46 years old. He is the father of seven children aged between 6 and 21. His children all attend school. Protais sells medicine for animals and has been selling medicine for 20 years. With the loan, he plans to buy more medicine to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more animal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 42 years old. She owns a boutique selling various merchandise. She has requested the loan to buy more flour and retail items. The profits from the business she will add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy more flour to sell in her market.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, Grace operates a family member's business providing motor transport services. Grace has been engaged in this business for three years and earns 1,700 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Grace joined GDMPC. Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service.   used in the business  . She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 51 years old, is married, and has 5 adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling crabs in the local community to tourists and community members. She has been engaged in her business for more than 23 years and earns approximately 2,100 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

Aquilina joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional crabs to sell. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is from Aurora Zamboanga del Sur, and father of two children. He is 51 years old. He is happily married and his wife is a nurse. He has a flower farm to earn a living. He decided to engage in this business to help his wife to earn an income for the family needs and of course for the education of the children. His wife is not yet a regular employee and does not earn so much. He has been in this business for about 5 years and earns an income of approximately PHP 8,250 a month.

Jerry was very happy hearing the name of GATA DAKU MPC when someone introduced them to him. Timing was good because he needs financial assistance for his farm. Without a doubt he went to the office and requested a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000. This is his first cycle of loan. The purpose of this loan is to purchase fertilizer which you can see he has picture. In the future he wants to purchase a cab for his single motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the good growth of the flowers he planted.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence is 34 years old. Her husband is a businessman and they have four children. She owns a bar and has been running the business for four years. She wants the loan to buy more crates of brewery beer and jerrycans of locally produced beers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Ian Orlando

texts.en:
Ian Orlando is married with 3 children. Ian Orlando is 32 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela, Philippines.
Ian Orlando is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer.
Ian Orlando has been a member of PMPC for 9 months. In the future, Ian Orlando hopes to save in case of some emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for his fruit and vegetable crops.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 40 years of age and lives in Gumahan Josefina, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 5 children.
Eliza raises pigs and earns approximately PHP 32,000 every 3 months doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more feed for her hogs.
Eliza has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost 5 years. In the future, Eliza hopes to expand her business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en:
Novelita is 58 years of age and lives in Poblacion Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with five children.

Novelita has a corn farm and earns 30,000 PHP every four months doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more fertilizer to grow corn.

Novelita has been a member of Paglaum MPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to become a successful woman.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 36 years old and lives in Dampalan, La Libertad. She is married with 4 children.
Linda has a shop that sells vegetables. She has had this business for almost a year. She has requested a loan to purchase assorted vegetables to sell.
Linda has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase 30 baskets of assorted vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has five children. She is 26 years old. Her husband is in a transport business, driving a motorcycle in their community. Raquel is in an agriculture business, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been in this business for four years. Raquel has another line of business, selling ready-to-wear clothes.

During harvest, she sells her banana to her contract buyer in the town. She earns a return in the amount of PHP 8,000. 

Recently, Raquel joined GDMPC to obtain financial services. Raquel is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizer, for the good growth of her banana plants. Raquel plans to reinvest part of her profits into expanding the existing business, and she plans to save another part of the profits for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, for the good growth of the banana plants

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 40 years old and lives in Upper Bunawan, Calamba. She is married with 3 children.
Lucila has a shop that sells dried fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to purchase 10 boxes of dried fish.
Lucila has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.

loans.use: to purchase 10 boxes of dried fish.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 59 years old and lives in La Libertad. She is married with 5 children.
Adela has a sand and gravel business and makes hollow blocks.  She earns approximately PHP 5000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase the cements needed to make hollow blocks.
Adela has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of cement for to make hollow blocks.

loans.name: Ida's Group

texts.en:
Ida is 50 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Calamba. She has a live in partner and is blessed with 2 children.
Ida has a shop that sells assorted groceries and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to purchase assorted groceries and beverages to sell.
Ida has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.
Ida is the leader of a 3 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 boxes of assorted groceries and 20 cases of beverages.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 60 years old. She is married and has six children. They currently reside in the village of Manaoag. She's been into vegetable farming for almost 40 years. She planted vegetables such as eggplant, squash, string beans, and tomatoes in their back yard. She's earning 15,000 PHP a month. She would like a loan amounting to 40,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. According to Gloria, she plans to buy a lot for her family. She's hoping that her loan will be granted to enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marifi

texts.en:
This is Marifi, 35 years old and a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Rey, her business partner and is the mother to their children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand-in-hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marifi owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and maintain her jeepney. Marifi dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good education and a good life. She meets her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
This is Priscilla. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help toward covering her personal, household and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in higher profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Priscilla dreams that her store will be a grocery store and dreams that her children will all be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Chansen's Group

texts.en:
Chansen, age 50, lives in a rural village in the Kandal Stoeng district. She has four children. Chansen is a rice farmer to make a living and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee. She and her husband have been in this business for 30 years. The current business earns her about KHR 38,000 per day and allows her to save about KHR 15,000 each day after daily expenses.
 
This is a micro loan for Chansen with Kiva’s partner. Now she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy material for building a latrine, such as a toilet bowl, tile drainage etc. Chansen hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy material for building a latrine

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is married with 4 children. Leonida is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Leonida is a farmer and grows assorted vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She has requested a loan to pay for land preparation for gardening.
Leonida has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation for the growing of vegetables.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a 59-year-old woman living in Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. She has earned a living through her sari-sari (variety) store for more than three years now. This is the source of her income. She is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, rice candies, biscuits, coffee, beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to cater and sell more products to the people in her area thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Delia hopes of expanding her store.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, rice, candies, biscuits, coffee, beverages, soap and toiletries for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Tegal Badeng Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut has a pig business; her husband supports her business because it helps improve the family income. She also wants to renovate the barn. 

She needs a new loan to purchase piglets; she also plans to buy a sow. Because the loan is not enough to purchase a sow, her husband will give her money to support the bussines to buy a sow. 

She hopes the sow will give her a healthy piglets and she can sell them to other breeders in her village.

loans.use: To purchase a piglets..

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cristeta's business is doing well. She was able to repay the loan on time and also meet the needs of her family well. She is grateful for the support. 

Cristeta would like to invest further in the business. She is applying for a loan of Php 5,000 to buy woods and materials needed for her furniture business.

loans.use: to buy woods and materials needed for her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 38 years of age,married with three children. Two of her children go to school while her youngest child is still very young. Delia offers a variety of merchandise within her village. She has been in this kind of business for nine years. 

Delia would like request additional capital in the amount of PHP 20,000. This amount will be used to buy merchandise such as canned goods, egg, cooking oil, ingredients, instant noodles, shampoo and detergent. She knows that through her dedication and patience she could further improve her variety store. In addition, she could also earn greater profits which will serve for her family's daily consumption, education of her two children, obtain better way of life and ensure proper growth of her duck-raising business.Delia would be thankful if her requested loan is granted.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as canned goods, eggs, cooking oil,cooking ingredients, instant noodles, shampoo and detergent for her variety store

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi, 35 years old, is married to Juan and has three children. Noemi is a loving mother who does everything to for provide the needs of her family. She is engaged in selling personal products and is she is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy soap, lotions, perfume and face powder for her business.

loans.use: to buy soap, lotions, perfume and face powder to sell in her business.

loans.name: Realite De Dericour 1, 3, 4 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Coeurcivil est le coordinateur de son groupe Realite de Dericour de Bras de Lance 1, 3, 4 & 6. il n´est pas marie et il a 5 enfants. Il habite dans la région Trou Du Nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. 

Coeurcivil a dirigé son commerce de d´artisanat pendant les 10 dernières années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, il cultivait la terre. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir d'acheter leurs artisans ses œuvres. Coeurcivil espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son commerce.

Coeurcivil dit que ses défis principale est de devenir un plus un grand commercant et Il dit que son but principale c'est d'avoir plus d'argent pour obtenir un plus grand commerce avec l'aide de Dieu.
texts.en: Coeurcivil is the coordinator of the group "Realite de Dericour de Bras de Lance 1, 3, 4 & 6". He is not married and has 5 children. He lives in the Trou Du Nord region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Coeurcivil has run his crafts business for the last 10 years. Before starting this business, he cultivated the land. He would like to use this loan to buy works made by craftsmen. Coeurcivil hopes that this loan will help him to grow his business. He says that his main challenges are to become a larger retailer and that his main aim, with the help of God, is to earn more money in order to get a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy craft works.

loans.name: Hemelina

texts.en:
Hemelina is a 46-year-old married woman with four children.

Hemelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns income by buying and selling rice.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more inventory, such as coffee, creamers, soap, canned goods, and noodles, to sell in her general store. Prior to this loan, Hemelina had borrowed and re-paid 20 loans through NWTF. Hemelina aspires to save enough money to provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory (e.g., coffee, creamers, soap, canned goods, and noodles) to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mellanie

texts.en:
Mellanie is a vegetable farmer from Jagna, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of seven young children. Mellanie has been growing vegetables for more than three years now.
Mellanie is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. With this, she will be able to produce healthy vegetables thus allowing her to sell more to the market. In the future, Mellanie hopes to expand her vegetable farm, repay her loan, and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertlizer and pesticides for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 32-year-old man from Ubay, Bohol. He has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for 4 years now. He sells canned goods, noodles, juice, biscuits, and other assorted goods. The business is the source of his income which he uses for the family needs and expenses like for their daily food consumption.
Joel is requesting a loan to buy assorted groceries. He wants to buy more items such as canned goods, noodles, juice, detergent, soap and other toiletries, biscuits, snacks, and soft drinks. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy all these items.

In the future, Joel hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is applying for a 1,000 USD loan to improve her business. Anita has a kiosk in a market. She is very busy because many people come to buy her goods. She is making a good income from selling her goods in the kiosk. She will use the loan to buy some additional stocks to keep in her kiosk such as sugar, coffee, pens, books and other items  She opened her kiosk in 2006 with her own working capital of 100 USD. She is single and independent.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, pens, books and other items

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is 31 years old and she is married. She has four children, all whom are in school; her husband is a farmer. 

Domingas is taking a loan of $600 to buy some additional stock to keep in her store such as biscuits, soft drinks, hard drinks, sugar, salt, coffee, and rice. 

She opened her kiosk in 1998 with her own working capital of $200.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, soft drinks, hard drinks, sugar, salt, coffee, and rice.

loans.name: Ronida

texts.en:
Ronida is 56 years old and has ten children. Ronida is married. Two of the children are in school.

Ronida is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Ronida requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Ronida has been raising livestock for three years now and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Ronida would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Sunatullo

texts.ru: Сунатулло житель города Вахдат. Ему 28 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Сунатулло заинтересован торговой деятельностью. Он хочет начать новый бизнес в этой сфере и заниматься купле-продажей детской оджеды. С этой целью он обратился за кредитом. На полученный кредит Сунатулло планирует открыть торговую точку на центральном рынке города, приобрести товар и начать продажу детской одежды.
texts.en: Sunatullo lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 28 years old and he is married with three children.  Sunatullo has become interested in the business of sales.  He wants to start a new business in this sphere and work in the purchase and sale of children's clothing.  With this goal in mind, he has asked for a loan.  On receiving his loan, Sunatullo plans to open a trading stall in the city's central market, to buy his goods and to start selling children's clothing.

loans.use: to open his trading stall and procure his goods (children's clothing)

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Хикматулло 27 лет. Он с женой и двумя детьми проживает в Яванском районе. Хикматулло очень предприимчивый человек. У него высшее экономическое образование, он работает в банке. Сейчас Хикматулло хочет одновременно заняться животноводческой деятельностью. Его интересует купля-продажа крупно-рогатого скота. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для закупа скота с дальнейшим его откормом и продажей. За счет прибыли с новой деятельности Хикматулло планирует увеличить поголовье скота и сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Hikmatullo is 27 years old.  He lives with his wife and two children in the Yavan region.  Hikmatullo is a very enterprising man.  He has a higher economic education and he works in a bank.  Now he wants to work raising cattle at the same time.  He is interested in buying and selling livestock.  With this goal in mind, he is asking for a loan to buy cattle with the goal of fattening them up and selling them.  With the income that comes from his new business, Hikmatullo plans on increasing his head of livestock and making repairs to his home.

loans.use: to buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Ya Nere Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA est responsable du groupe YA NERE. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Mme se porte bien. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 1an03mois. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge.
 Mme vend des pagnes, des prêts à porter et des chaussures depuis 11 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10. Elle a bien exécuté son prêt passé et est très contente. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes. 
Elle veut s’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes, 01douzaine de chaussures et 01 douzaine de prêts à porter. 
Avec ses économies, elle veut améliorer son activité et s’acheter une moto. Elle souhaite encore agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et pouvoir épargner. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
Haoua is the leader of the Ya Nere group. She is married and the mother of 4 children. She is doing well. Her eldest child is 13 years old and the youngest is 1 year and 3 months. Two of her children attend school and she is responsible for 3 people.

Haoua has been selling pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African fabric), ready-to-wear clothing and shoes for 11 years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market. She has implemented her previous loan successfully and is very happy. Her customers are men and women. She wants to buy 10 pieces of pagnes, a dozen pairs of shoes and a dozen ready-to-wear items of clothing. She would like to improve her business and buy a motorcycle using her savings. She wishes to increase her business further in order to better satisfy her customers and to be able to save. She would like to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of pagnes, a dozen pairs of shoes and a dozen ready-to-wear items of clothing.

loans.name: Andal Group

texts.fr:
Mme KADIATA BINGUEL représente le groupe ANDAL. Elle se porte bien. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.
 Mme vend des bouteilles de gaz et pagnes depuis 03ans. Son crédit passé s’est bien déroulé. Mme est très contente. Elle s’approvisionne à sodigaz pour le gaz et au marché du secteur 10 pour les pagnes. Ses clients sont les amis voisins. 
Elle veut s’acheter 25 pièces de pagnes 15 complets bazin et 20 bouteilles de gaz. 
Mme veut utiliser ses économies pour améliorer son activité et épargner. Elle ambitionne aider à la scolarisation des enfants dont elle a la charge.
texts.en: Kadiata Binguel is the Andal group representative. She is doing well. She is single and has no children. She has 2 people in her care. She has been selling gas cylinders and pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African fabric) for 3 years. Her previous loan was successful and she is very happy. She gets her gas supplies at Sodigaz and her pagnes at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are friends and neighbours. She would like to buy 25 pieces of pagnes, 15 damask suits and 20 gas cylinders. She wants to use her savings to improve her business and build more savings. She aims to help the children that she is raising get an education.

loans.use: to buy 25 pieces of pagnes, 15 damask suits and 20 gas cylinders.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $600.00 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, books, pens, pencils, bread and salt.  She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Maria independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, books, pens, pencils, bread and salt.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is a 25-year-old married man from Garcia, Bohol. He is engaged in a farming business. He grows rice. He earns 3000 PHP per month. This is the source of his income. His wife is a housekeeper.

Ritchel is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. This will be used in his farm so that his rice crops will grow healthier. Through the help of this loan, he will be able to buy the fertilizer.

In the future, Ritchel hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Recarte

texts.en: Recarte earns a living through his sari-sari or variety store business. He lives in Bohol, Philippines. He sells various goods and commodities to the people in his place. He is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell such as canned goods, rice, soda, noodles, soap, and toiletries. With this, he will be able to sell more products to the people in his place thus increasing his sales and profit. In the future, Recarte hopes to expand his business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell such as canned goods, rice, soda, noodles, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Dukomezegusenga Group

texts.fr:
Barnabé fait partie du groupe  Dukomezegusenga et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 38 ans et est marié à Euphrasie, une commerçante.  Ensemble ils ont 4  enfants  âgés de  10 à 14 ans,  tous  étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de pièces de rechange automobiles  depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son  neuvième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de pièces de rechange à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait avoir son propre garage  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: Barnabé is a member of the Dukomezegusenga group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 38 years old and married to Euphrasie, a retailer. The couple have 4 children, aged between 10 and 14 years old, who all attend school. He has been selling spare parts for cars for 5 years. This is his 9th loan from Turame. The Kiva-sponsored loan that he receives will increase his capital and allow him to buy a lot of spare parts for resale, to earn more money. In the coming years, he would like to own his own garage and see his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 48-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 12 to 25 years. She describes herself to be determined and hard-working. She operates a farm and retail business where she sells cereals such as maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a viable business environment and her primary customers are local residents. Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be high transportation costs. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy cereals to sell. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Lagmentaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZOENABO est la représentante du groupe LAGMENTAABA. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 09ans le moins âgé a 2ans. 01 de ses enfants va à l’école et elle a 04 personnes à sa charge.
Mme est tisseuse. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de cissin. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et les amis.
Mme veut  s’acheter  03 balles de fils de tisse, 15kg de teinture et un peu de bois de chauffe.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut s’occupe de la scolarité de ses enfants  et épargne un peu. Mme ambitionne toujours ouvrir un atelier de tissage.
texts.en:
Zoenabo is the Lagmentaaba group representative. She is married and the mother of 3 children. The eldest is 9 years old and the youngest, 2. One of her children attends school and she has 4 people in her care.

Zoenabo is a weaver. She has been in this line of work for 4 years. She gets her supplies at the Cissin market. Her customers are women, men and friends. She would like to buy 3 bobbins of sewing thread, 15 kgs of dye and some firewood. With her profits, she would like to take care of her children's education and build some savings. She still aims to open a weaving workshop.

loans.use: to buy 3 bobbins of sewing thread, 15 kgs of dye and some firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for his transportation service.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a 62-year-old married man. He has seven children. He describes himself to be a social and jovial man. He operates a food stall where he sells snacks such as doughnuts. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located at a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of ingredients used for preparing the snacks. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing snacks to sell at his food stall. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay a loan of KES 10,000.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing snacks to sell.

loans.name: 3.5.238.10.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiên works in the agriculture sector farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.
