She is 42-years-old and is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 3.5.238.10.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of seven members. Hiên supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, which is a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2004, Hiên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiên has successfully repaid six loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hiên hopes for her business to do well, make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Divine Bonte Group

texts.fr:
Mme Marie Augustine est la représentante du groupe DIVINE BONTE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 33ans et le moins âgé a 03ans 02mois. 01 va à l’école et elle a 01 personne en charge.
Elle fabrique et vend le savon liquide et en boule depuis 03ans. Mme s’approvisionne à Faso chimie en cité AN III en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes, les gérants de boutique et le voisinage.
Mme veut s’acheter 100 litres d’huile de coco, 03 sac de soude, 03 sac de carbonate et 60 litres de beurre de karité pour la fabrication du savon.
Mme utilise ses économies pour satisfaire ses commandes. Elle n’a pas pu acquérir sa deuxième machine donc elle ambitionne toujours s’acheter une deuxième machine de transformation et ouvrir un magasin.
texts.en: Marie Augustine is the Divine Bonte group representative. She is married and has 3 children. The eldest is 33 years old and the youngest, 3 years and 2 months. One child attends school and she has one more person in her care. She has been making and selling liquid soap and soap balls for 3 years. She gets her supplies from Faso Chimie in the Cité AN III part of town. Her customers are women, men, shop owners and the neighbourhood inhabitants. She would like to buy 100 litres of coconut oil, 3 bags of soda, 3 bags of carbonate and 60 litres of shea butter with which to make soap. She uses her savings to fulfill her orders. She has not been able to buy her second machine and therefore still aims to buy a second processing machine and open a shop.

loans.use: to buy 100 litres of coconut oil, 3 bags of soda, 3 bags of carbonate and 60 litres of shea butter with which to make soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic slippers.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in the Airport community in Magibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia.  She is 30 years old and married; her husband is a security guard and they have two children, ages 3 and 12.  

Since 2000, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She likes how people respond to her business - and the thing she most likes is the interaction with customers. 

Edith is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  She plans to buy land, and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 43 years old, married and lives in Buchanan, the capital of Ground Bassa County. Buchanan is good at producing fish for the local Liberian market. 

Ruth has four children between 16 and 24 years old. She runs a shop in which she sells cosmetics to her community. She enjoys her business because it makes her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics for her business.  With the income from her business she hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta is 27 years old and lives in Montserrado county, which is the largest commercial county in Liberia. She lives with her boyfriend and their three children. The children are two to eight years old, and all of them are in school.

For 5 years, Satta has been selling frozen foods in her community market -- for example, chicken, pigs' feet, and fish. She started her business with money given to her by her boyfriend. She makes more profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more frozen foods for inventory. Her plan is to expand her business, even more.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods for inventory, to expand her sales

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Fatmata from Moriba town Bo Southern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 5 years and 19 years.

To earning a living, Fatmata runs a fish business where she sells fish within a busy market area. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 7 days per week, and 8 hour per day, 6 days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says despite the challenges of storage of fish, she is very hard working and desire to educate her children up to university.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy different kinds of fish. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children school fees and increase her fish business. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fish for her business in the market

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Abdul. He is married and has three children, aged 14, 12, and 5 years. Two of them are school-going children. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because she is attending school.

In 2003, Abdul established his clothing business. He began his business because he dropped out of school, due to a lack of financial support. His uncle advised Abdul to join him in his business, because it was the only way he could help him. He had no alternative but to join his uncle, and trade with him from place to place. He worked with his uncle until years later, when he started his own business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 925,000 every month from this business.

Abdul would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. He requires a loan in order to purchase jeans, baby clothes, T-shirts, underwear, towels and skirts. The loan will help him to earn additional income. He hopes to repay his loan at the contract period, in order to be eligible for subsequent loans. He is a hard-working and competitive businessman.

Abdul plans to expand his business in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more clothing to resell

loans.name: Gatrude

texts.en:
Gatrude is 44 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is single with four children between the ages of four and twenty-three. She has a tenth grade education. 

For five years, Gatrude has been selling fashion clothes in the local market. She started this business with funds given to her by her mother and with knowledge of this trade learned from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 37 years old, single, and lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County – that is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She has two children, ages 4 and 7 years old, that are in school and live at home. She stopped her education at Grade 7. For the past five years, she has been selling used clothes from a table in the local market. She focuses on used clothes because sellers of used clothes are not many in the market where she sells, and customers are many. She established her business with a loan from her mother. She enjoys the independence her business gives her. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Bassie

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Bassie.  She is married and has four children, aged 8, 5, 3, and 1 year. Two of the children are school-going children.

In 2009, Bassie established her general store business, selling items like peak milk, mayonnaise, sardine, sweets, batteries, biscuits, cigarettes, and soap. She began her business because she did not attend school, her parents being people who did not see value in educating a girl child.  She used to assist her mother in business.  After she got married, her husband opened a shop for her to run.  Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,158,000 every month from this business.

Bassie would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Bassie requires a loan in order to buy inventory, like Ovaltine, powered milk, baby food, sweets, cigarettes, toilet paper, soap, and batteries. In the future, Bassie plans to educate her children, open another shop and become an international businesswoman.  This loan will help to expand the current business.  Frequent changes in the prices of items, is her major business challenge. She is a hard-working and trustworthy businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy inventory, like Ovaltine, powered milk, baby food, sweets, cigarettes, toilet paper, soap, and batteries.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is the lady standing in front of her store/kitchen. She prepares pastries like meat pies, spring rolls and doughnuts for sale, which she has done for 15 years.  

Eunice is married and has three children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying her children’s school fees.  

Eunice will use her loan to purchase flour, cooking oil, meat, chicken and other ingredients which will be needed in her pastries preparation. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, meat, chicken and other ingredients which will be needed in her pastries preparation.

loans.name: Streves

texts.en: Streves sells vehicle spare parts. This he has done for 20 years. He is married with three children. He uses his income to provide shelter, food and clothes for his children. Streves will use his loan to acquire more spare parts and tools to sell. With the new profit, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to acquire more spare parts and tools to sell

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a 42-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He operates a retail store where he sells timber. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy and competitive business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy timber to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is married and has six children. She operates a snack bar where she sells soft drinks and pastries. She's managed the business for eight years. Dora uses her income to help her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills. Dora will use her loan to to purchase a variety of soft drinks to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa cooks the traditional corn and cassava dough, banku, for sale. Adwowa serves her banku recipe with fried fish, peppers and tomatoes sauce in  Asafora near Cape Coast. She is  a widow and has five children.   

Adwowa has been in this business for 20 years now. She uses her income to take care of the general upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of maize and fish that she needs in preparing her banku and accompanying side dishes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better stall for the sale of her prepared food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku (traditional corn and cassava dough) for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 42 years old, married and has been blessed with four children. He owns a shop and has been in business for the past 14 years. He previously used to be a supplier of shoes in his area. He is God-fearing and very hardworking. He describes his business as very busy and competitive. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy stock for his shop.

He hopes to open a wholesale shop. He requires a loan of 28,231 KES (Kenyan shillings) to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: 3.6.239.thiệu Nguyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiệp works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future. Hiệp  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is 65 years old and she is married with 2 children. Hiệp is the group leader of the 3.6.239.Thiệu Nguyên solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Her children are grown up so she supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Hiệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hiệp  hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 4 years. She describes herself to be a social and risk taking woman. She operates a food stall where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of vegetables and fruits. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 8 children and has been doing this work for 10 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, among other crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Feeding my dairy cow!' Her biggest challenge is 'Transportation of milk to the market.' One of the animals in the farm is named “lelmo”.

Mary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Fair interest rates.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'managing farming as a business.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Mary replied 'More disposable income and better nutrition for the children.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mary owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is a 56-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 14 years to 20 years. He describes himself as a determined man. He operates motorcycle and retail businesses through which he provides transportation services and sells cereals. He has been involved in these businesses for 2 years. His business is located at a ready market. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to purchase ten bags of maize to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of maize.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a 25-year-old married man. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a welding business where he provides the service of welding windows, doors, roofs, etc. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy welding materials. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man. He has a child who is 5 years old. He describes himself to be a business-oriented man. He operates a farm stand and a restaurant where he sells coffee, snacks, tea and food. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy baking flour and cooking oil. His business goal is to run a bakery within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man. He has a child who is 5 years old. He describes himself to be a business-oriented and determined man. He operates a farm stand where he sells coffee. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are daily consumers from the neighborhood. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy fertilizer and baking flour. His business goal is to buy land to expand his farming business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 35-year-old single woman. She has a child who is 15 years old. She describes herself to be an optimistic woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits such as mangoes, oranges, etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located within a potential business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fruits to sell. Her business goal is to be a major supplier of fruits within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, after managing to repay a previous loan of 10,000 KES.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha lives in Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three school-going children. She owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for ten years

Asha learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations. 

Asha is applying for a loan of 85,900 Kenya shillings (KES) to add retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. to her store. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children. She looks forward to owning a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two school-going children. For the past 5 years, Asha has owned and run a food café, mainly selling cooked food. She also earns additional income from the rental houses owned by the family. The area has a large population, most of whom work on the island and return to the mainland in the evenings, with little time to prepare meals. 

Asha learned about Milango through advertisements. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations. Asha is applying for a loan of 43,200 Kenya shillings to buy retail and food stock such as rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc. Asha will use the extra income from the loan for savings, to improve her family's living standard and to pay school fees for her children. She looks forward to owning a large business space and a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice, cereals, wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She owns a green grocery, a business which she has been operating for four years.

Nancy learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the high cost of transportation while sourcing her goods.

Nancy is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables and fruits at wholesale. The extra income she earns as a result of this loan will help her pay for school fees. Her aspiration is to own a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking oil and wheat flour for the restaurant and buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds to sow.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David, 39 years old, married to Getruda and a father of four children, has been selling charcoal in Kangemi for four years now, earning a monthly income of forty thousand shillings. This will be David's first loan with KADET LTD, which he plans to use to buy 15 sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future he wants to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy 15 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en:
Maseray is 35 years old, married, and has two children, ages 7 and 12. Both of her children go to school. 

She runs a store selling palm oil and gari in Moriba Town in Sierra Leone. She works at the business for 9 hours per day, 7 days per week. Maseray says that transportation to her store every day is difficult and is the main challenge facing her business.   

Maseray has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil and gari to grow her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the life and education of her children. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and gari to grow her business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 33-year-old married man. He has a 1-year-old and a 5-year-old child. He describes himself to be a social and business-oriented man. He operates a motorcycle business where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the frequent breakdowns of his motorcycle. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be a business-oriented woman. She operates a retail store where she sells detergents. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. Dorcas will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase pigs for starting a new business of reselling them. Her business goal is to open a new retail shop within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM  after managing to pay a loan of Kes 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy pigs for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has two children, ages 5 and 8 years old. He describes himself to be a jovial and ambitious man. He operates a tailoring retail store where he sells the clothes he makes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a strategic business area and his primary customers are schools and the general public. 

Joseph describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for business expansion. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a sewing machine. His business goal is to run a boutique within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a personal car. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 35-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be an ambitious and creative man. He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruit. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a potential and reliable business area and his primary customers are local dwellers.

Nicholas describes his biggest business challenge to be quick perishability of vegetables and fruit. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruit to sell. His business goal is to run a wholesale green grocery business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have expanded his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM, having paid successfully a loan of Kes 20,000.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be a humble man. He operates a tailoring retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a shortage of funds to improve his tailoring business.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fabric. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is now 46 years old, he has been practicing dairy farming with a very good income for the past 12 years. 

He is requesting his fifth loan which is a school loan to pay school fees for his  children. He has a good credit history with KADET LTD. 


His business is doing well and his income is great.

loans.use: to pay school fees for  his children

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is still in the farming business in her home area and she says that the previous loans boosted her farming activities. She is still planting cash crops like maize, beans and potatoes. She is also still married to George who is also a farmer, and their two children are doing fine.

This will be her second loan in the amount of KES. 20,000 and she plans to use it to buy fertilizer, maize and potato seeds for planting in her farm during this planting season.

In the future, Martha hopes to grow her farming business and plant more cash crops hence make more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en:
Wambua is a 52 year old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 25 years. 

He describes himself to be determined man, and he operates a retail store where he sells curios. He has been involved in this business for 23 years, and his business is located at a busy market area where his primary customers are tourist and local residents . He describes his biggest business challenge to be high monthly rates such as electricity, city council etc. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy curios to sell. His business goal is to run several outlets  within 5 years. 

Wambua hopes that in the future, he will pay his children's school fees with the profit generated from his business. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of Kes 100,000 previously which he managed to pay.

loans.use: to buy curios to sell

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna is a 45-year-old married woman. She has a daughter who is 22 years old. She describes herself to be an honest woman. Previously, Kuvuna was selling herbal medicine to customers.  She decided to start a new business of retail business where she has been selling cereals, plastic items, firewood, slippers for the last three years to increase her business income. Her business is located at a viable business area and she describes her biggest business challenge to be the high transportation cost of cereal to her business and customers. 

She will use the 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy cereals to sell. Her business goal is to run a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Shuvyanne

texts.en:
Shuvyanne is a married woman. She has a child who is one year old. She describes herself to be a faithful woman. She operates a hardware store  where she sells items such as spanners, paints, bolts, bicycle spare parts etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are local residents. 

Shuvyanne describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy bicycle spare to sell. Her business goal is to run a wholesale hardware shop  within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase  bicycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, materials, and secondhand clothes

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man. He describes himself as hard working, optimistic and a determined man. He operates  rental houses business where he provides rental housing accommodation services. His business is located within a viable business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding his business. He will use the 100,000 KES loan to pay for the construction of a septic tank. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. In addition, Moses runs a retail shop and provides transport services.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a septic tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more dry maize to sell

loans.name: Patrick Kinyanjui

texts.en:
Patrick is still progressing with his farming activities though he got a divorce from his wife. He says that the farming business has been very good and his income increased to KES. 15,000 per month which he uses to improve his living standards. 

Patrick is applying for the second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully.  He will use the loan to buy a heifer. With the anticipated profit from farming, Patrick will expand his farming activities. 

His dreams are to start a business where he will be buying and selling livestock.

loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is 36 years old and is married with two children, and lives in Mwambalazi, Kenya. Her major monthly expenditure is the payment of school fees.

Chizi owns a fish stall where she sells fish as a business. She has been doing this for 2 years now. She has requested a loan of KSH 10,000 to buy fish to resell.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila has a well-stocked grocery store. She says that she started with a small store, and now it is a grocery store. It has gone very well for her, and she has regular customers.

She's requesting this loan to buy beverages, canned goods, vegetables, and other supplies for her business because these are the most popular items.

She's grateful for the help she gets.

loans.use: To buy beverages, canned goods, vegetables, and other supplies

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia, aged 34, is the mother of two daughters: Jane, 6, is attending pre-primary school, and Agnes is 2 years old. She has been running a food stall business for more than 3 years, and it helps her provide for her family.

She is approaching for loan amounting to 30000 KES to buy 30 litres of cooking oil, bundles of wheat flour, and a sack of maize.

loans.use: to buy 30 litres of cooking oil, bundles of wheat flour, and a sack of maize.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 31 years old and married with three children. She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. All her children are schooling and so her major monthly expenditure is school fees. She owns her shop where she sells home-use items. In addition she also operates a poultry business which she sells to restaurant operators. She has approached with a loan request amounting to 40,000 Kenyan shillings to restock her shop and buy soft drinks, bundles of wheat flour, sacks of maize flour and cooking oil and add chicks for her poultry business. She is grateful for such an opportunity.

loans.use: to restock her shop and buy soft drinks, bundles of wheat flour, sacks of maize flour and cooking oil and add chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a 43-year-old woman, who is married and has five children. She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya, with her husband. All their children are in school. They live in a rented house; therefore, her monthly major expenditures are school fees and rent.

She owns a charcoal stall, where she sells charcoal. She has approached Yehu for a loan amounting to KES 20,000, which she will use to buy firewood and sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to buy firewood and sacks of charcoal to resell at the stall.

loans.name: Juleit

texts.en: Juleit is a 34-year-old married woman. She has four children who are all still in school. She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. Her major monthly expenditure is school fees payment and food. She owns a cereal stall business where she buys and sells maize and beans. She has approached us with a loan request of Ksh 20,000 to buy sacks of beans, maize and rice. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of beans, maize and rice.

loans.name: Leah Kwamboka

texts.en:
Leah is 48 years old, single, and supporting her only child. She is a dairy farmer and her business has been in operation for a period of 11 years. Her monthly income amounts to KES. 18,000. 

She is servicing her seventh loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase dairy feeds. The anticipated profits will used to educate her child. She has been repaying her loans well.

Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to purchase a plot of land and construct rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feeds

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: NIcholas, 59, is married, hard-working entrepreneur who lives with his wife and seven children, five of whom attend school. He is the breadwinner in his family. He owns a shop where he sells home-use items such as cereals, cooking oil, sugar and flour. He has requested a loan of KSH20,000 to buy bundles of wheat flour and sacks of maize flour. He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour and sacks of maize flour.

loans.name: Muthawali

texts.en:
Muthawali is a 34-year-old married man living in Kaloleni, Kenya. He has four children, all of whom are in school. His biggest monthly expense is the payment of their school fees. 

Muthawali owns and runs a general store selling house consumables. He is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings so that he can purchase stock of rice, floor, sugar and washing detergents.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, floor, sugar and washing detergents.

loans.name: Kafadzi

texts.en:
Kafadzi, 34, is married and has four children. He lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. All of Kafadzi's children are in school, making school fees one of his major monthly expenditures.

Kafadzi owns a butcher shop. He is requesting loan of KSH 50,000 to buy cattle to slaughter and sell. He is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy cattle to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Luis Malaquias

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Luis no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar fútbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja en una veterinaria, como chofer recogiendo y llevando a sus domicilios a los animalitos, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su puntualidad y responsabilidad.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el trámite para la renovación de su brevete y licencia de conducir, ya que este se encuentra a poco tiempo de vencer, de esta manera él podrá circular formalmente y sin problemas en la ciudad, así pues Luis seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y un negocio comercial.
texts.en:
Luis is a 26-year old man who lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings. He is kind, hard-working and enthusiastic, and has a great ambition for self-improvement. Unfortunately, Luis couldn't study a professional degree due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work to help his parents; however, he would really like to do it. He likes to play soccer with his friends in his spare time and occasionally cooks a delicious Ají de Gallina to share with his family. 

He took the initiative to work, with a lot of tenacity and dedication, at a veterinary clinic. He works as a driver, picking up and taking the little animals to their homes, every day from very early in the morning and for approximately 8 hours. He enjoys his job and thinks things are going well thanks to his punctuality and responsibility. 

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders given that, thanks to their support, he will be able to renew his soon-to-be-expired driving license. This way he will drive legally and avoid problems in the city, and will continue to work hard to achieve his big dream of having his own house and a commercial business.

loans.use: to renew his driving license.

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina is a 24-year old married mother with two young children who lives in the southern part of Albania. She has worked as an on-call midwife for the surrounding villages for the last three years. She has also been selling hamburgers to schools and villages nearby through her street hamburger food stall. Her husband, Vilson, with whom she is photographed, helps her with the hamburger food stall, which has the potential to be a "good profit maker" according to them.

Dorina is requesting this loan to replace the old grill, repair the hamburger food stall and add some more items to resell.

Dorina and Vilson are planning to add some tables later on, so people can be served while sitting down.

loans.use: To repair her hamburger food stall, replace the old grill and add some more items to resell.

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita is a 45-year-old Egyptian married mother of one grown-up child. She and her family live in a rural village in the southern part of Albania, unlike other members of their community who for generations have been living in the suburbia of major cities.

Lindita has been selling secondhand items, particularly shoes, in the local market of a little town near their village. Even though she has been the only one to support her family financially, she proudly claims that she has been able to secure not only the basics for the family but she also has been able to earn a bit more than that.

Lindita is requesting a loan now to buy more secondhand items to resell.

loans.use: To buy inventory of secondhand shoes to resell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis vive en Libertad, tiene 37 años. Su negocio lo hace vendiendo frutas en el mercado. Pero para obtener mas dinero tambien realiza el trabaja de recolector de basura este trabajo lo realiza solo en la madrugada hasta las 02:00pm; después del trabajo como recolector Luis acude al negocio que trabaja conjunto con su esposa de venta de frutas y legumbres, este negocio lo tienen en la parte delantera de su casa.

La mayor dificultad  es la  delincuencia por lo que sale en la madrugada a trabajar como recolector. Esta casado, Tiene dos hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar frutas y legumbres para diversificar mejor su negocio. El sueño del cliente es que su negocio se mantenga porque él es quien mantiene su hogar; además también quiere poder lograr a terminar su casa porque es de caña y quiere hacerla de cemento.
texts.en:
Luis, 37, lives in Libertad and his business is selling fruit from his house.  He also works as a trash collector to earn more money but does that just from dawn until 2pm.  After he finishes his job as a trash collector he works with his wife selling fruit and vegetables, from their home.

His greatest difficulty is crime because he heads out at dawn to work as a collector.  He’s married, and he has two children attending public school.

He wants to use the loan to buy fruit and vegetables for his business.  His dream is that his business stays stable because he’s the only source of support for his home. He also wants to be able to finish building his house because it’s currently made from sugarcane stalks and he wants to make it out of cement.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es:
La clienta Martha vive en Libertad, tiene 40 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo ropa luego fue incrementando poco a poco su negocio.    
El trabajo lo realiza sola, en todo el día. En los casos que tiene mucho trabajo o de alguna emergencia familiar o necesidad le ayuda el esposo, le va muy bien con la ayuda de Dios. 

Está casada y su esposo le ayuda trabajando como chofer de un taxi, no tiene hijos, tanto ella como el esposo se ayudan para salir adelante en los gastos del hogar.

Con el préstamo la clienta quiere comprar blusas, pantalones, interiores para su negocio y asi siga creciendo e invirtiendo en más mercadería para así poder obtener mayores ingresos y poder pagar los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Martha, age 40, lives in Libertad.  She started her business selling clothes.  Then, she was increasing her business little by little.

She works alone all day.  On occasions when she has a lot of work or a family emergency, her husband helps her.  With God’s help it is going very well for her.

She is married.  Her husband helps her by working as a taxi driver.  She does not have children.  She and her husband help each other to get ahead with the household expenses.

She wants to use the loan to buy blouses, pants, and underwear so that her business will continue growing.  She wants to continue investing in more merchandise in order to be able to have greater income and to be able to pay for the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like blouses, pants, and underwear.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha vive en Libertad, tiene 41 años de edad. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa siempre lo ha hecho desde muy joven junto a su mama. En la actualidad tiene su propio negocio en donde le va muy bien. 

Este trabajo lo realiza sola todo el día, ella es una persona enferma que requiere de ayuda, no está casada, es un amujer soltera con hijos, los hijos ya no estudian son mayores de edad y trabajan. Le a tocado ser madre y padre para sus hijos y sola se esfuerza para seguir adelante dandoles un mejor bienestar asu familia.

Con este prestamo quiere comprar blusas, pantalones e interiores para asi poder comprar mas mercadería para que su negocio siga creciendo y así pode regenar mayores ingresos y tener un hogar lleno de armonia.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha lives in Libertad and is 41 years of age.  She has a business of selling clothes.  Martha has always been in this line of work since she began doing this as a young woman with her mother.  At the moment, she manages her own business and is doing very well.

Martha works every day by herself, but she needs assistance since she is a person who is not well.  She is not married and has children who are not studying since they are grown and working.  Martha has been both mother and father to her children, so she has strived to move them forward by herself and provide for her family’s welfare.  

With this loan, Martha will buy blouses, trousers, and undergarments.  By purchasing more merchandise for her business, she will be able to keep growing and generate more income.  This will allow her to have a harmonious household.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, and undergarments.

loans.name: Luriana

texts.en:
Luriana is a 33-year-old, married, Egyptian mother of three children, ages 11, 7 and 5. She and her family have been living within their community in a major city in the southern part of Albania. For the past two years, she has been running a little variety store in her neighborhood. To stock up on some additional items to sell, she needed a “little loan,” as stated by her, of 50,000 ALL.

Luriana dreams of educating her children in the future. "I was never given the opportunity to get an education myself, just like almost everyone in my community, so, I will make sure that my children get one," she says. "Being vulnerable is a status that follows you all your life, whether you want it to or not."

loans.use: To stock her variety store with additional items to sell.

loans.name: Manushaqe

texts.en:
Manushaqe, a villager in her late 50s, is an Egyptian married woman who lives in the rural part of southern Albania. She lives very poorly as you can see from her picture; in the background is her tiny house. Manushaqe is known by people in her village for her faith in God as well as her hardworking attitude and gentle nature.

For the past 10 years, she has been planting potatoes in the land she owns and selling them to local stores in a nearby main city. The soil in this region is good for growing potatoes and onions as well. 

A loan of 150,000 ALL will help Manushaqe to buy potato seeds to plant soon. This will be her fourth loan, with the previous ones being all paid off on time.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer lives in a small town outside of Ukunda, close to the Kenyan coast. She has been farming for 23 years, and is currently growing passion fruit on her land. 

Jennifer has four children, and hopes to use some of the income from the hives she will buy with this loan to build additions to her house. She hopes to make significant improvements to her farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement her income.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in a small town near Ukunda, close to the Kenyan coast. She is currently retired, and has five children. She likes beekeeping because she enjoys eating honey, and is excited that Honey Care employees will help take care of her beehives. This is her first loan to buy beehives, and she plans to use the extra income from her hives to build a house.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement her income.

loans.name: Ndegwa

texts.en:
Ndegwa lives in a town called Mwanduda, in the Kwale province of eastern Kenya. He is married with four children, and he and his wife have been farming for 35 years. He is currently growing citrus plants, as well as jatropha, a hardy shrub with seeds that are currently being used to make biodiesel. 

This is his first Kiva loan, and he plans to use the income generated from the beehives he will buy to help pay for school fees. One day, Ndegwa hopes to start a horticulture farm on his land.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement his income.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en: Japhet lives in Mwanduda, a small town close to the Kenyan coast. He farms passion fruit with his wife, and they have four children. He is excited about beekeeping, as he sees it as a good source of income, and is particularly enthusiastic about the guaranteed market that Honey Care provides for his honey. This is his first loan to buy beehives, and he hopes to use it to help pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement his income.

loans.name: Glenda Rosario

texts.es:
Glenda vive en Libertad, tiene 40 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio primero con un pequeño bazar, por interés propio, poco a poco fue poniendo un cyber el cual le trajo mejores ganancias.	

Trabaja todo el día en su casa junto a su hija que le ayuda, no tiene dificultades porque el negocio se encuentra en casa, cada día se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su familia.

Está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la pesca, tiene un hijo menor de edad que estudia en una escuela fiscal, y el cual junto a su esposo se esfuerzan  para darles un mejor vivir.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar impresoras y confites para ganar más dinero. En el futuro quiere seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en: Glenda, 40, lives in Libertad.  She started her business on her own initiative first with a small variety store and gradually installed an Internet café that produced higher profits.  She works all day at home with help from her daughter.  She has no difficulties because the business is located at home.  She strives daily to move her family forward.  She’s married and her husband works fishing.  She has a minor son who attends public school.  She and her husband strive to give them a better life.  She wants to use the loan to buy printers and snacks to earn more money.  In future, she’d like to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy printers and snacks.

loans.name: Gisela Alexandra

texts.es:
La clienta Gisela vive en Libertad, tiene 36 años de edad. Ella aprendió a tener un negocio así por el papá que fue el primero de la familia que logró tener el negocio de una Lubricadora. Todos los hermanos tienen una lubricadora.
El trabajo lo realiza junto a su esposo que se queda en el negocio. No tiene ninguna dificultad ya que su negocio lo tiene en su propio hogar.
Está casada, tiene un hijo menor de edad que estudia en una escuela fiscal, para su esposo y ella su hijo son su esfuerzo para seguir adelante cada día y obtener todo lo que se propongan sobre todo con la ayuda de Dios.
Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceite, baterias para autos y más su negocio dando así todo tipo de servicio de autos. Es lo que le gusta hacer.
texts.en:
Gisela, age 36, lives in Libertad.  She learned how to have a business from her father.  He was the first in the family to manage to have a 'lubricadora' (a place that carries out vehicle oil changes).

She works with her husband, who stays in the business.  She does not have any difficulty because her business is at her own house.

She is married and has one minor child.  Her child goes to a public school.  For Gisela and her husband, their child is their strength in order to get ahead every day and to get everything they propose, especially with God’s help.

She wants to use the loan to buy oil, automobile batteries, and more.  This way her business will provide all types of services for automobiles.  It is what she likes to do.

loans.use: to buy oil and auto batteries.

loans.name: Kleber Alfredo

texts.es:
Kleber vive en Libertad, tiene 26 años. El comenzó el negocio desde muy pequeño vendiendo junto a su tía desde ese entonces le gusto y así poco a poco fue siendo independiente hasta para lograr obtener su propio capital y así poder obtener un negocio.

El trabajo de venta de ropa lo realiza junto a su esposa todos los fines de semana, la dificultad que cruza día a día son los accidentes y robos.

Tiene dos hijos menores edad y estudian en una escuela fiscal, el cual son el esfuerzo de cada día para seguir adelante y no darse por vencido. 

Con este préstamo quiere poder comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas. Su sueño es poder tener un local comercial en el centro de la ciudad donde sería mayor las ventas para lograr así mayores ingresos y tener un mejo bienestar para él y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Kleber lives in Libertad, and is 26 years of age. He started his business at a young age, when he would go out selling with his aunt. He liked this work from the start, and little by little he became more independent, until he was able to obtain his own capital and start his own business. He works selling clothing alongside his wife, working every weekend. The difficulties he faces on a day-to-day basis are accidents and theft.

Kleber has two children (both minors) who study in a public school. They are the driving force behind his daily effort to get ahead and never give up. With this loan Kleber wants to be able to buy slacks, blouses and shirts. His dream is to have commercial premises in the center of the city where his sales will be higher. This will allow him to have greater income, and will improve his own wellbeing and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and shirts

loans.name: Merly Liliana

texts.es:
Merly es una mujer de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su pequeño hijo de 2 años, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzo por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es madre y padre para él; gracias a su esfuerzo Merly pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta realizar trabajados menores y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Merly trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, adicionalmente realiza pequeños trabajos de enfermería cuidando a algunos ancianos, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Merly cree que  le va bien por el trato amable y cordial que brinda a sus clientes.
Merly se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, como cremas, cosméticos, perfumes, maquillaje y otros, de esta manera Merly tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una gran tienda comercial.
texts.en:
Merly is 31 years old and lives with her two-year-old son in the city of Chiclayo, in the district of Guadalupe.  She is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her efforts to providing for her son, as she is both mother and father to him.

Thanks to her determination and hard work, Merly was able to study to become a nurse.  In her free moments she likes to do small chores and on occasion she cooks a delicious Arroz con Pollo [rice with chicken] to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and determination, Merly works at her small beauty products business.  In addition, she does small nursing jobs in which she cares for the elderly.  She works every day from early in the morning for about ten hours each day.  Merly believes that her business is going well because of the kind and friendly service she gives her customers.

Merly is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise for her business, such as creams, cosmetics, perfumes, makeup and others.  This will allow Merly to better stock her business and to sell to more customers.  In this way she will continue working and striving to achieve her greatest dream, which is to have a large commercial store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as creams, cosmetics, perfumes and makeup.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana lives with her husband in a small town close to the Kenyan coast. She and her husband have four children. They have been farming for 38 years. They currently grow yellow passion fruit on their land. The region they live in is famous for its tangy, high-quality passion fruit. This is her first loan, and she is excited about working with Honey Care, whom she says "provides xcellent customer service."

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement her income.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea lives in Kakamega county in western Kenya. He is a widower, and has been farming his land for over 40 years. He is currently growing maize, and is happy that Honey Care will provide free services for his beehives, which he describes as a good source of income. He and his wife had 10 children, who themselves now have children, and he plans to use the proceeds from his hives to help pay his grandchildren's school fees. He hopes one day to live a better life with his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement his income.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis lives in Kakamega county in western Kenya. He has been farming for 25 years, and is married with seven children. His wife is also a farmer, and together they grow maize and keep poultry. He likes beekeeping because it is an activity that is easy to handle, and he hopes to use some of the income generated from the hives obtained with this loan to expand his poultry business.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement his income.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente nació en Guayaquil. El cliente era albañil pero para mejorar sus ingresos comenzo con un negocio de venta de jugos y tostadas. Ya tiene 12 años en esta actividad, tiene un puesto en la principal de la perimetral donde hay mucha fluides de personas ya que es una calle principal,  esta actividad le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia. 

Esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposa desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde.
Tiene una hija con discapacidad auditiva que en este momento se encuentra en tratamiento por eso el trabaja todos los dias para darle una mejor oportunidad a su hija. El cliente  también mantiene a su nieta y le pago los estudios.

El quiere seguir ayudando a su hija y a su familia por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo frutas, panes, maquina para juagos. Las metas o sueños del cliente es tener por lo menos dos carretas mas de jugos y seguir construyendo vivienda.
texts.en:
The client was born in Guayaquil.  He was a bricklayer.  However, in order to improve his income he started a business of selling juices and tostadas.  He has had this business activity for 12 years.  

He has a stand along an important part of the Perimetral Highway where there are a lot of people passing by.  This is because it is a main street.  This business activity has allowed him to improve his income and that of his family.  He does this work together with his wife from six in the morning until four in the afternoon.

He has a daughter with a hearing impairment.  She is now receiving treatment, and he works every day in order to give his daughter a better opportunity.  The client also supports his granddaughter, and he paid for her education.

He wants to continue helping his daughter and his family.  Therefore, he wants to use the loan to buy fruits, breads, and a juice machine.  The goals or dreams of the client are to have a least two more juice carts and to continue building his home.

loans.use: to buy fruits, breads, and a juice machine.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil, tiene un negocio de pesca el cual lo empezó de manera independiente ya que el oficio lo aprendió desde que era un niño de su papá, este trabajo lo realiza desde las cuatro de la mañana hasta las doce del día y tiene a dos personas quienes les ayudan en los pedidos de pescados.

Una de las dificultades del cliente es no tener una estremidad de su cuerpo que es su mano, la perdió hace 10 años. Debido a esto le dificulta su trabajo; pero no se da por vencido pese a su dificultad logra seguir adelante para poder sustentar a su familia. Ya que está casado, y tiene tres hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal, y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar una maquina para poder pescar mejor. El sueño que tiene el cliente es poder mejorar su vivienda y poder educar mejor a sus hijos ya que el tiene mucha fe en ellos.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil.  He has a fish business that he started on his own, because he learned this trade from his father when he was a child.  He works from 4 in the morning until noon, and he has 2 people who help him with the fish orders.

One of the difficulties this borrower faces is that he is missing one of his hands, which he lost 10 years ago.  Because of this, the work is difficult for him.  But he doesn't give up; in spite of this difficulty, he has managed to keep moving forward so that he can support his family.  He is married and has 3 children who attend a public school.  His wife is a housewife who takes care of the household tasks.

With this loan, he wants to buy a machine so that he can fish better.  He dreams of being able to improve his house and provide his children with a better education, because he has a lot of faith in them.

loans.use: to buy a machine for his fishing business

loans.name: Las Almendras. Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Almendras está conformado por ocho integrantes, madres solteras, con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Son personas muy trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente ninguna pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. Por lo tanto luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus pequeños hijos. 
La coordinadora del banco comunal Las Almendras, es Concepción la cual se encarga de las responsabilidad de pago de las integrantes, en tiempo y forma, Concepción tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles  en  cantidades pequeñas como sobre de shapoo, sobre de café, azúcar, pan, leche, jugos, galletas, tiste, frijoles, aceite, cuajada. La rutina de trabajo de Concepción es unas 12 horas diaria. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Las Almendras agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Almendras is comprised of eight single mothers who, in all, are responsible for 20 children. They were born in Sauce in northern Nicaragua. The women are hardworking, responsible, and ambitious. Sadly, none of them went to school because they lacked money. They strive each day to offer their children a brighter future.

The communal bank Las Almendras coordinator is Concepción, who is responsible for the members' timely payments. Concepción manages a small grocery store in her home, where she sells food items at retail: shampoo, coffee, sugar, bread, milk, juice. cookies, tiste, beans, curd cheese, and oil. She works about 12 hours a day.

She will use this loan as working capital to stock her store so that her earnings will rise. The communal bank Las Almendras thanks the Kiva lenders, who give low-income people in countries such as Nicaragua the means for decent work.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with items such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, bread, milk, juice, cookies, beans, curd cheese, and oil.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía es una mujer de 41 años de edad, luchadora, responsable, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 4 hijos 2 de ellos estudian en la escuela y los otros 2 ayudan en los quehaceres del hogar, Rosalía tiene un conocimiento de educación primaria completa y no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de apoyo económico, día a día realiza sus actividades dentro y fuera de su hogar como los oficios domésticos en su totalidad con mucho esfuerzo y con el apoyo de su esposo en el área agrícola específicamente el cultivo, producción y mantenimiento de café. Ella tiene un hogar bien fundamentado ya que junto a su esposo y demás miembros de la familia empujan la carreta de un nuevo porvenir.  

Rosalía está solicitando su ayuda para darle mantenimiento a su producción de vivero y cultivo de café mediante la compra de fertilizantes y abono, ya que este oficio es el único sustento que ella y su familia tienen para cubrir las necesidades del hogar como ser: alimentación, vestimenta, educación, medicinas, etc.

Rosalía es caracterizada por sus vecinos, amistades y familiares por su gran trayectoria como mujer trabajadora y responsable con sus compromisos, su meta es poder ampliar su terreno para poder sembrar y cultivar café ya que su sueño es poder darle a sus hijos una mejor educación, un mejor estilo de vida y puedan heredar lo que sus padres con mucho esfuerzo han logrado obtener y pueda darse de generación en generación.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a 41-year old woman who is persistent and responsible.  She is married, and from her marriage she has 4 children.  Two of them study at school, and the other two help with household chores.  

Rosalía completed her primary education, but was not able to continue studying because of a lack of economic support.  Day after day, she does her work inside and outside her home, like all the domestic tasks, with much effort and with her husband's support in agriculture, specifically in the planting, production and upkeep of the coffee crop.

She has a very grounded home, because along with her husband and the rest of her family, they are pushing forward for a new future.

Rosalía is requesting your help to keep up her nursery production and coffee growing through the purchase of fertilizers and compost.  This profession is the only support she and her family have to cover household necessities such as:  food, clothing, education, medicines, etc.

Rosalía is described by her neighbors, friends and family for her long history as a hard-working woman who is responsible with her commitments.  Her goal is to be able to expand her plot to be able to plant and grow coffee.  Her dream is to be able to give her children a better education and a better lifestyle, and so that they can inherit what their parents have been able to acquire through a lot of effort, and can pass it down to generation after generation.

loans.use: to care for and to buy fertilizers and compost to improve her coffee nursery, planting and growing.

loans.name: Stephene

texts.en: Stephene lives in Kakamega county in western Kenya, where he has been farming for 13 years. He is married and has three children, and his wife also works as a farmer. He says he likes working with Honey Care because they keep their promises, and he hopes to use the money from his beehives to take care of his family. Stephene is currently growing vegetables, and hopes to one day invest more money in his farm, expanding it into a “big business.”

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement his income from farming.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy lives with her husband and three children in Kakamega county, western Kenya. Kakamega is an area known for its production of sugar, and Nancy grows sugarcane on her land, along with maize. Her husband helps her with the farming and also works as a carpenter. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her beehives to expand her farming activities. In the future, Nancy wants to expand her farming activities and increase the size of her farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement her income from farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three washing machines

loans.name: Marlon Jairo

texts.es: Marlon de 32 años de edad se dedica a la venta de víveres y abarrotes, el conoce muy bien su mercado y dice que al tener más mercancías, obtiene más ventas, pero su negocio requiere aumentar el capital  disponible para invertir. Esta es la razón para acudir a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará arroz, azúcar, lácteos, café, embutidos enlatados, que son los artículos de mayor rotación en su negocio y  de los cuales debe tener inventarios para poder crecer rápidamente. su idea de negocio nació desde hace 4 años , en el 2008, cuando la experiencia de un familiar lo llevó a observar, como éste lograba hacer progresar a su familia con ese mismo negocio, por eso imitó esta experiencia con la que le ha ido muy bien y con su capacidad de trabajo y deseos de progresar quiere hacerla crecer., En su tienda trabaja diariamente desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche y compra en graneros,  donde es muy reconocido y le ofrecen precios competitivos, con los cuales día a día trata de impactar a su clientela, para mantenerla atenta a hacer su compra en la tienda de Marlon, que hoy es suya y como él dice no tiene que pagar arriendo a nadie y esto le ayuda a generar ingresos que sirven mucho a su hogar.
texts.en:
Marlon, 32, sells fresh foods and groceries. He knows the market well and believes that, if he has more merchandise, his sales will increase. He needs capital to invest in and grow his business. So he has applied for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the funds to buy rice, sugar, milk products, coffee, and canned goods, which are the most popular items and the ones he needs to have in stock to grow quickly.

Four years ago in 2008, the idea to start this business occurred to him after seeing how another family had managed to get ahead the same way. He followed the example, and the business has prospered under his management. He wants to keep growing. He works in the store every day form 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. He buys from granaries, where he is well-known and offered good prices. Daily, he tries to convince customers to shop at Marlon's. Since he is the owner, he doesn't have to pay rent, which means he has more income to help his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk products, coffee, and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and renovate her salon to make it more comfortable for her customers.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald lives in Kakamega county, western Kenya, with his wife and six children. He has been farming for thirty years and is currently growing maize and vegetables. He thinks that Honey Care beehives are the best because they produce high quality honey, and he likes beekeeping because it is a manageable activity. This is his first loan, and he plans to use the extra income generated from his honey production to buy more beehives. Gerald hopes to one day live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement his income from farming.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.en: Vasiliy is a farmer. He raises vegetables in greenhouses. Vasiliy invested his previous KIVA loan into purchases of film, seeds and fertilizers for his greenhouses. Due to this investment, he had an early harvest and was able to sell his vegetables at good prices. This time Vasiliy is getting ready for the coming Spring season. Vasiliy is  applying for a loan of 15,000 UAH. He needs to fix his greenhouses, which were damaged by strong winds, by welding metal arches and replacing film. Vasiliy also needs to purchase fertilizer and wood for heating.

loans.use: to fix his greenhouses, which were damaged by strong winds, and to buy fertilizer and wood for heating.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en: Irene is a thirty-six year old shopkeeper, selling household commodities. She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because, in her own words, "I saw KOMAZA as a project of reducing poverty due to the money I will get from the trees." With the profits from her tree farm, Irene plans to educate her children, purchase a dairy cow for milk production, and buy other livestock.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: Carlos de 54 años de edad habita al sur de  la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y tiene 5 hijos adultos. En su juventud aprendió con amigos el arte de la fotografía y poco a poco recibió capacitación técnica, que le permitió perfeccionar su actividad hasta convertirla en la generadora de ingresos más importante, pues cuenta con dos puntos de servicios en diferentes barrios a los cuales les ha adicionado el servicio de escaner. Su meta es convertir sus estudios fotográficos en espacios reconocidos en su zona de aceso y agregarle tecnología y nuevos servicios, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr rápidamente este propósito. Hoy acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el fin de lograr su primer financiamiento mediante Kiva, pues necesita ampliar su capital   para comprar una fotocopiadora  e insumos de fotocopiaje y agregar a sus instalaciones este servicio.
texts.en:
Carlos, 54, lives in south Barranquilla with his wife and five grown children. As a young man, he learned the art of photography with his friends and received training that helped him perfect his skills until photography became his main source of income. He has two locations in different neighborhoods, where he also offers scanning service.

His goal is to make his photography studios known throughout the area and add new technology and services. He lacks the working capital to quickly achieve this goal. He is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for his first Kiva loan to increase capital so that he can purchase a copy machine and supplies for his studios.

loans.use: to buy a copy machine and supplies.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustín invirtió su anterior credikiva en mercancías con la que surtió su negocio él compró cemento, cerraduras, partes eléctricas, etc, como esta es una mercancía que rota rápidamente ha vuelto a invertir, su negocio gradualmente está creciendo en clientela y la demanda es superior, por eso ha acudido a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará tubería, cemento, cal, cerraduras etc. Sus financiamientos han servido para tener capital disponible y responder a su clientela de acuerdo con sus necesidades y exigencias.  Su mensaje a los financiadores es: “Gracias por darme nuevamente la oportunidad de tener créditos para hacer crecer mi negocio. “
texts.en: Agustin invested his previous loan in merchandise to stock his business, buying cement, locks, electrical parts, etc. Since this merchandise sells quickly, he has invested in more supplies. His business is gradually gaining more customers and the demand is going up. This is why he is requesting another Kiva loan with which he will buy pipes, cement, lime, locks, etc. The financing has helped him to have the necessary money to be able to meet his customers’ needs and demands. His message to Kiva lenders is: “Thank you for giving me the chance to have a loan to be able to grow my business."

loans.use: to purchase nails, screws, sandpaper, paint, plaster, cement, PVC tubing, etc.

loans.name: Law Group

texts.en:
The group consists of two members namely, Lawrencia and Rebecca. They sell towels and second-hand clothes respectively. They have been together from January, 2013 to date. 

Lawrencia is a 44-year-old towel seller. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two months and is doing very well with her business. 

She has been doing this business for five years now. She hawks from Mondays through to Saturdays. She says thanks to ID Ghana for the help it's given to people like her.  This is her first loan and she needs GHS 350 to buy more towels to sell to her customers. 

Both need a total amount of GHS 700 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more bales of towels and sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Hazbr

texts.en:
Hazbr is 28 years old, a married man. He is an employee in an electricity association. He gets a low salary and can’t accumulate a considerable sum of savings because he spends most of it to pay for all his family's living expenses. 

Now, he needs to buy furniture for his house, but he doesn’t have enough money. Therefore, he asked for a youth loan of YER 190,000 to help to buy furniture for his house. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
In Houston, Texas, Angela owns Angela's Bridal Designs Tailoring & Alterations, where she works with all fabrics specializing in custom-cut bridal wear, dance costumes, embellishments, quilts and then some.

With more than 30 years of experience, Angela's next step is to create a line of wedding veils; she already has permission to vend at a local wedding shop where she offers her services. She is positive that once the veil material arrives, the demand will follow and she'll be able to hire the list of people waiting for a job with her, that without the loan, she would not be able to do.

When Angela attended school to become a designer, she knew to sew and quickly learned to make patters. "God gives you a gift, and that's very important. We have that; my daughter and I have that. We don't say no to anything," she says. "We do a lot of stuff here," she says. "It's the only way to keep in business. I do a lot of custom-made pants, shirts, tuxedos and suits." You can view Angela's full list of services on her website www.angielocustoms.com/.

She's helped launch several companies through her work: one man employed Angela to create and sew designs for his business of selling custom-designed soft computer cases; that man is now in China shopping for a large factory to keep up with his orders. Another man requested Angela create a prototype of his detachable vinyl-type house invention, which allows clean air to flow in while workers in factories and refineries can work without the dangers of harmful fumes. Currently, Angela helps a lady develop her fashion line of dresses by sewing.
