To achieve this dream, Leonel has proposed increasing his sales and creating some savings with the extra money that he receives. To do this, Leonel is applying for a loan that will be used 100% to place larger orders and to be able to meet the demands of his customers. 

Leonel thanks those who through Kiva and Fundación Alternativa help him to finance his dreams and thus to be able to continue with the support of his children and some day see them become adults with excellent careers.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of rice and be able to save to have his own warehouse

loans.name: Villa Del Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado VILLA DEL SOL está en su ciclo número SEXTO del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirtha, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres. Entre el trabajo que ella hace es la venta de empanadas, asaditos, sopa todas las noches, también se debe destacar que ella es una persona my trabajadora y que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante. Su meta es poder tener un gran establecimiento de venta de comidas y por medio de eso ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus ingredientes para la venta de comestibles, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called VILLA DEL SOL is in its sixth cycle of the committee for women, where they all work and help one another get ahead.

Mirtha is one of the members who showed a level three of poverty in the last survey.  Among the work she does is the sale of empanadas, grilled food, and soups.  She also a hardworking person who is getting ahead with great effort and sacrifice.  Her goal is to set up a great food establishment and be able to help her family and give them all they need for a life without worries.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy ingredients to sell food, which will help her and solidify her business plans.  This will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene de 45 años es una mujer de amplia capacidad laboral, soltera y con la satisfacción de haber logrado que sus hijos sean hoy personas de bien.Posee una vivienda construida  a base de madera  la cual construyó con el fruto de su trabajo.Como toda mmdre responsable optó por cultivar las parcelas que le habian heredado sus padres y asi iniciarse en la producción  de cacao y café orgánico.
Lleva 15 años desempeñándose de manera independiente y hasta el momento  ha logrado tener muy buenas ganancias que le ayudan a sustentar a su familia. No obstante las temporadas de lluvias impiden el trabajo fluido en sus parcelas.Desea  realizar algunas mejoras en sus parcelas para esto tiene que reemplazar los árboles cacaoteros desfasados .Sus planes a largo plazo apuntan a la mejora de su vivienda con material noble para asi  mejorar su calidad de vida y a su vez desea tener una tienda de abarrotes.En está ocasión requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas de almácigo y la contrata de jornaleros para el reemplazo de sus plantaciones desfasadas.
texts.en:
Irene, who is 45-years old, is a woman of great working capacity.  She is single and has the satisfaction of having raised children who are doing well.   Irene has a wooden dwelling, which she was able to build with the fruits of her labor.  Like all responsible mothers, she chose to cultivate the plots of land she inherited from her parents.  And that's how she got into cacao and organic coffee production. 
Irene has been carrying out her duties independently for fifteen years.  She has had very good earnings, which have helped her to support her family.  Nevertheless, the rainy season impedes continual work on her plots of land.  Irene hopes to makes some improvements on her plots of land, like replacing the out-dated cacao trees.  Her long-term plans are to make improvements to her dwelling using high-quality materials, which would improve her quality of life, and also to have a small grocery store.  At this time, Irene needs 1,000 nuevos soles ($400 USD) to purchase copper-wood plants and to hire day laborers to replace her out-dated plantings.

loans.use: to purchase plants and to pay her laborers.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El Sr. Martin se dedica a la venta material de ferretería como grifos para instalaciones de agua y variedad de productos, tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona del Tejar   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Martin va a usar este préstamo para la compra material de ferretería por mayor  para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos  a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Martin va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así ir mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una ferretería muy surtida. El Sr. Martin es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Martin works selling hardware goods and a variety of other products such as faucets for plumbing installations. He works out of a storefront in the El Tejar neighborhood. This will be Martin's first loan cycle with this institution, and he plans to use the loan to purchase wholesale hardware goods to stock his business and provide his customers with a greater variety of products. He is requesting this loan because he wishes to improve his business. The proceeds will go toward purchasing more goods and increasing his income. He hopes to maintain a well-stocked store. Martin is a very hardworking individual, and he is happy to have this opportunity provided to him as this is his only means of making a living.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale hardware items.

loans.name: Yvette Fay

texts.en:
Yvette Fay is single with two children. Yvette Fay is 25 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Yvette Fay sells a variety of products to earn a living, and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 8000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Yvette Fay has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Yvette Fay hopes to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Hudoiberdi

texts.ru:
Худойберди мужчина в возрасте 47 лет, женат имеет 4 детей. Он со своей семьей живет по среди гор.  Жена домохозяйка занимается воспитанием детей. Так как они живут среди гор,они вынуждены заниматься только откормом  скота. Уже много лет Худойберди разводит скот и очень доволен этим, потому что получает хорошую прибыль от этого вида деятельности. Каждый месяц он покупает скот на скотном рынке и откормив их через некоторое время продает по выгодной цене. 
С самого детство у Худойберди были финансовые проблемы в семье, он не смог учиться,жил в плохих условиях, поэтому он мечтает чтобы его дети жили в достатке,учились в Вузах,работали по профессии и не знали голода. Для того чтобы достичь всего этого он трудиться не покладая сил.
Худойберди хочет приобрести скот и увеличить поголовье скота.Для этого он обратился в организацию Арванд для получения кредита. Надеется,что получит кредит и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Hudoiberdi is a man of the age of 47. He is married and has four children. He and his family live in the mountains. His wife is a housewife, and she raises the children. As they live in the mountains, they can only work with livestock breeding. 

Hudoiberdi has been breeding livestock for many years already, and is very satisfied with this, because he gets a good income form this type of business. Every month he purchases livestock at the livestock market and fattens them for some time, before selling them at a higher price. 

Since childhood, Hudoiberdi's family had financial problems, and he was not able to study, and lived in bad conditions. Therefore, he dreams of his children living in prosperity, studying at the university, working with their profession of choice and not knowing hunger. In order to achieve all this he works very hard. 

Hudoiberdi would like to purchase livestock and increase the number of cattle. For this he turned to the organization "Arvand" to receive a loan. He hopes that he gets the loan and can develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with the purchase of bread and different flavors of sherbert and popsicles.

loans.name: Venchita

texts.en:
Venchita is single with one child. Venchita is 57 years old and lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Venchita has a business buying qand selling ready-to-wear. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3000. She has requested a loan to purchase additional ready-to-wear items to sell. 

Venchita has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Venchita hopes to save money in case of any emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is 46 years old and lives in Masabod Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Felipe works in the fish industry, selling fish for a living; he has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell for his business. Felipe has been a member of PMPC for one year. 

In the future, Felipe hopes to save to financially support immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell for his business

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
Belina is 45 years old and married; she does not have any children. She buys and sells dry goods to help her husband in generating income. She aims to improve the business, generate sufficient income to satisfy their necessities, and save for future emergencies. 

To improve the business, Belina is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stock of t-shirts, blouses, skirts, pants, jackets, sweaters, and underwear to sell. 

Through this financial assistance, she believes she will make additional improvements in the business, and hopes she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of t-shirts, blouses, skirts, pants, jackets, sweaters, and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Hermogina

texts.en:
Hermogina is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown children from Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari, or variety store, selling various goods and commodities to the people living near her. 

Hermogina is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, candies, rice. soda, soap and detergents, cooking materials, and other ingredients. With this, she will be able to cater and sell more to augment her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, candies, rice,. soda, soap and detergents, cooking materials, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en: Mrs.Narantuya is 38 years old and lives with her husband and son in a Ger in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Battogtoh, age 37, works in maintenance.  Mrs. Narantuya has been a saleswoman since 2010. She has gained a lot of experience in the field and is now starting her own clothing retail business at a rental counter of the local market. She is requesting 1,905,000MNt to purchase inventory for her newly-started clothing  business. She is an open-minded, responsible, and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her newly started clothing business

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Suhbaatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a small house in the Orhon Province of Mongolia. His wife Enhchimeg, age 36, works at a local road company. His daughter, Oyuntulhuur, age 16, and sons Gantulga, age 15, and Hatanbaatar, age 12, study at local schools.  

The borrower has been working at a state-owned transportation company for more than 10 years now. His daughter is enrolling in university next year, and their family expenses will be getting higher soon. He is now starting his own transportation service business in town, and needs 4,000,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly, economical vehicle to run his transportation service business in order to save for his daughter's further study

He is a hard-working and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly, economical vehicle to run his transportation service business in town in order to save for his daughter's further study.

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes  du groupe  Finesse  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 2 enfants vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de commerce. Pour diversifier leur activités et de renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux répondre aux attente des clients, elles décident d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier cycle de  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habillements et bien d’autres articles divers. 
Moh, qui est la seule debout fait l’achat vente d’habillements. Elle s’approvisionne dans la ville de Bougouni auprès des grossistes de la place et compte acheter avec son  prêt, une balle de friperie. Ces habits sont ensuite revendus en embulant et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités,  utilisé pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The female members of the Finesse group are all married, and have an average age of 32. They have an average of two children each, and mainly live in traditional families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. These women know each other as they are related through marriage or have working relationships. To diversify their businesses and consolidate their capital, so that they can better meet their customers’ requests, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance loan program. They are on their first loan cycle. 

This group of women works selling clothing and a number of other miscellaneous items. Moh, who is the only woman pictured standing, works buying and selling clothing. She gets her supplies from local wholesalers in the city of Bougouni, and plans to use her loan to buy a bale of second-hand clothing. After buying her clothing she then sells it from door to door and at home, on a cash and credit basis. Her customers are both male and female.

Moh plans to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which she will use to invest in her business, pay medical expenses, and repay her loan.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: Муким добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Из-за обстоятельств в семье и трудных времён он не смог получить высшее образование. После школы пошёл работать и помогал родителем, так как он был старшим сыном в семье. Муким трудился за кусок хлеба, но и не забывал  об моральных ценностях. Постоянно читал книжки, очень интересовался медициной. Прошли годы и сейчас у Мукима своя семья. У него любящая жена и трое детей. Жена не работает, воспитывает детей. Муким как ответственный семьянин, заботливый папа и добрый муж старается, чтобы его семья не нуждались и дети выросли грамотными. Он работает в больнице фельдшером в двух сменах. Трудиться, и старается, чтобы его детям не было тяжело как ему самому в детстве. Хочет, чтобы они обучались и получили образование. Муким старается создать хорошие условия жилья и всегда поддерживает свою семью морально и материально. Для воплощения своего очередного плана – отремонтировать квартиру, ему понадобились дополнительные средства. Он хочет освежить жилые комнаты и обновить ванную комнату к весне.  Для этого он решил воспользоваться кредитом и обустроить своё жильё. Он обратился в МДО «Арванд» и надеется на помощь и поддержку  со стороны организации.
texts.en:
Mukim is a good and hardworking man. Because of family circumstances and tough times he was not able to get higher education. After school he started working and helped his parents, as he was the eldest son in the family. Mukim worked for food, but he did not forget about his moral values. He always read books and was very interested in medicine. 

The years went by and currently Mukim has a family. He has a loving wife and three children. His wife does not work, she raises the children. Mukim, as a responsible family man, a caring father and a good husband, works hard so that his family is not in need and his children grow up literate. He works two shifts at the hospital as a medical assistant. He works and struggles so that his children don't have as hard a childhood as himself. He wants them to study and get an education. 

Mukim tries to create good living conditions and always supports his family morally and materially. To realize his future plan, which is to renovate their apartment, he is in need of additional resources. He would like to refresh their living rooms and renew their bathroom by spring. To do this, he decided to take a loan and equip his house. He turned to "MDO Arvand" and hopes for help and support from the organization.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es:
José, está soltero, trabaja para sus propios gastos, dedicándose a la ganadería y crianza de cerdos, inicio con poco, en la venta de cerdos y ganado, el horario que dedica para esta actividad es de 4:00 am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente tiene el plan de comprarse cerdos para crianza y engorde, esto le ayudara para mejorar el negocio y tendrá más animales en la granja, para continuar negociando, su objetivo es poder obtener más ganancias y mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
José is single and works to pay his own expenses. He began with very little, but now works raising and selling cattle and pigs, for which he works from 4 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Currently he plans to buy pigs to raise and fatten. This will help him improve his business and have more animals on the farm, which in turn will help him continue raising and selling animals. His goal is to earn more profits and improve his house.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ailyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, spices, egg, etc.

Ailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros. Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Dios con nosotros, está conformado por 9 integrantes, siete mujeres dos hombres, padres y madres de familias con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Estos integrantes son personas, responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación responsable. Lamentablemente ninguna pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económicos. Desde muy joven tuvieron que trabajara para ayudar a los gastos del hogar. Por lo cual desean brindarle un futuro mejor para sus hijos.
La coordinadora del banco Dios con nosotros es Rosa Andrea,  tiene por actividad económica  la venta de pasteles y empanadas, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, porque ha sido la forma de vida y la de sus hijos.  La rutina de trabajo de esta mujer es vender de forma ambulante, unas 10 horas diarias con un canasto en su cabeza de unos 10 kg ofreciendo sus pasteles y sus empanadas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta del producto como pasteles de carne, de pilla, de quesos, empanadas de arroz. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Dios con nosotros agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Dios con Nosotros Communal Bank is made up of nine members, seven women and two men, fathers and mothers who have 20 children in their care.  They're from Malpaisillo, located in the western part of the country.

These members are responsible and hardworking people with a desire for personal self-improvement.  Unfortunately none of them were able to pursue a university education due to lack of financial resources.  They had to work from a young age so they could help with the household expenses.  This is why they want a better future for their children.

The coordinator of Dios con Nosotros Bank is Rosa Andrea, whose job is selling pastries and pies, which she does with great pleasure because it has been her way of life and that of her children.  Her work routine is to sell her pastries and pies on foot some 10 hours a day with a basket on her head that weighs about 10 kilograms.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling products such as rice pies and meat, cheese, and other pastries, so she can have better income in the near future.

Dios con Nosotros Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to buy and sell rice pies and meat, cheese, and other pastries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque tiene experiencia en créditos y a través de ellos es un buen recurso para trabajar, el invertirá en la compra de frutas y verduras como tomates, papas, güisquiles, manzanas, uvas, entre otras.
Ella comenta que la buena inversión en el negocio ha logrado más rentabilidad, le ha ayudado a mejorar su economía, gracias a las ganancias del negocio, ahora cuenta con mejores condiciones y oportunidades para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
María has decided to request another loan because she has experience with loans and because they are a good resource, enabling her to work and invest in buying fruit and vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes, pear squash, apples and grapes, among others.  

She notes that good investment in her business has achieved better profitability and helped her improve her income. Thanks to her business earnings she is now in a better condition and has more opportunity to keep on working.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, pear squash, apples and grapes.

loans.name: Tonui

texts.en:
Tonui lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. He has two children and has been doing farming work for three years.  His primary income sources are eggs, tea, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Plucking tea!' His biggest challenge is: 'Plucking tea when too sunny.' The animal in the farm is named: 'Lelkina." He will use the loan of KES 20,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds.

Tonui was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Fast service.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: ''It deals with groups.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Tonui replied: 'I will earn more income.'

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Tonui owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle,' but does not own: 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, solar power,' but does not have: 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Josue Abacu

texts.es:
Josué, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para poder invertir en el negocio de la panadería se comprara harina, huevos, levadura, entre otros productos, que le faciliten la producción del pan.
El considera que a través del trabajo con préstamos, la inversión que ha realizado al negocio ha sido mejor, ya que ha logrado tener mejores ganancias debido a la producción.
texts.en: Josué has decided to take out a new loan to invest in his bakery business.  He will buy flour, eggs, yeast and other products that he uses to make bread.  He believes that, by taking out loans, the investment that he has made in his business has improved and he has made better profits.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and yeast

loans.name: Carlota Aida

texts.es:
Carlota, vive con su esposo, su padre y un nieto, ella se dedica a atender un chalet, este negocio lo hace por la necesidad para tener ingresos, lo realiza desde hace mas de cinco años, lo tiene instalado en un centro escolar donde por una amiga logro el poder instalarlo.
Ella necesita realizar una inversión en el chalet, comprando un extractor de jugo, boquitas, snack para la venta, para esto solicita un préstamo que solucione su necesidad en el negocio, teniendo más variedad y los electrodomésticos necesarios.
 Su aspiración es que el negocio crezca para la subsistencia de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlota lives with her husband, her father and a grandchild.  Her business is running a snack bar and she does this work because she needs to make money.  She has been in business for more than five years.  Her stall is located in a school and it was a friend who helped her to set up there.

Carlota needs to invest in her snack bar by purchasing a juicer and also some snacks to sell.  She is requesting a loan to cover her business needs.  She wants to be able to sell a greater variety of products and have the equipment she needs to hand.  Carlota's ambition is to grow her business so that she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy a juicer and some snacks

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Benkadi  est constitué de dix femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  médicaments traditionnels à travers  ASSETOU, première assise à gauche.  Elle fait l’achat vente de médicaments traditionnels et compte acheter avec son prêt, 250 sachets de médicaments traditionnels améloirés avec les fabriquants agrées  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi comprises ten women, all married, who average 33 years of age and four children each, living for the most part in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and children in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougouni City. The women know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. 

To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan. 

This group of women trades in traditional medicines through ASSETOU, who is the first person seated on the left in the photo. She buys and sells traditional medicines and intends to use her loan to purchase 250 pouches of improved traditional medicines from authorized manufacturers in Bougouni. Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of men and women, she makes her sales at the market and at home. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be invested in business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase traditional medicines

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes  du groupe  Kankele  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et 6 enfants vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de commerce. Pour diversifier leur activités et de renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux répondre aux attente des clients, elles ont décidé d’adhérer  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur septième cycle de  prêt et les six précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait essentiellement le commerce de céréales. 
Yama, qui a un papier en main fait l’achat vente de céréales. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de Bougouni auprès des paysans venus des villages environnants de Bougouni et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 300Kg de Fonio, 150Kg de petit mil et 200Kg de sorgho. Ces céréales sont ensuite revendues sur place dans le marché en détail et au comptant  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités,  utilisé pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
All of them married, the women of the group Kankele average 47 years of age and six children each, living for the most part in traditional families in the Dougounina district of Bougouni City. They women know one another through ties of marriage and commerce. 

To diversify their businesses and to bolster their financial capacity, so as to respond better to customer expectations, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their seventh loan cycle, where the six previous loans have been properly repaid. This group of women essentially does business in grains.

Yama, who is holding paper in the photo, buys and sells grains. She gets her supplies from the Bougouni market from peasant farmers from the villages surrounding Bougouni. She intends to use her loan to purchase 300 kg of fonio (a kind of millet), 150 kg of pearl millet, and 200 kg of sorghum. At the market, the grains are then sold for cash locally at the retail level. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be invested in business, used for covering healthcare costs, and used for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres unidas al progreso está en su Vigésimo primer  ciclo  (21º) es un grupo muy antiguo que trabaja con la fundación. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos de las señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, y ellas se están esforzando por salir adelante con la ayuda de las capacitaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que muestra que esta por debajo de la línea de la pobreza. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha día a día por su familia, para darles lo que ella no tuvo, y con la venta de ropa que hace quiere salir adelante. Comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela y que con esto esa teniendo los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, ya que quiere poder tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes y de esa forma invertir en su trabajo y seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Unidas al Progreso' group are in their 21st loan cycle.  They have been working with Fundación Paraguaya for a long time.  According to the Poverty Elimination Survey, two of the ladies currently find themselves below the poverty line and they are working hard to get ahead in life with the help of the training sessions they attend.  

Maria is a member of this group.  When Maria last completed the survey, she was on level one of the poverty scale which means that she is below the poverty line.  She is a very hard-working person who works hard day in day out for the sake of her family so that she can give them everything she was not able to have herself.  She hopes that by selling clothing she will be able to make progress in life.  Maria comments that she has a very good customer base and her business is making her the income she needs to help her family.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying clothing as she would like to have a good range of garments to sell to her customers.  She will invest in her business and continue working as she has been up to now.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick survived Cambodia’s Khmer Rouge regime and resettled in France with his mother when he was only 3 years old. His father was left behind in Cambodia. When he was 20 years old, Patrick came to the U.S. to look for his father because he believed his father lived with his uncle in Seattle. Unfortunately, his father wasn’t here. 

Patrick was strong enough to get through and decided to restart his life in the U.S. He learned English, but unfortunately wasn’t able to attend college.  He found a job in the telecommunications industry, promoting, selling, and servicing wireless phone services. Then he became an independent contractor, doing installations and sales for Verizon FIOS with the hope of creating jobs for his fellow immigrants. After four years of hard work for Verizon, he became its top salesperson.

In early 2012, Patrick and his wife decided to start their own company to provide marketing services for telecommunication companies. Verizon became the company’s first major customer by contracting with Patrick’s company to handle referrals of prospective customers throughout the United States.  Patrick’s company’s job is to follow up and sign up the customers with services from Verizon. In this past year, the company has hired seven employees and has started to make a profit. 

In late 2012, as his business grew so fast, Patrick wanted to expand his business and hire more staff. However, with his limited credit score and short business history, he wasn’t able to get the loan from the bank. One day, he heard about PACE from his friend. 

With a loan of $10,000 from PACE, Patrick can add three work stations equipped with computers, printers, and Internet access; also upgrade the phone system and hire at least three more staff.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, upgrade the phone system, and hire three new staff members for his telemarketing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Violeta is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.

Violeta has a business buying and selling sea shells in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional shells to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional shells to sell

loans.name: Taivandulam

texts.en:
Mrs. Taivandulam is 56 years old and a widow. She lives alone in a 'ger' in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her daughter has gotten married and lives separately. Mrs. Taivandulam ran a clothing retail business since 2005 in another province. She has moved to Uvurhangai province and is now restarting her clothing retail business at a rental counter in the local market. Her daughter also runs a clothing retail business in that market and will import inventory for the borrower's business from Erlian, China. 

Mrs. Taivandulam is now requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase start-up inventory from Erlian, China for her new clothing sales business. She is hardworking and a bright-minded woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory from Erlian, China for her new clothing sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Biswa Maa Tarini Self Help Group

texts.en:
Biswa Maa Tarini Self Help Group consists of 13 women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves, to share their problems, and to solve their problem among them. All the group members are engaged in different kind of activities like running a variety shop, vegetable shop, farming, etc.

One of them is Anusaya, who was selected as the President of Biswa Maa Tarini Self Help Group. The lady standing fourth from the left hand side, wearing an orange colored saree in the photo is Anusaya. Anusaya is 41 years old and is living with her husband and her children who are in school. She hopes to see her children as officers serving the country. She is engaged in the activity of growing and selling vegetables in her village. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

She along with her group has requested a loan of 195,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation. She says a portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase vegetable plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing vegetable plants, fertilizers, insecticides, etc. for vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. He is married but with no children yet. He has been doing his work for four years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and other crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Reaping maize, milking!' His biggest challenge is 'Poor weather conditions at times. One animal in the farm is named 'Cheboit.'

Edwin was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Low interest rate.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "How to deal with groups.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Edwin replied 'Family income will increase.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Edwin owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Annie Benita

texts.es:
Annie es una mujer de 56 años, su vida ha sido un ejemplo de trabajo y esfuerzo, terminó la secundaria en su ciudad natal Quevedo y luego se trasladó para prepararse en corte y confección de ropa, es soltera y tiene un hijo quien se ha convertido en la motivación para cada día realizar su trabajo de la mejor forma. Pues ella sola es quien lleva el sustento a su casa y provee para las necesidades de su hijo y el mantenimiento y servicios básicos de la casa. Esta humilde mujer vive con su hijo en la parroquia Abrahan Calazacón en Santo Domingo la ciudad capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un lugar que  tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa de Ecuador. Además la visita de turistas nacionales y extranjeros aporta al fortalecimiento de las actividades de los emprendedores que desde hace algunos años han establecido sus negocios alrededor de toda la ciudad. Esta ciudad que es la tercera más habitada de la región, también contribuye con actividades como la agricultura, ganadería, pesca y manufactura. 
Desde hace 25 años, Annie ejerció por cuenta propia su oficio de costura, confeccionando todo tipo de ropa casual y formal, oficio que heredó de algunos familiares. Ella atiende a sus clientes en su casa, en donde ya muchos moradores de la zona la recomiendan por la responsabilidad y buen trabajo que realiza con la ropa. Trabaja todo el día, sentada en su máquina de coser elaborando trajes a la medida de sus clientes. Para Annie es importante un crecimiento de su negocio para que su hijo herede el espíritu emprendedor que seguramente le servirá de mucho en el futuro. Como un paso al mejoramiento del negocio, ella requiere un préstamo con el cual piensa comprar una máquina de coser que serviría para la elaboración de disfraces que son muy demandados en ciertas épocas del año, además de las telas e insumos necesarios. Con esta compra, los ingresos de Annie incrementarán y ella podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo para que éste obtenga el título profesional que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de conseguir. Cuando se le contó sobre la intermediación de Kiva para financiar sus sueños, Annie se sintió muy emocionada y dijo que agradece a cada persona que alrededor del mundo dedica tiempo y dinero a la realización de proyectos de emprendedores como ella que en muchas ocasiones se les dificulta tanto la obtención de créditos en el sector financiero.
texts.en:
Annie is a 56 year old woman.  Her life has been an example of hard work and effort.  She completed high school in her hometown of Quevedo and then moved in order to train herself in styling and sewing clothes.  She is unmarried and has one son who has become her motivation for doing her best job each day.  She alone is the one who supports her household, provides for her son’s needs, and pays for the home’s maintenance and utilities.  This humble woman lives with her son in the Abrahan Calazacón parish in Santo Domingo, the capital of the Province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas.  Commerce is very active here and this area has become a land port for trade between the mountains and the coast of Ecuador.  In addition, the visits of domestic and foreign tourists contribute to the strengthening of the activities of entrepreneurs that have established their businesses all around the city in recent years.  This city is the third most populous in the region and also contributes to activities such as agriculture, livestock breeding, fishing, and manufacturing.

For 25 years, Annie has been working as a self-employed seamstress. She inherited the trade from her family and makes all styles of casual and formal clothing.  She serves her clients in her home and many area residents recommend her because she is responsible and does a good job on the clothing.   She works all day, and sits at her sewing machine fashioning custom-made suits for her customers. For Annie, the growth of her business is important because she wants her son to inherit the entrepreneurial spirit that will surely serve him well in the future.  As a step toward improving her business, she is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine, fabric, and materials, which will help her make costumes that are in high demand at certain times of the year.  With this purchase, Annie’s income will increase which will enable her to improve her quality of life and that of her son so that he may earn the professional degree that she didn’t have the opportunity to obtain.  When told that Kiva could act as an intermediary to finance her dreams, Annie was very excited and said that she is very grateful to each person around the world who dedicates time and money to the realization of the plans of entrepreneurs like her who often have difficulty obtaining credit in the financial sector.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to make costumes.

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en: Mr. Zoljargal is 30 years old and lives with his wife in a house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Yanjinsuren, age 33, is currently unemployed. The borrower has been running a transportation service business in town since 2005. He transports food products back and forth to Ulaanbaatar and Uvurhangai province. He is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory for his wife to start up a clothing sales business in a local market. His wife has experience of some years in clothing sales business. Both the borrower and his wife are hardworking, welcoming and modest people.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his wife to start up a clothing sales business in a local market

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 47 years old, married, and has two children who are both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Glenda has a business making 'siopao' (steamed buns) in the Philippines. Glenda requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production.

Glenda has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Glenda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Jaylen

texts.en:
Jaylen is 54 years old and a widow with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste, soap, eggs, etc.

Jaylen has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jaylen aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste, soap, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Alamako Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Alamako est constitué de 7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24  ans et 2 enfants.  Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Méridièla, un des villages du cercle de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de  renforcer leurs capacités financières pour de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles  adhèrent  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales,  de beignets, d’arachide et de la restauration.
Mamou  debout papier en main,  fait de l’achat vente d’arachide. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt,  160 kilos d’arachide décortiqués des grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes  au marché de Méridièla et dans les foires des villages environnants, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Alamako group is made up of seven married women, who are, on average  24 years old, and have two children.  They live in traditional families in Méridièla, one of the villages in the Bougouni circle. 
They know each other as neighbors, friends, and through their businesses. In order to increase their working funds to better run their businesses, they belong to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their first loan.  These women sell cereal, beignets, peanuts, and serve prepared food. 
Mamou, in front with the paper in her hand,  sells peanuts. She plans to buy, with her loan, 160 kilos of shelled peanuts from wholesalers in Bougoni.   She makes her sales at the market in Méridièla and at fairs in the neighboring villages, at retail for cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women.

She foresees making an average monthly benefit of 22,000FCFA which will be used to invest in her business and to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Saudo José

texts.es:
El señor saudo José vive en la cuidad de Managua Nicaragua, su núcleo familiar esta compuesto por  tres personas. 
Actualmente trabaja en una universidad  de Managua desempeñándose como operador de fotocopiadora  con una estabilidad laboral de  13 años.

Saudo visito ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para cubrir gastos escolares de sus hijos como pago de colegiatura, compra de uniformes y cuaderno.


Espera  le sea otorgado el préstamo por que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia
texts.en:
Saudo José lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua, and his nuclear family is composed of three people. Currently he works at a university in Managua as a photocopy machine operator. He was worked there with stability for 13 years.

Saudo visited Ceprodel to ask for a loan to improve his home and to cover school costs for his children like paying tuition and buying uniforms and notebooks. The investment that Saudo wants to make is the purchase of ceramic and cement for the installation of ceramic in his home. He hopes that the loan will be granted because he wants to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to cover school costs for his children like paying tuition and buying uniforms and notebooks

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William  vive en la cuidad de Managua tiene dos hijos e caracteriza por se responsable en su trabajo y con su familia.

  Se desempeña como vigilante de una  expresa desde hace tres años,  Es por  esta razón que decidió hacer la solicitud de préstamo para las mejoras  de su casa de habitación. Para poder mejorar brindar condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en: William lives in the city of Managua. He has two children, and he is responsible in his job and with his family. He has worked as a security guard at a business for three years.This is why he has decided to apply for a loan to make home improvements and to able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make home improvements and to able to provide his family with a better quality of life

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de insumos para la venta de tortas y demás comida rápida, y otros productos para continuar realizando la venta, por ejemplo, pan, carne, repollo, lechuga, ya que esto hará que el negocio funcione bien.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo en su negocio, mejoro la variedad par elaborar la venta, en su familia su deseo es continuar con el negocio para construir una casa, ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
José is asking for another loan to buy supplies for the sale of sandwiches and other fast food and products, such as bread, meat, cabbage and, lettuce, since this will ensure that the business keeps running smoothly. 

José's last loan had a positive impact on his business, improving the variety of the food he sells. His dream is to continue with the business so that he can build a house, helping his family.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, cabbage and lettuce.

loans.name: Jean Rose

texts.en:
Jean Rose works hard to support three children. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines. Jean Rose requested a loan of 3600 PHP through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer. The Envirofit stove needs less fuel to cook food.

Jean Rose is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou. She previously accessed a loan of 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, as well as in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 15,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilou hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a second time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. He is applying for a loan of 600,000 UGX. He lives in one of the slum areas of the city with his two children aged 6 and 17 years. The children's mother is in the village looking after cattle. He does laundry for people in Kampala as his main source of income. It is this business that has made him able to feed and educate his children and pay rent for the premises where he stays and works. He applied for the loan to renovate his parents’ home in the village which is apparently in a sorry state.

His future plan is to purchase washing machines that help him do the washing easily on top of purchasing land and building a residential building on it.

loans.use: To renovate his parents' house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: A 52-year-old farmer, Lucena has been engaged in a rice farming business for several years. She also operates a motorcycle transport business. Lucena is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and yield. In the future, Lucena hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Manuel Armando

texts.es:
Manuel, quiere continuar realizando viajes exprés, solicita un préstamo para poder pagar el mantenimiento del motor, frenos y llantas, esto le permitirá tener en mejores condiciones su vehículo para transportar a los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior, él considera que sus ingresos por la prestación de transporte aumento, manteniendo un buen número de clientes, en su familia su aporte aumento para cubrir las necesidades en su hogar.
texts.en: Manuel wants to continue offering express taxi trips and is requesting a loan to pay for the maintenance of the motor, brakes, and tires of his moto taxi. This will help him to keep his vehicle in good condition to transport his customers. With the previous loan, he earned more money from his transportation business, he maintained a good amount of customers, and was able to take more money home to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motor, brakes, and tires of his moto taxi.

loans.name: Pachocol Group

texts.es:
Diego (la primera persona en la fotografía con playera de color morado de derecha a izquierda) un hombre de 45 años de edad el está casada y vive en Sololá. Tiene seis hijos de ellos cuatro mujeres la cual dos de ellas apoyan a don Diego a trabajar en el campo de la agricultura aportando al desarrollo familiar. 

El se dedica al cultivo y mantenimiento de banano y tomate en una parcela que tiene a un kilómetro de su vivienda.  Aprendió este trabajo junto a su padre de este modo fue como apoyaba  la economía de su familia por que este trabajo es lo que más se realiza en la comunidad.

El decide realizar su propio cultivo en parcelas de la familia ahora cuenta con 15 años de experiencia trabajando independientemente vendiendo sus productos en el mercado local  el ve que sus ganancias son buenas y quiere invertir más capital ampliando su cultivo. 

Es una persona líder en su comunidad la cual organizo un grupo de personas para solicitar un préstamo que utilizaran en la ampliación su cultivo comprando fertilizante, plantas de banano para próxima siembra y el pago a trabajadores que preparan la tierra en las parcelas. 

Sueña que en un futuro pueda comprar otra parcela para ampliar sus cultivos para obtener más ganancias y mejorar cada vez más la economía familiar. Los demás integrantes de este grupo se dedican a esta misma actividad como es el cultivo y mantenimiento de banano  siendo el cultivo que  más se trabaja en la zona generando empleos para más personas.
texts.en:
Diego, 45, is married and lives in Sololá.  (He's the first person on the right in the photograph, wearing a purple t-shirt.)  He has six children.  Four of them are women, two of whom help Diego work in the field, contributing to the development of the family.

He makes a living growing and maintaining bananas and tomatoes on a plot of land one kilometer from his house.  He learned this job from his father and this is how he supports his family, because it's one of the most common jobs in the community.  

He has 15 years of experience working independently on his family's land and selling his products in the local market.  He make a good living and wants to invest more to expand his business.  

He's a leader in the community, organizing a group of people for whom he's requesting a loan to expand the crop by buying fertilizer and banana plants for the next planting, and to pay the workers to prepare the plots of land.

He hopes that in the future he can buy another plot of land to expand his crops and get more profit to continue supporting his children in their academic studies and to improve the family economy more all the time.

The other members of this group do the same job, growing and maintaining bananas and coffee, which are one of the main job-generating activities in the region.

loans.use: to grow bananas

loans.name: Xexac Group

texts.es:
Francisca (la primera en la fotografía de derecha a izquierda) una mujer de 37 años de edad ella está casada y vive en Sololá. Ella tiene tres hijos de ellos una  mujer quien estudia y apoya en los oficios del hogar  y dos varones uno trabaja independiente y otro trabaja apoyando  en el campo de la agricultura en la mitad del día y en la otra mitad estudia en una escuela de su comunidad. 
Ella  trabaja en el  cultivo y mantenimiento de banano y café en una parcela que tiene a dos kilómetros de su vivienda.  Aprendió este trabajo junto a su madre ya que sufrió el fallecimiento de su padre desde que tenía siete años de este modo fue como aprendió esta labor apoyando la economía de su familia. 
Así fue como  decide realizar su propio cultivo.  Ahora cuenta con 15 años de experiencia trabajando independientemente. Ella vende su producto en el mercado local  viendo  que sus ganancias son buenas y quiere invertir más capital en su cultivo. 
Doña Francisca es una mujer líder en su comunidad logrando organizar un grupo de personas y solicitan un préstamo para ampliar su cultivo comprando fertilizante, plantas de banano para próxima siembra y el pago a trabajadores que preparan la tierra en parcelas. 
Su mayor sueño es que en un futuro pueda comprar otra parcela para ampliar sus cultivos obteniendo más ganancias para seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios académicos y mejorar cada vez más la economía familiar. Los demás integrantes de este grupo se dedican a la misma actividad como es el cultivo y mantenimiento de banano y café  que son una de las principales actividades de la región en la generación de empleo.
texts.en:
Francisca (shown on the far right in the photo) is 37, married, and lives in Sololá. She has three children: a daughter, who is a student and helps with the housework; and one son who works for himself, and another son who works part of the day in the fields and also studies in a local school. Francisca grows bananas and coffee on land two kilometers from her house. She learned the trade from her mother, as her father died when she was six, and her work added to her family's earnings.

Eventually she started her own plantings and has now been working independently for 15 years. She sells her crops in the local market, and since her earnings are good, she would like to invest more capital in her business. Francisca is a community leader. She managed to form a group to apply for a loan to increase her crops, buy fertilizer and more banana plants for the next sowing, and to pay the workers who prepare the land.

Her great dream is to buy another parcel to plant and have more income to keep helping her sons with their education and improving the family's finances. The other group members also grow bananas and coffee, which is one of the main sources of work in the region.

loans.use: to grow bananas.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dona do próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (caldo, arroz, óleo, bolachas, doces, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e construir uma casa para aluguer, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de construir a casa de aluguer para aumentar as suas receitas.
texts.en: Luisa is married and is the mother of 3 children who go to school.  She lives in her own home and doesn't support anyone besides her family.  She owns her own business selling various products.  She will use this loan to buy products (soup, rice, oil, crackers, sweets, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to grow her business and to build a house to rent out.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is building a house to rent out and to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy products (soup, rice, oil, crackers, sweets, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Tserenbadam

texts.en: Tserenbadam is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a newly-built house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband Tomorbat, age 41, works as a driver for a mining company. Her daughter Olziiduuren, age 18, studies at university and Olziiburen, age 16, studies at the local secondary school. The borrower has been working as a librarian at the local school for years and started her butcher shop business in the rental counter of the local market in 2000. She is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation material for her newly-built house to stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winters. She is a hardworking, experienced and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material for her newly-built house to stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winters.

loans.name: Vissha  Joy

texts.en: Vissha Joy is 21 years old, single and a new graduate from college. Due to lack of job opportunities, she decided to engage in selling fruits in the market to generate income and help her parents in financing the education of her younger sister. She aims to make the business more profitable in order to generate a higher income. She plans to sell more kinds of fruits but she does not have enough capital, therefore she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more stocks of watermelons, apples, grapes, oranges and mangoes to sell. She believes that someday, she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of watermelons, apples, grapes, oranges and mangoes to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes  du groupe  Benkadi  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 3 enfants vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de commerce et d’amitié. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poisson et de condiments. 
Awa, qui est assise à l’êxtrême droite, fait l’achat vente de poissons. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 60 kilos par jour avec les pêcheurs bozos de la ville de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes en embulant dans la ville de Bougouni, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités,  utilisé pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are all married women.  On average, they are 28 years old and have three children each.  Most of them live in traditional families in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They know one another through friendship and professional ties.  In order to boost their financial capacity and to better conduct their commercial activities, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second loan.  

The women of the Benkadi group sell fish and condiments.  Awa, sitting at the far right, buys and sells fish.

With her loan, she intends to buy 60 kg of fish per day from the Bozo fishermen of the city of Bougouni.  She works as an itinerant seller, in Bougouni, and sells her merchandise for cash or on credit to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 50,000 CFA francs.  She will invest these profits in her business, and also use them to cover medical expenses and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Celia Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Celia tiene 30 años, soltera  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa,  ella vende de manera ambulante visitando distintas ferias y zonas de la ciudad de anta Cruz, este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Celia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, La Sra. Celia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes.
texts.en: Celia is 30 years old, single, and works selling clothing. She is a mobile salesperson visiting different markets and areas of the city of Santa Cruz. This loan will be her first from the institution. Celia will use the loan to buy clothing at wholesale for her business, and the reason she is requesting the loan is because she does not have the money to invest in stock. Celia's main challenge is the daily competition. She will use the loan to improve her stall. Her wish for her business is to have enough stock to be able to offer a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale for her business.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque realizara un nuevo cultivo de maíz y frijol, para él debe arrendar el terreno en el cual realizara la siembra,  este préstamo le servirá con el dinero necesario para que se lleve a cabo el trabajo en la siembra de maíz y frijol.
Con el préstamo anterior, Orlando considera que le ayudo a comprar los insumos agrícolas, con la cosecha a podido ayudar a su familia en la alimentación, él está avanzando en sus estudios ya que es su objetivo es finalizar su carrera, tambien por las mañanas y noches vende pan por las zonas cercanas.
texts.en:
Orlando is requesting a new loan because he is going to plant more corn and bean crops. In order to do this, he must rent the land in which the crops will be planted. The requested loan will provide him with the necessary money to complete the work of planting the corn and bean crops. 

The previous loan helped Orlando to buy agricultural inputs, which meant he could help his family out by sharing the harvest with them, and to advance with his studies as his goal is to finish his degree. He also sells bread at morning and at night in the neighboring areas.

loans.use: to rent land.

loans.name: Cristino Aparicio

texts.es:
Cristino, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de invertir en el cultivo de regadillo, ya que está próximo a realizarlo, se comprara semilla, abono, fertilizante, herbicidas, entre otros que sean necesarios para poder proteger y ayudar al desarrollo del cultivo.
Él manifiesta que trabajar con préstamos le permite, que su cultivo mejore la producción, aumenta la calidad del maíz y le permite realizar ventas, en este periodo mejoro su vivienda en algunos aspectos.
texts.en: Cristino is requesting another loan because he needs to invest in the crops that he is about to sew. He will buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and herbicides among other items that will be necessary to protect and help the development of his crops. He comments that the loans have helped him to improve production, increase the quality of the corn, make sales, and make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Dúo Shama De Peronia Group

texts.es:
SHAMA REFINANCIAMIENTO
El grupo lo forma doña Iris Siomara y Mayra.  Iris es la líder del grupo y es casada tiene 2 hijos, y se dedica a la venta de utiles escolares(libreria), desde hace tiempo ella realiza sus ventas, ella necesita este crédito para la compra de mas mercaderia en productos de libreria ya que nececita surtir mas su negocio para tener mejores ganancias ella necesita invertir bastante para aumentar sus ingresos, ella espera que se le apoye con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
This group consists of Iris Siomara y Mayra.  Iris is the leader of the group and is married with 2 children.  She works selling school supplies(bookstore), and has a good deal of experience.  

She is requesting this loan to buy more inventory for her bookstore in order to invest more in her store and improve her income.  She hopes you will help her with this credit.

loans.use: Para la compra de productos de libreria

loans.name: Errocina

texts.es: Errocina tiene una peluquería en su casa en Curico, Chile, y lleva 4 años trabajando en su negocio. La peluquería es una ampliación que hizo en su casa para su local y se necesita el prestamos para reparar el techo de su peluquería . En el futuro Errocina quiere ampliar su negocio y poder tener personas nuevas que trabajen con ella y a las que enseñar su trabajo. Ella tiene dos hijos, 20 y 25 años, uno estudia en la Universidad y el otro trabaja. Tambien tiene dos hijos tutores que viven de lunes a viernes en su casa porque viven muy lejos de Curicó para poder viajar diariamente. Le gusta trabajar con Fondo Esperanza por el compañerismo que se genera dentro del banco comunal. Ademas en las sesiones de educación ha aprendido de cómo llevar su negocio, organización de dinero y de qué manera hacer inversiones, cuanto cobrar por su servicio y separar ingresos de costos.
texts.en:
Errocina has a beauty salon in her house in Curicó, Chile, and has been working in her business for four years.  The salon is an expansion she made to her house for the shop.  She needs the loan to repair the roof.

In the future Errocina wants to expand her business and be able to have new people working with her to whom she can teach her work.

She has two children, ages 20 and 25; one studies in the university and the other one works.  She also is the guardian of two children who live with her from Monday through Friday because they live too far from Curicó to be able to travel there every day.

She likes working with Fondo Esperanza because of the camaraderie in the communal bank.  Also, in the training sessions she has learned about how to run her business, organize her money, make investments, and separate income from costs, as well as how much to charge for her service.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her beauty salon

loans.name: Dúo Sembradora De Las Mies Group

texts.es:
DUO SEMBRADORAS DE LA MIES
Este duo lo forma doña Mayra Marina, quien vende pollo destazado en la zona 7 de la capital hace 9 años, es casada y su hijo está estudiando, ella espera que le aprueben el crédito para comprar mas carne de pollo para la venta, su esposo se fue a trabajar lejos y viene cada 15 días y ella tiene que suplir los gastos para su familia e hijo espera que se le apoye con su negocio y seguir adelante.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de carne de pollo para la venta.
texts.en:
"DÚO SEMBRADORAS DE LAS MIES" [Sowers of Grain Duo]

Mayra Marina is one part of this duo. She explains that she has been selling butchered chicken in Zone 7 of the capital for nine years. She is married and her son is in school. 

She hopes that her loan for buying chicken to sell is approved. Her husband left to work far away and comes back every two weeks; she has to cover all the expenses for her family and son. 

She hopes that she gets support for her business and that she can carry on. She is requesting this loan to buy chicken meat to sell.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four sacks of compost.

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita para el negocio más mercadería, manteniéndolo fortalecido,  con la compra de pantalones, blusas, vestidos, entre otra variedad, esto le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad a los clientes.
Él considera que trabajar con préstamos le ha ayudado a mantenerse en el mercado, atender a mas clientes, permitiéndole generar más ingresos para su familia, en su casa está en proceso de construcción para mejorar algunas partes.
texts.en:
José has decided to take out a new loan because he needs more merchandise for the business in order to keep it stocked. He will buy pants, blouses, and dresses, among other things. This will help him to improve availability for his customers.

He thinks that working with loans has helped him to stay afloat in the market and attend to more customers, allowing him to generate more income for his family. At home, he is in the process of building in order to improve some parts of the home.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and dresses.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, necesita el apoyo de un nuevo préstamo para poder iniciar un nuevo cultivo, que este préstamo le dé el recurso económico para pagar el arrendamiento del terreno, asegurando ya el lugar donde efectuara la siembra de maíz y frijol.
El considera que trabajar con préstamos, le ayuda a la compra de insumos agrícolas, para que su producción agrícola sea mejor y abundante, con las ganancias ha podido ayudar a su familia y tener una mejor condición.
texts.en: José needs the support of another loan to be able to start sowing his next crop. The loan will pay the rent on the land ensuring that he has somewhere to sow corn and beans. He says that using the loans helps him to buy farming supplies which make his harvest better and more abundant. He has been able to help his family with the profits and has improved his life.

loans.use: to pay the rent of his land to be able to sow the new crop.

loans.name: Emelith

texts.es: Emelith con su negocio de venta de víveres, en el pasado acudió a un credikiva, el cual  invirtió en Kiva  productos de aseo personal y refrescos; con este crédito, su negocio  avanzó porque  incrmentó el número de clientes. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará  pimpinas de aceite, y ampliará su local comercial.Su sueño ahora es mantener su local comercial surtido de productos que aun no vende y que son parte de la demanda del mercado. Emelith está llena de mucho agradecimiento  con el crédito pues su negocio ha prosperado.
texts.en:
Emelith, with her business selling provisions, approached Kiva in the past and invested in personal care products and soft drinks. With this present loan, her business will advance because she will be able to increase the number of customers. Today Emelith is applying for a new Kiva loan to purchase large earhenware jars of cooking oil, and to expand her store's size.

Her dream, now, is to add to her store's selection of products items that she doesn't sell presently for which there is market demand. Emelith is filled with gratitud for these loans because her busness has prospered.

loans.use: to purchase large earthenware bottles of oil, and to expand her store.

loans.name: Reyna Del Rosario

texts.es: Reyna del Rosario vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; Ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, además para complementar los gastos de hogar también se dedica a crianza y venta de ganado  tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro  y ha ganado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el terreno donde cultiva es de alta incidencia agrícola y esta muy cercano a su vivienda muy accesible para trabajar, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque siempre posee lo que necesitan, con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Reyna es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y luchadora, todos los días se levanta dispuesta a lograr sus metas, se esfuerza al máximo pues sabe que así alcanzara el éxito que desea, en la ultima temporada no pudo obtener las ganancias esperadas por eso quiere recuperarse y realizar una nueva inversión para ello le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ganado, semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Reyna del Rosario tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, se siente satisfecha con la ayuda brindada por lo que asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
