Reyna del Rosario lives with her life partner and her children. She works in agriculture, specifically in the harvest of corn and beans. Also to compensate for the household expenses she has worked for many years in the breeding and sale of cattle. She has gained a lot of experience that has allowed her to gain a good income.

The land where she cultivates has a lot of agriculture and is very close to her housing, very accessible to work as she sells to all of the surrounding community. She already has a lot of clients that prefer her because she always has what they need, she has quality product, accessible prices, and most of all an excellent service. 

Reyna is a woman dedicated to her work, energetic and hardworking, every day she gets up determined to complete her goals. She maximizes her effort because she knows that this way she will gain the success that she desires.  
In the last season she was not able to earn the income she hoped and for this reason she wants to recuperate and realize a new investment. She is requesting a loan from Integral, to allow her to purchase cattle, corn seeds, beans, insecticide, herbicide, etc. 

Reyna del Rosario has good references of payment and high morals. She feels satisfied with the help provided as she is sure this will relieve her from debt and at the same time she has faith that will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, corn seeds, beans, insecticides, and herbicide

loans.name: Elsa Corona

texts.es:
La clienta Silvia vive en Libertad, tiene 38 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo ropa luego fue incrementando su negocio con maquillaje AVON, productos de belleza.  

El trabajo lo realiza sola, en todo el día y en caso de emergencia o necesidad le ayuda el esposo, le va muy bien con la ayuda de Dios. 

Está casada y su esposo le ayuda trabajando como chofer de un taxi, no tiene hijos, tanto ella como el esposo se ayudan para salir adelante en los gastos del hogar.

Con el préstamo la clienta quiere comprar maquillaje y ropa para asi incrementar su negocio y asi siga creciendo e invirtiendo en más mercadería para así poder obtener mayores ingresos y poder pagar los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 38, lives in Libertad.  She started her business selling clothes.  Then, she started increasing her business with Avon make-up and beauty products.

She works alone all day.  In case of emergency or when she needs help her husband helps her.  With God’s help it is going very well for her.  

She is married, and her husband helps her by working as a taxi driver. She does not have children. She and her husband help each other to get ahead with the household expenses.

She wants to use the loan to buy make-up and clothes.  This way she will increase her business.  She will continue growing and investing in more merchandise in order to be able to get more income and be able to pay for the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy make-up and clothes.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
La Sra. Juanita vive en Libertad, tiene 42 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio con una pequeña tienda y gracias a Dios está cada día creciendo en su negocio poco a poco. La tienda la comparte con su hija.
Juanita  empieza su negocio desde la mañana comprando legumbres frescas, para venderlas en su tienda. Este negocio lo realiza con su hijo todo el día.

Le teme a la delincuencia a pesar que en el barrio por donde vive la conocen, no está casada, está separada, tiene dos hijos; y dice que si ella llega a enfermarse sus hijos le ayudarían en las cosas de la tienda. 

Con el préstamo la Sra. Juanita quiere comprar viveres, legumbre, snack. Su sueño es que su tienda siga creciendo ya que es su única forma de subsistir ; además quiere también ponerse un Minimarket.
texts.en:
Sra. Juanita lives in Libertad and is 42 years of age. Her business started out as a small store and thanks to God it has grown a little bit each day. She manages the store with her daughter.

Juanita begins her work in the mornings by purchasing fresh legumes to sell in her store. Her child works in her business throughout the entire day. Despite the fear of crime, the neighborhood where she lives is well-known. Juanita is separated and has two children. She says that her children help around the store whenever she becomes ill.

With this loan, Sra. Juanita will buy food products, legumes, and snacks. Her dream is to continue expanding her store since it is the only form of income. In addition, she also wants to open a minimarket.

loans.use: to buy food products, legumes, and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil, tiene 60 años de edad. El cliente se ha dedicado al comercio desde hace un año, le ha gustado lo que hace por eso lo hace con amor, el tiene un negocio de venta de rosquillas. En está elaboración de rosquillas la realiza y lo hace en un triciclo. Sale todos los días a realizar la venta a barrios de su ciudad. 

Teme a su enfermedad llamada POLIOMILITIS (también llamada parálisis infantil, afecta principalmente al sistema nervioso. La enfermedad la produce el virus poliovirus, el poliovirus preferencialmente infecta y destruye las neuronas motoras. Esa destrucción de neuronas causa debilidad muscular y parálisis aguda flácida). Actualmente teme empeorar ya que ahora está es una enfermedad  por ahora produce una infección leve. 

Es un hombre casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a la venta de productos naturales OMNILIFE. 

Tiene hijos pero ya todos son mayores de edad, con este préstamo requiere en comprar harina para hacer mas rosquira y tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
This client lives in Guayaquil and is 60 years old.  He has engaged in the retail trade for one year.  This borrower enjoys his work because he does it with love.  He has a business of selling donuts.  After he produces the donuts, he sells them from a tricycle.  He works every day by making sales in the neighborhoods of his city.  

The borrower suffers from a disease called poliomyelitis (which is also called infantile paralysis) and it primarily affects the nervous system.  The disease is caused by the polio virus, which infects and destroys the motor neurons.  The destruction of the neurons causes muscle weakness and acute flaccid paralysis.  He is afraid that his condition will worsen since he now has a mild infection.  

The borrower is a married man and his wife devotes herself to the household chores.  She also sells Omnilife natural products.  They have children, but they are already grown.  With this loan, the borrower will buy flour for making donuts, which will result in more income.

loans.use: to buy flour for making donuts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil. El empezó su negocio desde hace 25 años en el mercado central, escogió esta actividad porque los padres fueron comerciantes.

Este trabajo lo realiza solo ya que la esposa se dedica al hogar y a sus hijos, vende artículos eléctricos, el cliente tiene una enfermedad en la pierna, desde hace 40 años y eso le dificulta su trabajo.

Esta enfermedad fue producida por una pelea callejera, tiene puesto un platino, es una persona que no tiene una estremidad. Está casado, tiene dos hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal.

Con este préstamo quiere comprar mercaderia de temporada. En el futuro requiere poder incrementar su negocio hasta el nivel que la esposa también tenga su puesto. Y así darles un bienestar propio a su familia, sobre todo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil. He started his business 25 years ago at the central market. He chose this line of work because his parents were merchants.

The borrower works alone since his wife devotes herself to taking care of their home and their children. He sells electronic goods. The borrower suffers from a disease that impacts his leg. He has had this condition for 40 years and it makes his work difficult. His disease was brought about as a result of a street fight. The borrower has a stand made of platinum since he lacks an extremity. He is married and has two children who attend a state school.

With this loan, the borrower will buy seasonal merchandise. In the future, he wants to expand his business to a level in which his wife can manage her own stand. He wants to provide for the welfare of his family, but most of all for his children.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Nanjidmaa

texts.en:
Nanjidmaa is 43 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in a small house in Orhon province, Mongolia. Her husband Erdene-Ochir, age 48, helps with her organic dairy products business. Her sons are Tsend-Ayush, age 21, who studies at a specialty training school; and Tsendbazar, age 18, who studies at the national engineering school. Her daughters Tserenlham, age 15, and Tsendmaa, age 11, study at local schools. 

Nanjidmaa has been running her organic dairy products sales business at a rental counter of the local market for 12 years. It is the only income source for the family and has barely covered their expenses over the years. She is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of organic dairy products to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking and positive person who says: "Our children are growing and they will soon start working and making money for the family and it will be a big support for the family."

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of organic dairy products to sell to local customers

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 28 years old and from Nakuru. He is married to Penninah and they have two children who are in school.

Nelson has a carpentry business which he has operated for the past five years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy timber and tools.

He hopes to buy a plot in Nakuru and build his house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy timber and modern tools.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
This is Herminia. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Herminia would like to apply for another loan, this time for 11,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Herminia hopes that her business gets bigger and dreams of having a good and happy family. She meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Benkola est constitué de 7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent  majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles à Méridièla, un des villages du cercle de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Afin de  renforcer leurs capacités financières pour de mieux faire leurs commerces, elles ont adhérés à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur septième  prêt. Les  précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments,  de tasses,  de vêtements, des tubercules et de la restauration.
Fatoumata  debout papier en main,  fait l’achat et la vente de condiments. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  3 sacs d’oignon séché et 2 paniers de Sounbala auprès de grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché de Méridièla, dans les foires des villages environnants  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkola group comprises seven married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have four children each.  These women mostly live in traditional families, in Méridièla, one of the villages of the Bougouni Cercle.  They know one another through neighborhood, friendship and professional ties.  In order to boost their financial capacity and to better run their businesses, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their seventh loan.  Their previous loans have been duly repaid.

The women of the Benkola group sell condiments, cups, clothes, tubers, and they also prepare meals.  Fatoumata, standing and holding a sheet of paper, buys and sells condiments.  She plans to use her loan to buy three bags of dry onions and two baskets of soumbala (a West African condiment) from wholesalers.  She sells her merchandise from home, at the Méridièla market and at other markets located in surrounding villages.  She sells for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

She is expecting to make average monthly profits of 42,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru:
Толибжон живет в сельской местности Дж Расуловского района. Ему 38 лет, женат имеет троих детей. Его жена  работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Толибжон является водителем такси. К сожалению  в свое время он не смог получить образование и теперь вынужден работать таксистом. Толибчон очень хорошо водит машину так как с раннего возраста научился водить. Также он занимается откормом скота. Днем он ухаживает за скотом а вечером подрабатывает таксистом. Толибжон конечно же очень устает, но он не падает духом и старается делать все чтобы его семья жила в достатке. В данное время у него возникли неисправности с авто.
 У Толибжона были накопленные денежные средства для ремонта своего автомобиля но ему пришлось оплатить учебу дочери. Чтобы купить запчасти для своего авто он обратился в организацию Арванд за кредитом. На полученный кредит Толибжон планирует купить необходимые запчасти для авто и устранить неисправности.
texts.en:
Tolibjon lives in the rural region of J. Rasulov District. He is 38 years old, married, and has three children. His wife works on a dekhan (mid-sized) farm. Tolibjon is a taxi driver. In his day, he was unfortunately unable to receive an education and now is forced to work as a taxi driver. 

Tolibjon drives cars very well because he learned how to drive from an young age. He also fattens up cattle. During the day he tends to his cattle and at night, he has a side job as a taxi driver. Of course, Tolibjon is very exhausted, but he keeps his chin up and strives to do all he can so that his family can live comfortably. Currently, several malfunctions have developed with his car. 

Tolibjon had savings for car repairs, but he had to pay for his daughter's education. In order to buy replacement parts for his car, he turned to Arvand for a loan. With the received loan, Tolibjon plans to buy essential replacement parts for his car and repair the malfunctions.

loans.use: to buy car parts.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino, tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposa de 39 años, tienen tres hijos de 17, 12, 4 años de edad, Marcelino se dedica a la ganadería y sus derivados, crianzo el ganado, tiene 25 años en esta actividad, trabajo que aprendió de su padre.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de tres semovientes, para el engorde, esta inversión le ayudara para incrementar el número de ganado y así a futuro tener más opciones de venta.  Su aspiración es que sus hijos estudien y se preparen profesionalmente.
texts.en: Marcelino is 41 years old. He lives with his 39 year-old wife and they have three children aged 17, 12 and 4. Marcelino works in cattle ranching and its derivatives, raising cattle. He has done this for 25 years; it's a job he learned from his father. He is applying for a loan to buy three livestock to fatten up. This investment will help him to increase the number of cattle and so have more chance to sell in the future. His hope is that his children study and prepare themselves professionally.

loans.use: to buy three livestock (cows)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil, tiene 38 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio hace aproximadamente 3 años, vendiendo a sus amistades ya que tenía que hacer de padre y madre para sus hijos ya que es viuda, pero con la ayuda de Dios se le abrieron puertas y pudo aumentar su negocio, le gusta lo que hace.

Este trabajo de venta de artículos de fomix y almohadas lo realiza sola todos los día y en cada momento.
La dificultad que tiene es su enfermedad que no la deja trabajar en una empresa pero  por ese motivo prefiere ser una persona independiente con su propio negocio.

Es una mujer viuda, tiene dos hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal, sus hijos (un niño y una niña) son su esfuerzo para seguir adelante (en la foto aparece con su hija quien le ayuda en el negocio). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar fomix y almohadas. Su sueño es seguir adelante junto a sus hijos, dejar algo para que sus hijos tengan lo que necesiten, y tener un local en su casa en el cual pueda exhibir sus productos y dar trabajo a personas que tienen la misma enfermedad que ella, para que puedan seguir adelante sobre todo con la ayuda de Dios.
texts.en:
This client lives in Guayaquil.  She’s 38-years-old.  She started her business about three years ago selling to friends because she had to be both father and mother to her children because she’s a widow.  However, with God’s help doors opened for her and she was able to increase her business; she enjoys what she does.  Her work is selling foam items and cushions; she works alone every day and all the time.  The difficulty she has is her illness that prevents her from working for a firm and this is why she prefers to be an independent person with a business of her own.  She’s a widow and has two children (one boy & one girl) attending public school.  Her children are the reason she strives to move forward. (Her is in the picture and helps her with the business)

She wants to use the loan to buy foam items and cushions.  Her dream is to continue moving ahead with her children and to leave something behind so her children can have what they need; she also would like to have a space at home where she can display her wares and employ others who have the same illness she has so that they can continue forward above all with God’s help.

loans.use: to buy foam articles and pillows.

loans.name: Handsuren

texts.en:
Handsuren is a 40 year old widow who lives with her 3 children in a Ger in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her elder son Byambasuren, age 19, runs buggy rides in town, while her younger son Bayanzul and her daughter Misheel study at a local school. 

Handsuren has been running her butcher shop business at a rental counter in the local market since 2006. She is now requesting 1,200,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of meat products from herders in the countryside to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, strong and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of meat products from herders in the countryside

loans.name: Rentsennatsag

texts.en:
Rentsennatsag is 47 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and granddaughter in a Ger in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife Erdenedeleg works as a painter in a furniture making company. His daughter Sainbuyan is a university student who has just given birth to baby girl but has not named her yet. 

Rentsennatsag has been working at a private local furniture manufacturing company and now he is starting his own business on his plot of land with his wife. He is requesting 1,600,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory and tools for his newly starting wooden furniture manufacturing business. He and his wife are both hardworking and honest people.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory and tools for his new business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
This time, for her 15th loan cycle, Juliana is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.  

Juliana’s business was previously funded through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. and its Kiva partner to continue to provide for Juliana and her family with increased income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, necesita invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda, por eso solicita un préstamo para poder comprar aceite, jabón, azúcar, arroz, entre otros productos que sean necesarios para ofrecer a los clientes.
Ella manifiesta que trabajar con préstamos, le ha fortalecido el negocio, mejora sus ganancias y mantiene a su familia con lo necesario, en sus condiciones familiares, comenta que sus deseos de incrementar siempre más el negocio, ya que esto le dará mayor estabilidad.
texts.en: Sonia needs to invest in buying merchandise for the shop. For this reason she is applying for a loan so she can buy oil, soap, sugar and rice, among other products that she needs to provide her customers with. She says that working with loans has strengthened the business, improves her profits and maintains her family with what they need at home. She mentions that her wish is to continually grow the business because this will give her greater stability.

loans.use: to buy oil, soap, sugar, rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Monhjargal

texts.en:
Monhjargal is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 2 sons in a Ger in Dornogobi province, Mongolia. Her husband Tuvdendorj, age 47, works at a construction site as an assistant worker. Her sons are Buyanmonh, age 21, who studies at a university; and Monh-Erdene, age 15, who studies at a local school. 

Monhjargal has been running her tailoring business in town since 2005. She is now producing organic felt products such as slippers, boots, rugs, etc. for local customers, and she is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory and wool-combing machinery for her organic products business. She is a hardworking, diligent and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and wool-combing machinery for her organic products business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 58 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Beatriz is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Beatriz has been buying and selling livestock for seven years and earns additional income from making native bags.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is a hard working mother who is engaged in selling AVON products in the community to supplement her husband's income. She is 51 years old and has three grown-up children. She aims to improve the business and uplift their status of living to give her family a better life. She plans to acquire more products to sell but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of body sprays, lotions, roll-on, lipsticks, face powders, colognes, toothpastes and underwear to sell. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve and strengthen the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of body sprays, lotions, roll-ons, lipsticks, face powders, colognes, toothpastes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 22 years old and married with one kid.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elisa has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Elisa has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 62 years old, married and has six children. 

Cecilia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Cecilia has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Cecilia has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana, vive con sus dos hijas una de 5 años y la otra de 6 meses de edad, quienes dependen de ella, Ana se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas, ella comenzó primeramente haciendo pitas de mescal, posteriormente aprendió la elaboración de hamacas, negocio del cual se mantiene.
Ella solicita el aporte de un préstamo para la compra de material para elaborar pitas o cabuyas, que se compra el mescal para elaborarlas, este dinero le servirá ya que no dispone de capital para poder expandirse con el producto.
Su aspiración es salir adelante con sus hijos, darles una mejor vida con el negocio.
texts.en: Ana lives with her two daughters, one 5 years old and the other 6 months old, who depend on her. Ana works making hammocks. She first started off making thread from the leaves of the mezcal (a type of agave plant). Then she learnt how to make hammocks, a business she supports herself with. She is applying for a loan to buy material to make thread or rope; she buys mezcal to make it. She will use this money as she has no capital to be able to expand her product. Her wish is to get ahead with her children, to give them a better life with her business.

loans.use: to buy material (mezcal) to make rope

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is 27 years old, married and a mother of five children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling fish in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 5,050. 

Mapenzi was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her second loan of KES 10,000 to buy additional fish stock for her business to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her business. 

Her goal for the future is to continue with her business, with the possibility of owning a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: to buy additional fish stock for her business.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Мархабо женщина очень старательная и пунктуальная, живет в сельской местности ДЖ. Расуловского района. Ей 48 лет, имеет троих детей. Двоих сыновей, и одну дочку. К великому сожалению муж Мархабо умер несколько лет тому назад и ей пришлось стать для детей, и отцом и матерью. Ее сыновья уехали на заработки в РТ и стараются по возможности присылать ей деньги.
  Мархабо занимается откармливанием крупно рогатого скота уже несколько лет. Она покупает молодых телят и откормив  продает их  мясникам.  Так как на нее возлагалась большая ответственность перед детьми, кроме откорма скота она пошла работать в дом инвалидов.  Там она работает в ночную смену.  Ее дочка помогает ей в откармливании скота. Мархабо очень тяжело без мужа, но она живет ради своих детей и не падает духом. Скоро ее сыновья вернутся с чужой страны   и  она женит их,для этого она копит денежные средства. 
 Мархабо решила получить кредит и купить скот для расширение своего бизнеса. Надеется,что ее поддержат в Арванде в финансовом вопросе
texts.en: Markhabo is a very diligent and punctual woman who lives in a rural section of J. Rasulov. She is 48 years old, and has three children — two sons and one daughter. Sadly Markhabo's husband died several years ago, and she has been forced to become both mother and father to her children. Her sons have gone to Russia for work, and they try to send her as much money as possible. For several years, Markhabo has been working raising and fattening cattle. She buys young calves, fattens them, and then sells them for meat. Since she no longer bears the heavy responsibility of looking after the children, she has gotten a second job working the night shift in a home for the disabled. Her daughter helps her with raising the cattle. Things are very difficult for Markhabo without her husband, but she lives for the sake of her children and doesn't lose heart. Soon her sons will come home from abroad and she will marry them off, and has saved up money for this. Markhabo has decided to take out a loan and buy a cow to expand her business. Hopefully she will receive financial support at Arvand.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has three children and has been doing this work for seven years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea. She will use the loan to buy more poultry.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Milking!' Her biggest challenge is 'feeding.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Seroy, chebaibai.'

Winny was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Grace period and good loan officers.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'that Juhudi Kilimo gives loans to smallholder farmers.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Winny replied 'It will  boost family income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Winny owns the following: cow, poultry and motorcycle, but does not own pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and running water but does not have electricity, solar power, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian, a 48-year-old married mother of two, works very hard to provide for them. She has run a general store in the Philippines for two years and is requesting a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as soap, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Vivian would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell such as soap, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Franklin Isaac

texts.es:
Franklin, se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, para seguir ampliando su taller, estos fondos los utilizara para la compra de un compresor y herramientas automotrices, que le permitan realizar las reparaciones a los vehículos, dando un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior Franklin logro mejorar sus ingresos, ya que realizo una buena inversión de la cual se ha visto beneficiado, se ha logrado estabilizar, sus hijos siguen estudiando y en su familia a tenido una condición estable.
texts.en:
Franklin decided to request a new loan to continue expanding his car repair workshop. He will use these funds to purchase a compressor and car tools, which will allow him to make repairs on vehicles and give his customers better service. 

With the previous loan Franklin succeeded in improving his revenue; since he made a good investment, he has managed to stabilize his business, his children continue to study, and his family conditions have been stable.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and car tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 60 years old and married with five children. Teodora works very hard to provide for them.

Teodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more stocks to sell.

Teodora has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Teodora would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
This is Ma. Luz.  She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to cover the maintenance costs of her computer shop.  Her earnings were a big help for expenses (business and personal) and for the education of her children.  She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for the same purpose.  Her profits will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of her children.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Luz hopes to have more computers and dreams of good health for her entire family.  She meets every week with her co-fellowship members in order to share stories of their lives and business.  She also draws strength from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en: Lucresia is a mat weaver from Ubay, Bohol. She has been in the mat weaving business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. Lucresia is asking for a loan to buy materials for making mats like romblon (a native plant), straw and dye. With this, she will be able to weave and create more mats, thus increasing her products to sell in the market. In the future, Lucresia hopes to increase her business, save money for the school expenses of her children and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for making mats like romblon, straw and dye

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 28 years old and married with two children who are seven and five years old. She sells new clothes in Kapsabet Town and has been in operation for a period of five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Peris is now servicing her second loan of KES 73,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to pay school fees for her children. 

The profits she earns will be used to pay the loan and reinvest in her clothing business.  Her dream is to provide all the basic needs for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita.  Her previous loan was a big help as she was able to buy all of the necessary products for her store.  She has been with this business for ten years.  At the age of 60, she still works hard to provide income for her everyday needs and to help her relatives.

Juanita would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy inventory, such as groceries, toiletries, and beverages.  More items displayed in the store results in a better opportunity for more profit.  Her business profits will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and to sustain her children’s educational expenses.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Juanita dreams to have her own house and land.  She also hopes that her business will grow bigger.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as groceries, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 42 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by farming peanut and corn in the Philippines.  Edna is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers, and farm equipment.  Edna has been farming peanut and corn for 2 years and has been earning additional income from raising pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and farm equipment.

loans.name: Hanah's Group

texts.en:
Hanah is a 33-year-old Iraqi woman. She is divorced and lives with her family. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Hanah is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has two years experience with the small, home-based sewing and tailoring business activity, which she would now like to improve. She would like to be able to offer a greater variety of creative options for her customers who order dresses and small fabric household items from her and to do so she would like to purchase an embroidery/pattern machine. To be able to buy the new machine, she took a small loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery/pattern machine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is now 39 years old. He is a businessman and he is still married to Mary. He has been in farming as a primary business for the past three years and started a bicycle transport with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family. 

Joseph is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy water pumps and pipes for irrigation. With the expected profit, he will venture into large scale farming. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land, educate his children and improve on the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy water pumps and pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Simakeni

texts.en:
Simakeni is a married, 51-year-old mother of 5 children.  For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling goat milk in Malindi.  She earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES.

Simakeni was introduced to KADET LTD, by our credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of 20,000 KES.  She will use this to buy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves, water cans, and medicine.  She will use the profits to pay for her children's school fees as well as to expand her farming activities.  Her future goal is to venture into mixed farming in order to increase her income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves, water cans, and medicine.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Being a responsible housewife, Gladys engages in selling snack foods in the local community to help her husband in generating income. She is 25 years old and was gifted with one child. 

She and her husband aim to improve their status of living in order to build their own house and to give their child a better life. In this regard, Gladys aims to strengthen the business and make it more profitable. She is asking for additional capital of PHP 25,000 to buy raw ingredients like bananas, fish balls, meat, chicken heads, milk, gulaman and coconut juice to be cooked and sold in their community. She believes that someday, she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like bananas, fish balls, meat, chicken heads, milk, gulaman  and coconut juice to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia. Her previous loan was a big help for her business. She was able to buy all the grocery items needed in her variety store. She also has a bakery and food stall for additional income. She is working hard to provide income for her family.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She will also use the money to buy ingredients for her bakery and food stall. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alicia dreams of giving her children a good life and a future. She hopes that her business will get bigger and stronger. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from CPG, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for almost five years now. This is the source of their income.
 
Mary Ann is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is 27 years old, married and a mother of four children. She sells clothes in Malindi for a living and she earns a monthly income of about KES. 10,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by a credit officer. She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more stock of clothes for sale. The anticipated profit she will use to improve the living standards of her family and pay school fees for her children. 

Mwenda intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day that she will come to own a well-established boutique in the area.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell
